title: Smith joins Washington Freedom ahead of MLC season
body:
Australia batter Steve Smith will play for Washington Freedom in the second season of Major League Cricket in the United States, the MLC team said on Thursday.

Smith, who has played just four Twenty20 internationals for Australia since the start of 2023, went unsold at the Indian Premier League auction held in December last year.

He competed for the Sydney Sixers in the 2023-24 Big Bash League (BBL).

The 34-year-old will be reunited with former team mate Ricky Ponting, who was appointed coach of Washington Freedom in February.

Last year, Smith was named brand ambassador to Washington Freedom, who have a high-performance partnership with New South Wales, his domestic team in Australia.

Washington Freedom finished third in the inaugural season of the six-team T20 tournament. The second edition of MLC is set to begin on July 4, following the conclusion of this year's T20 World Cup in the United States and West Indies.

title: Ricky Ponting on cusp of landing major coaching role amid genius cricket commentary
body:
Ricky Ponting has forged a reputation as one of the most astute minds in world cricket and now the Aussie legend could be taking that knowledge with him to the United States. The former Aussie captain has confirmed he is in talks to coach the Washington Freedom in America's Major League Cricket (MLC).

The United States launched its first major foray into the world of cricket with the introduction of the MLC in 2023 - a T20 competition comprised of six teams from a number of America's biggest cities. MI New York were crowned inaugural champions after defeating the Seattle Orcas in the championship final, with the majority of the matches played in front of sold-out stadiums in Texas and North Carolina.

OH NO: Will Pucovski ruled out of Sheffield Shield game amid fresh blow

BRUTAL: Michael Clarke mocked in savage moment at Aussie cricket awards

NOT GOOD: Ellyse Perry and Nathan Lyon dudded amid Mitch Marsh triumph

The US-based competition is part of the ICC's push for cricket's expansion into the lucrative North American market, and Ponting's inclusion would be a massive boon for both the MLC and the sport. The legendary former Australian captain is deciding whether he can commit to both the MLC and commentary duties for the T20 World Cup, which will be held in North America in June.

Ricky Ponting confirms talks with Washington Freedom

The second edition of MLC will begin just four days after the World Cup final is played in Barbados on June 30. "We're not there yet, I haven't committed to anything just yet, but I've had some initial discussions (with Washington)," Ponting told SEN radio on Thursday.

"The time of the year sort of fits in OK for me, but I've got a really hectic off-season again. When I say off-season, there's no such thing as an off-season for cricketers anymore."

Ponting is currently head coach of the Delhi Capitals in the Indian Premier League (IPL), the head of strategy for Hobart Hurricanes in the Big Bash League (BBL) and one of the chief commentators on the Seven Network's free-to-air cricket coverage in Australia. "It's potentially another big year of time away if I want it, so there are things I've got to work through," Ponting said. "If I'm actually going to be commentating the T20 World Cup or not and if I'm not doing that, where does MLC fit in?"

Ponting would be a tremendous addition to a Washington Freedom side that made it to the MLC eliminator final last year, with his knowledge of the game and tactical awareness among the best in the sport. Not to mention the commercial and public relations possibilities that come with having one of the game's greatest ever players attached to the competition.

India's influence in the fledgling US-based competition is evidenced by the fact three out of the six teams share part of their names with IPL franchises. Aussie states have also shown a willingness to form strategic partnerships with the US teams, with Cricket Victoria aligning itself with the San Francisco Unicorns and Queensland Cricket announcing a collaboration with the Seattle Orcas.

Cricket NSW also share a partnership with the Washington Freedom, with Greg Shipperd central to the relationship between the two parties. The Aussie coach led the Washington side in its inaugural season and recently took over as the NSW state coach, having managed the Sydney Sixers since 2015 in the BBL.

If Ponting is named as Shipperd's successor at Washington, he would become the latest big name in Aussie cricket to join the MLC. Aussie ODI World Cup winners Marcus Stoinis and Adam Zampa, as well as white-ball stars Matthew Wade and Aaron Finch were all part of the MLC's inaugural season.

Ricky Ponting's cricket brain continues to amaze

Washington would no doubt be hoping that Ponting could bring some of the cricketing genius that he continues to showcase in his commentary role for Seven. Ponting's commentary predictions have become legendary in recent years, with the 168-Test legend showing why he's regarded as the smartest man in cricket during Australia's Test series against the West Indies.

Ponting successfully called Alex Carey's downfall on day two of the Windies' historic Gabba Test win in Brisbane. It came as Usman Khawaja and Carey were left to try and rescue Australia's innings after a top order collapse against the underdogs. Khawaja and Carey combined for a 65-run partnership to steady the ship for Australia, but Ponting noticed Carey was starting to become frustrated with his own scoring rate.

"It looks like his eyes are spinning. He is in overdrive and wants to hit every ball," Ponting said. "I agree with you Bish (West Indies great Ian Bishop), just go a bit more defensive and make him play a big shot from a good length ball." As Ponting finished his tactical analysis, Shamar Joseph charged in and delivered a ball at Carey's chest.

Carey mistimed a pull shot and the ball went directly to the West Indies fielder. Once again Ponting had a premonition about a wicket after also displaying his clairvoyant powers 24 hours earlier. On that occasion, Ponting suggested the West Indies batting duo should rotate the strike at the end of day one or risk losing a late wicket.

That same over, Alzarri Joseph was dismissed on the final ball of the day after Kevin Sinclair had refused a single. The two examples were just the latest in a growing list of brilliant calls from Ponting, whose ability to predict what's about to happen in a cricket match is becoming legendary.

title: Major League Cricket Introduces Pitch Clock In Attempt To Reduce Average Game Time To Seven Days
body:
LONDON — Major League Cricket has announced that all future league games will use a pitch clock in order to reduce the average time of a match to around 168 hours.

"Aw, crumbs!" bellowed Albert Collins, bowler for the London WickerWhackers. "We shan't hardly have time for a proper match, shall we? All this bother over television rot goes against the spirit of the game! When are we going to have time for a mid-game cuppa with all this bustling about? Jolly shame!"

While other cricketers in the league have also expressed concerns over having to "rush the game," preliminary polls of the three or four people who actually watch cricket have shown that the change is quite popular.

"It makes it much easier to watch cricket now that I don't have to take two weeks' vacation every time I want to catch a game," said Robert Brown, avid fan of the New Delhi BumblyBowlers. "I have so much more time now to do other things, like eat and see my family. It was sorely needed."

At publishing time, the innovation had succeeded in bringing the length of MLC cricket matches down to a record 7 days, 4 hours, and 37 minutes.

title: Shakib Al Hasan Set to Create Another First in Major League Cricket
body:
Shakib Al Hasan has been part of many historic moments throughout his career. Currently, his team is in the United States for the World Cup, and Shakib has received some delightful news. The world-renowned all-rounder stands on the brink of another first: he is set to become the first Bangladeshi cricketer to debut in Major League Cricket (MLC).

For the second season of America's franchise T20 tournament, Major League Cricket, Shakib has signed with the Los Angeles Knight Riders. The franchise confirmed on Friday that they have directly signed Shakib. The second season of Major League Cricket will commence on July 4th, and ahead of this, Shakib inked his contract with the Los Angeles Knight Riders.

The team, owned by Shah Rukh Khan, has also signed notable players like Andre Russell, Sunil Narine, Jason Roy, Spencer Johnson, Unmukt Chand, Ali Khan, Saif Badar, Nitish Kumar, Shadley van Schalkwyk, and local cricketers Deron Davis, Matthew Tromp, Corné Dry, and Aditya Ganesh.

Bangladesh's star all-rounder will join these cricketers to light up the second season of Major League Cricket. Shakib has previously won the Indian Premier League (IPL) twice, in 2012 and 2014, with the Kolkata Knight Riders.

Shakib debuted in the IPL with Shah Rukh Khan's team in 2011. Over his IPL career, he has played 71 matches, scored 793 runs with two fifties, and taken 63 wickets. Now, Knight Riders fans are eagerly waiting to see how he performs in another franchise cricket league as a member of the same franchise.

The Los Angeles Knight Riders, Kolkata Knight Riders in the IPL, Trinbago Knight Riders in the Caribbean Premier League (CPL), and Abu Dhabi Knight Riders in the International League T20 (ILT20) are all teams under the same franchise.

title: Washington Freedom of Major League Cricket Announces Verizon as Team Sponsor for 2024 Season
body:
07/08/2024 - 09:00 AM

ROCKVILLE, Md.--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Major League Cricket’s Washington Freedom and Verizon are pleased to announce a partnership that will see the nation’s leading telecommunications company become a team sponsor for the upcoming 2024 Major League Cricket season beginning in early July. This partnership brings together two innovative organizations with shared values and a joint commitment to excellence, teamwork and community engagement.

Cricket is the second most watched sport in the world with an estimated 2.5 billion global fans and is rapidly expanding in the United States. The U.S. is hosting the ICC Men’s Twenty20 World Cup in partnership with the West Indies in June of 2024, and the 2028 Los Angeles Olympics will feature cricket for the first time since the 1900 Olympics.

The Washington Freedom play in Major League Cricket (MLC), a professional Twenty20 (T20) cricket league. MLC began play on July 13, 2023, with six teams representing major US cities. The inaugural season saw more than 70,000 fans in attendance throughout an 18-day tournament that was broadcast to 87 countries worldwide. The upcoming 2024 season is set to begin on July 5th, just a few days after the conclusion of the T20 World Cup.

"Verizon is a long-time leader in innovation and is one of the most recognized and respected brands in the world. We are thrilled to have Verizon as a sponsor for the Washington Freedom in the second season of Major League Cricket,” said Sanjay Govil, owner of the Washington Freedom. “We look forward to another successful campaign in the upcoming season, and we are excited to have Verizon as part of the team.”

“We’re excited to be on the ground floor of the growing cricket movement in the United States, and specifically in Washington, D.C., through our partnership with the Washington Freedom," said Chris Flood, Atlantic North Market President at Verizon. “We look forward to connecting with their dynamic and growing fan base, both on and off the cricket field, and we are incredibly proud to work with an organization that values innovation, teamwork and community engagement as much as we do."

Key highlights of the partnership include:

Branding Integration: Verizon’s logo will be featured on team helmets and caps, bringing visibility to a worldwide audience during games and events.

Year-Round Community Initiatives: The collaboration will extend beyond the field and cricket season, with joint participation in Washington, D.C.-based community events, cultural festivities, concerts, and programs.

About Washington Freedom

The Washington Freedom is a Major League Cricket team and the first professional cricket team to represent Washington, D.C. The team has partnered with Australia’s Cricket New South Wales, one of the world’s leading cricket entities. The team is owned by Sanjay Govil, an Indian-born American entrepreneur, who has a passionate belief in sport's ability to unite and inspire. Learn more at www.washingtonfreedom.com.

About Verizon Wireless

Verizon Communications Inc. (NYSE, Nasdaq: VZ) was formed in 2000 and is one of the world’s leading providers of technology and communications services. Headquartered in New York City and with a presence around the world, Verizon generated revenues of $134.0 billion in 2023. The company offers data, video and voice services and solutions on its award-winning networks and platforms, delivering on customers’ demand for mobility, reliable network connectivity, and security.

VERIZON’S ONLINE MEDIA CENTER: News releases, stories, media contacts and other resources are available at verizon.com/news. News releases are also available through an RSS feed. To subscribe, visit www.verizon.com/about/rss-feeds/.

View source version on businesswire.com: https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20240708473779/en/

Avikar Govil, Avikar.Govil@WashingtonFreedom.com

Sara Eljouzi, Sara.eljouzi@verizon.com

Source: Washington Freedom
summary: The Washington Freedom, a team in Major League Cricket (MLC), has partnered with Verizon as a team sponsor for the 2024 season. MLC is a professional Twenty20 (T20) cricket league that began play in July 2023 with six teams representing major US cities. The inaugural season saw over 70,000 fans in attendance and was broadcast to 87 countries worldwide. The 2024 season is set to begin on July 5th, just after the conclusion of the T20 World Cup. As part of the partnership, Verizon's logo will be featured on team helmets and caps, and the companies will participate in community events and initiatives throughout the year.

title: Los Angeles Knight Riders vs San Francisco Unicorns Preview & Prediction
body:
Click here for today’s sports betting tips from our expert analysts!

After finishing rock-bottom of the inaugural season of Major League Cricket in 2023, the Los Angeles Knight Riders began this season well with a victory but now come into this one on the back of back-to-back defeats. The San Francisco Unicorns have picked up one win with one defeat in their opening two matches ahead of this clash in North Carolina.

DATE & TIME: Saturday 13th July, 2024 - USA ET – 3:00pm / USA PT – 12:00pm / West Indies – 2:00pm / UK – 8:00pm / South Africa – 9:00pm / Sunday 14th July, 2024 - Pakistan – 12:00am / India – 12:30am / Bangladesh – 1:00am / Australia – 5:00am

VENUE: Church Street Park, Morrisville, North Carolina, United States

WEATHER: 32c o 89.6 F with rain forecast at the start of the match

HOW TO WATCH ON TV: USA – Willow TV / West Indies – TBA / UK – TNT Sports / South Africa – ESPN / Pakistan – A Sports / India – TBA / Bangladesh – TBA / Australia – N/A

HOW TO WATCH ONLINE: USA – Willow TV / West Indies – TBA / UK – TNT Sports app / South Africa – ESPN+ app / Pakistan – A Sports / India – TBA / Bangladesh – TBA / Australia – Amazon Prime Video

LOS ANGELES KNIGHT RIDERS FORM: THE SHODDY LAKR

The Los Angeles Knight Riders began the 2024 Major League Cricket season with an impressive defence of what seemed to be a fairly small total when the Texas Super Kings fell 12 runs short of LAKR’s 162-7. Since then, though, they could not defend 165-6 against the San Francisco Unicorns and then also suffered a nine-wicket thumping to last season’s runners’ up, the Seattle Orcas.

LAST THREE: LLWWL

SAN FRANCISCO UNICORNS FORM: BOUNCING BACK

The San Francisco Unicorns began their season with that aforementioned victory over LAKR in Dallas. Finn Allen led the way with 63 runs from 37 balls as they reached 166-4 in just 15.2 overs last week. In their second match of the tournament, they were skittled for just 127 by an experienced Texas Super Kings side before giving up the target in just 12.5 overs.

LAST THREE: LWLLW

LOS ANGELES KNIGHT RIDERS BETTING ANALYSIS

Even in victory, the Los Angeles Knight Riders simply haven’t scored enough runs. 162 shouldn’t have been enough to beat TSK and the two targets they have set since have been well below par. What did happen in their second game, though, was South African David Miller coming to the party with an unbeaten 44 at a strike rate of 200 and the thrilling middle-order bat is likely to be their top scorer if their misfiring top order get out early enough.

With the ball, they have a fair bit of variation with the likes of Ali Khan, Andre Russell, Shakib Al Hasan and Sunil Narine. However, they are heavily reliant on Aussie quick Spencer Johnson for wickets. The Unicorns go hard and should lose wickets so Johnson to take two or more poles would appear a good bet for that reason.

SAN FRANCISCO UNICORNS BETTING ANALYSIS

With a top order that consists of the aforementioned Finn Allen as well as Jake Fraser-McGurk, Matt Short and Josh Inglis; the San Francisco Unicorns have the potential to do exactly what they have shown in their opening two matches; collapse in a heap or go hard and get a big score in no time. Short is the man in the best nick at the moment so him to score 30+ at another decent strike rate would be a worthy shout.

In the bowling department, the Unicorns have the experience of former England international Liam Plunkett but beyond that they are perhaps a bit blunt for the shortest format of the game with the consistently flattering to deceive Haris Rauf and more suited to Test match bowling of Abrar Ahmed. Plunkett remains their best chance of wickets outside of the powerplay so Plunkett to be their top bowler remains the best bet for this.

LOS ANGELES KNIGHT RIDERS VS SAN FRANCISCO UNICORNS EXPERT PREDICTION

This is a confusing one to predict a winner in because of the strengths and weakness of both sides. LAKR have the edge with the ball, whilst the Unicorns are certainly the more modern day and aggressive of the two sides with the bat. That said, if the top four of San Francisco, albeit Inglis dropped to five against TSK, can fire then they can easily overwhelm any team in the competition – and LAKR’s best bet, of experience with the ball, is still relatively weak. As a result, the Unicorns will be confident of doing the double over their opposition.
summary:
**Match Details**

* Date: Saturday, July 13, 2024 (with varying start times depending on the region)
* Venue: Church Street Park, Morrisville, North Carolina, United States
* Teams: Los Angeles Knight Riders vs San Francisco Unicorns

**Team Forms**

* Los Angeles Knight Riders: Began the season with a win, but lost their next two matches, including a 9-wicket defeat to the Seattle Orcas. Their last three matches are LLWWL.
* San Francisco Unicorns: Won their first match against Los Angeles Knight Riders, but lost their second match to the Texas Super Kings. Their last three matches are LWLLW.

**Key Players**

* Los Angeles Knight Riders: David Miller, Ali Khan, Andre Russell, Shakib Al Hasan, Sunil Narine, and Spencer Johnson
* San Francisco Unicorns: Finn Allen, Jake Fraser-McGurk, Matt Short, Josh Inglis, and Liam Plunkett

**Prediction**

* The match is difficult to predict due to the strengths and weaknesses of both teams. The San Francisco Unicorns are more aggressive with the bat, while the Los Angeles Knight Riders have an edge with the ball. The Unicorns are confident of doing the double over their opposition if their top four batsmen can fire.

title: Major League Cricket 2024 Match 8: Washington Freedom beat Seattle Orcas by 5 wickets
body:
Washington Freedom beat Seattle Orcas by 5 wickets, in Match 8 of the Major League Cricket 2024, at Grand Prairie Stadium, Texas today.

Match Summary

Seattle Orcas vs Washington Freedom, Match 8

Seattle Orcas 124/10 (19.4 ov)

Washington Freedom 127/5 (18.2 ov)

Result - Washington Freedom won by 5 wickets

SCORECARD

Manhattan

Match Analysis

Washington Freedom edged out Seattle Orcas by five wickets in a tense low-scoring match of the 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas on Thursday.

Lockie Ferguson (4/26) and Saurabh Netravalkar (3/18) shared seven wickets to bundle out Seattle Orcas to 124 in 19.4 overs. Lahiru Milantha (33 off 30) and Obus Pienaar (25 off 28) then anchored a crucial unbeaten 63-run partnership to guide Washington Freedom past their 125-run target with 10 balls to spare.

With this win, Washington Freedom moved to the top of the points table with 5 points from three matches, remaining the only unbeaten team in the tournament thus far.

The Seattle Orcas came out firing to defend a low total of 125 runs. Imad Wasim removed the dangerous Travis Head for a duck on the second ball of the innings, ending the over with a wicket maiden. Steve Smith and Rachin Ravindra then looked to rebuild with the counter-attack. They scored as many as 18 runs in the third over. Ravindra looked dangerous with the bat, but Nandre Burger dismissed him in the fifth over for 26 off 16 balls, which included three boundaries and two sixes. Smith (12 off 13) followed him back to the pavilion in the following over, leaving the Orcas at 47/3 after six overs.

Both Mukhtar Ahmed and Glenn Maxwell were given lifelines with dropped catches but couldn't capitalise on them. Ahmed (8 off 8) was dismissed by Burger in the eighth over, and Maxwell (10 off 11) fell to Harmeet, leaving their team struggling at 68/5 after 10 overs.

Despite the dire situation, Washington Freedom batters Lahiru Milantha and Obus Pienaar showed resilience as they cautiously approached the target. They helped Washington reach the 100-run mark in the 16th over, reducing the equation to 23 runs needed off 24 balls. Milantha (33* off 30) and Pienaar (31* off 30) constructed a match-winning partnership to help their side get past the winning line.

Earlier in the contest, the Seattle Orcas had a shaky start to their innings. Nauman Anwar was dismissed cheaply for 3 off 9 balls by Saurabh Netravalkar in the second over. The Seattle batters struggled to accelerate on the slow batting track, managing only 35 runs in the Powerplay. Ryan Rickelton also fell for 4 off 11 balls to Lockie Ferguson in the sixth over.

Quinton de Kock (24 off 19) failed to build on his start and was bowled by Ferguson in the eighth over, with Seattle struggling at 44/3 after eight overs.

Heinrich Klaasen and Shubham Ranjane carefully constructed a crucial partnership that steadied Seattle's innings. However, Ranjane (12 off 17) was unfortunately run out on the first ball of the 14th over. Klaasen, batting as if on a different surface, completed his fifty in just 29 balls but was immediately caught by Mukhtar Ahmed at long-off off Marco Jansen in the 15th over. His crucial innings, which included four fours and three sixes, helped Seattle cross the 100-run mark in the 15th over.

Meanwhile, the Washington bowlers didn't allow the following batters to score big. Ferguson took two wickets in the 17th over, finishing his spell with four wickets. He removed Imad Wasim (4 off 6) and Hammad Azam (4 off 9) in his last over. Netravalkar then dismissed Harmeet Singh (2 off 3) in the following over, leaving Seattle struggling at 112/8 after 18 overs.

Seattle managed to get nine runs in the penultimate over as Cameron Gannon (8 off 5) attempted to hit the ball as hard as possible. He struck a maximum, but was dismissed on his second attempt, as he got caught by Ferguson at long-off off Ian Holland's bowling. Netravalkar then removed Nandre Burger (3 off 6), thus bowling out the Orcas for 124 in 19.4 overs.

Match Stats

Seattle Orcas Fall of wickets: 1-6 (Nauman Anwar - 1.6 ov), 2-34 (Ryan Rickelton - 5.5 ov), 3-44 (Quinton de Kock - 7.5 ov), 4-81 (Shubham Ranjane - 13.1 ov), 5-102 (Heinrich Klaasen - 14.3 ov), 6-107 (Imad Wasim - 16.2 ov), 7-110 (Hammad Azam - 16.6 ov), 8-112 (Harmeet Singh - 17.3 ov), 9-120 (Cameron Gannon - 18.5 ov), 10-124 (Nandre Burger - 19.4 ov)

title: Seattle Orcas vs Washington Freedom Highlights: Washington beat Seattle by 5 wickets
body:
Right then, that will be it from us for this contest. We hope you enjoyed the coverage. The action continues at the Major League Cricket, 2024. The next match of the competition will see the Texas Super Kings locking horns with the MI New York at Church Street Park in Morrisville. That game will be played on July 13th and will start at 12.30 am IST (7.00 pm GMT, the previous day). But as you know, you can always join early for all the build-up. Until then, take care, and cheers!

Steve Smith, the Washington Freedom skipper, says that it was a hard-fought game. Adds that the top order did not great start but Lahiru Milantha and Obus Pienaar played smart cricket and got the job done. Shares that it was a slow and low wicket and all the bowlers did a good job. Mentions that they had a few hiccups with the bat but glad to be on the winning front. Reckons that the wicket got a tad slow so it was important to cash on the powerplay and would have been easy if someone from the top order had made a 50-60 but he's happy that the middle and lower order got their chance and they came out victorious.

The losing skipper of Seattle Orcas, Heinrich Klaasen says they lost the game in the last four overs with the bat as they couldn't add a lot to the total and left with a below-par score. Adds that they are lacking that one guy in the last few overs who could give them the perfect balance with both bat and ball to finish things well. Mentions that they needed to pick up wickets early on and they did that as well but they were good 15-20 runs shot at the end with the bat. Closes by saying the pitch was good and had they been at 140-145 by the end of their innings, the result could have been different.

Lockie Ferguson is the Player of the Match for his stellar spell. He says that it’s a good start to the campaign and nice to get in full 40 overs. Adds that as a group, it’s been great. Mentions that he tried bowling in good areas and it worked well for them. Ends by sharing that Heinrich Klaasen was looking dangerous and he's that they got his wicket.

Rachin Ravindra is up for a chat. He says it wasn't easy in the middle to bat but it was easier to bat while the ball was new. Adds that Imad Wasim bowled a maiden first up but him being a left-hander was a match-up for him and the support staff backed him for taking it on and it worked for him. Mentions that they look to stick to their plans and today despite the fall of wickets they kept playing their brand of cricket and eventually won.

Earlier today, Seattle Orcas were asked to bat first and they made a below-par score of 124 with only Heinrich Klaasen making an attacking fifty while the rest of the batting struggled. Lockie Ferguson and Saurabh Netravalkar accounted for seven wickets between them and broke the back of Seattle Orcas' batting. Seattle Orcas are stranded at the bottom of the table while Washington Freedom moves to the top position. It's still early days in the season but teams will want to make winning a habit.

Seattle Orcas did not have a huge score to defend but they started well by picking an early wicket. They gave away a few freebies through the powerplay but came back strong to put a dent in the Washington Freedom batting. Nandre Burger was the pick of the bowlers taking 2 for 26 while Harmeet Singh, Imad Wasim, and Cameron Gannon chipped in with one apiece and kept it tight. Seattle Orcas have suffered their second loss of the season and will want to turnaround their campaign quickly.

A hard-fought run chase from the Washington Freedom takes them to the top of the table and they are unbeaten in the season so far. Chasing a tricky score of 125 for the win, the Freedom lost Travis Head for a duck but Smith and Ravindra stuck a few boundaries and got their side to a decent start in the powerplay. The Seattle Orcas came back strongly and reduced the Freedom to 64 for 5 with all their big guns back in the hut. Lahiru Milantha and Obus Pienaar joined hands and added an unbeaten 63-run stand to steer their side home. Lahiru Milantha made a steady 33 off 30 while Obus Pienaar chipped in with 31 crucial runs. Washington Freedom are the only unbeaten side in the tournament so far and will hope to keep it going.

Strategic Break! Washington Freedom needs 32 off the final five overs. They are ahead in the game but the Seattle Orcas are giving it a real fight. A couple of wickets here would tilt the tide in favor of the Orcas. Washington Freedom will hope for Lahiru Milantha and Obus Pienaar to carry on and take their side home to get two more points on the board.
summary: The Washington Freedom cricket team has won their match against the Seattle Orcas, moving them to the top position in the tournament standings. The Freedom chasing a score of 125, made a hard-fought run to win the game with Lahiru Milantha and Obus Pienaar adding an unbeaten 63-run stand to steer their side home. Lockie Ferguson was named the Player of the Match for his stellar spell. The Seattle Orcas, on the other hand, are stranded at the bottom of the table, having suffered their second loss of the season. The next match of the competition will see the Texas Super Kings taking on the MI New York at Church Street Park in Morrisville on July 13th.

title: MLC 2024 Match 7, SFU vs TEX | Playing 11 Prediction, Cricket Tips, Preview, Live Streaming
body:
Faf du Plessis in action for Texas Super Kings during MLC 2024 (X.com)

For the seventh fixture of the Major League Cricket 2024 season, San Francisco Unicorns will be pitted against Texas Super Kings on July 11, 12.00 AM IST at Church Street Park in Morrisville.

While Texas is yet to taste victory, the Unicorns kicked off the tournament on the right note.

SFU vs TEX: Team Previews

San Francisco Unicorns

San Francisco Unicorns' tournament-opening game against the Los Angeles Knight Riders in Dallas turned out to be a dominant outing for the former. They bowled well to restrict LAKR to 165 runs total before Finn Allen went ballistic in the chase.

He scored 63 off 27 deliveries to ensure the Unicorns are off to a flyer start. Moreover, Matthew Short's fiery contribution of 58 (26) steered Unicorns to a successful run chase with four overs left.

Overall, it was a complete performance from both the departments and hence ahead of the upcoming game against Texas, the Unicorns will count themselves as favourites.

Texas Super Kings

On the other hand, Texas Super Kings are struggling to find their footing into the MLC 2024 edition. After losing a close game to LAKR in the tournament opener, Texas were saved by rain gods in the following game against Washington Freedom.

Skipper Faf du Plessis' century resulted in 203 runs in the first innings total for Texas, and it appeared good enough until Travis Head and Steve Smith unleashed carnage in the powerplay.

Head's 32 (12) and Smith's 26 (13) blistering knocks steered Washington to 64 runs on board in just the first four overs before rain interrupted play. Due to a weak drainage system, the game couldn't resume and both teams were awarded a point each.

However, it's safe to say, had the game resumed, Washington would have walked all over Texas in no time. Hence, the Super Kings will remain under a lot of pressure against the Unicorns.

SFU vs TEX: Church Street Park Pitch Report

The pitch at Church Street Park generally provides a fair contest between bat and ball. However, this MLC 2024 season, the surface has favoured the batters to a larger extent. The powerplay period will be crucial for both sides and with the looming threat of rain, chasing is a good option.

Seattle Orcas

The Seattle Orcas have had a mixed start to their campaign, having won and lost a game each so far.

In the previous fixture against Los Angeles Knight Riders, Ryan Rickelton stole the show with a gritty 66-ball century that helped his team wrap up the 169-run chase on the penultimate delivery of the game.

Washington Freedom

Chasing 155 runs against MI New York, Steve Smith stamped his authority with 46 off 28 runs knock, and before rain halted the game, Washington had 55 runs on board at the loss of one wicket. They were four runs ahead as per DLS calculations and were awarded two points for the game.

Washington Freedom have potentially the most fierce and balanced unit at their helm this tournament. Travis Head and Smith are in the form of their lives whereas Glenn Maxwell, Marco Jansen and Saurabh Netravalkar have also raised the standards.

title: [Watch] Steve Smith Records A Poor Outing In MLC 2024 As Cameron Gannon Castles Him
body:
Steve Smith was bowled by Gannon [X]

In a gripping encounter at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas, Washington Freedom opted to bowl after winning the toss against Seattle Orcas in the Major League Cricket 2024.

Their decision proved decisive as they restricted Orcas to 124 runs, paving the way for a successful chase.

Right-arm pacer Lockie Ferguson starred with the ball, scalping four crucial wickets, supported by Netravalkar, who took three wickets.

Despite a shaky start in their chase, Washington Freedom found stability through valuable contributions from Rachin Ravindra (26 runs), Lahiru Milantha (33* runs), and Obus Pienaar (31* runs).

Watch: Cameron Gannon Dismisses Steve Smith

However, the moment of the match belonged to Seattle Orcas' Cameron Gannon, who bowled a memorable delivery to dismiss Washington's skipper Steve Smith.

In the 6th over, Gannon's delivery angled in towards off, catching Smith off guard as he attempted a forceful shot through the off-side.

The ball evaded Smith's bat, clipping the off bail and sending it flying. Smith departed for a quick 12 runs off 13 balls, leaving Freedom momentarily stunned.

Looking ahead, Seattle Orcas will square off against San Francisco Unicorns on July 15, while Washington Freedom prepares to face Los Angeles Knight Riders on July 14 in upcoming Major League Cricket fixtures.
summary:
* The article reports on a match between Washington Freedom and Seattle Orcas in the Major League Cricket 2024 tournament.
* Washington Freedom won the toss and chose to bowl, restricting Seattle Orcas to 124 runs.
* Lockie Ferguson was the star performer with the ball, taking 4 wickets, while Netravalkar took 3 wickets.
* Despite a shaky start, Washington Freedom successfully chased down the target thanks to contributions from Rachin Ravindra, Lahiru Milantha, and Obus Pienaar.
* The match saw a memorable moment when Seattle Orcas' Cameron Gannon bowled Washington Freedom's skipper Steve Smith for 12 runs off 13 balls.
* Upcoming fixtures in the tournament include Seattle Orcas vs. San Francisco Unicorns on July 15, and Washington Freedom vs. Los Angeles Knight Riders on July 14.

title: SEA vs WAS Dream11 Prediction, Dream11 Playing XI, Today Match 8, MLC 2024
body:
Dream11 fantasy cricket tips and guide for 8th match of MLC 2024 to be played between SEA vs WAS in Dallas.

Match No. 8 of the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 will be played between Seattle Orcas and Washington Freedom. This match will take place at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Thursday. These two teams have played two matches each and have one win each to their name.

The Orcas are fifth on the points table with two points, while the Freedom have three points, and they are sitting at top two. It is the start of the new season, so a good lead at the start can help the team in the later half. So these two points are very vital.

SEA vs WAS: Match Details

Match: Seattle Orcas (SEA) vs Washington Freedom (WAS), Match 8, MLC 2024

Match Date: July 11, 2024 (Thursday)

Time: 06:00 A.M. IST (Friday) / 12:30 AM GMT (Jul 12) / 07:30 PM LOCAL

Venue: Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas

SEA vs WAS: Head-to-Head: SEA (1) – WAS (0)

These two teams have played one game so far in the Major League Cricket and Seattle Orcas won that game by five wickets.

SEA vs WAS: Weather Report

The weather will be very clear on Thursday with temperature around 33° C. There is no sign of rain, and the humidity will be around 40 percent, whereas the wind speed will be around 14 km/h.

SEA vs WAS: Pitch Report

The pitch in Dallas offers a good batting track for the batters. It has a good bounce and a fast outfield. The shorter boundaries add pressure to the bowlers. One can fancy chasing any score at this venue.

SEA vs WAS: Predicted XIs:

Seattle Orcas: Quinton de Kock (wk), Ryan Rickelton, Heinrich Klaasen (c), Shubham Ranjane, Nauman Anwar, Imad Wasim, Hammad Azam, Harmeet Singh, Nandre Burger, Zaman Khan, Cameron Gannon

Suggested Dream11 Fantasy Team No. 2 SEA vs WAS Dream11:

All-rounders: Glenn Maxwell, M Bracewell, Imad Wasim, Marco Jansen

Captain First-Choice: Quinton de Kock || Captain Second-Choice: M Bracewell

Vice-captain First-Choice: Steve Smith || Vice-captain Second-Choice: Marco Jansen

SEA vs WAS: Dream11 Prediction – Who Will Win?

Washington Freedom have done a pretty decent job so far and have not lost a game, while Seattle Orcas are coming off a big defeat. Hence, we will go by the momentum and back Washington Freedom to win this game.

title: LAS vs SF Match Prediction – Who will win today’s MLC match between Los Angeles vs San Francisco?
body:
Preview

Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAS) will lock horns with San Francisco Unicorns (SF) in Match 10 of the Major League Cricket 2024, at Church Street Park, in Morrisville, on Sunday, July 14.

Knight Riders currently find themselves in fourth position with just one win in three games. After winning their opening game over Texas Super Kings, the Sunil Narine-led side is on a two-match losing streak, suffering defeats against Unicorns and Seattle Orcas, respectively.

On the other hand, Corey Anderson-led side is just below Knight Riders and holds the fifth position in the points table. The side started their campaign on a high note, registering a six-wicket win over the same opponents. But in their previous game against Super Kings, the San Francisco-based franchise faced a batting collapse which eventually resulted in them ending on the losing side.

Match Details

Pitch Report

The surface at Morrisville appears to be consistent, maintaining its characteristics for the full 20-over game. However, a notable issue is the decreasing strike rate of batters in the second innings, as the ball loses pace off the surface. This allows bowlers to exploit the inconsistent bounce, suggesting teams should set moderate, achievable targets rather than aiming for exceptionally high scores. However, the team that wins the toss will look to bowl first.

Jason Roy could be the best batter in the upcoming match against the San Francisco-based franchise. The English opener who is not a regular member of the Three Lions has been featuring in most of the franchise-based leagues all around the world. For San Francisco, Roy has been exceptional with his bat and has scored 97 runs in three innings. With his form, he can trouble the opposition bowlers and take his team to a comfortable position single-handedly.

Probable Best Bowler of the match:

Spencer Johnson could be the best bowler in the forthcoming game. The left-arm pacer has been among the wickets since the first game and is currently the second-highest wicket-taker with six wickets under his name. With the pitch favouring more to the bowlers, Johnson will be a key player.

title: [Watch] 6, 4, 6 - CSK's IPL Star Rachin Ravindra Thrashes Imad Wasim In MLC 2024
body:
Ravindra took on Imad in MLC 2024 [X]

In a staggering display of power-hitting, Chennai Super Kings (CSK) star Rachin Ravindra took on Pakistan’s seasoned spinner Imad Wasim, scoring 17 runs in a single over during the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 game between Washington Freedom and Seattle Orcas.

Seattle Orcas were bowled out for 124 runs by Washington Freedom while batting first in the eighth fixture of the MLC 2024 edition. Saurabh Netravalkar and Lockie Ferguson starred with seven wickets combined.

Meanwhile, in the chase, Washington Freedom received a big blow in the form of Travis Head. The explosive opener was sent packing on a duck in the first over by Imad Wasim.

However, the next batter on the crease, Rachin Ravindra, wasn’t impacted by the early blow, as he unleashed an onslaught over Imad to fetch a massive 18-run over in the powerplay.

Watch- Ravindra hammers Imad Wasim in MLC 2024

For the third over, Imad Wasim returned to the attack to further dismantle the Freedom. However, Ravindra foiled his plans with a 77-metre six on the very first delivery.

Wasim was under the pump and ended up bowling a quicker delivery next. However, the spinner got the line wrong and offered too much width for the Kiwi batter to stay in the crease and slash a boundary through the square in the off-side.
summary:
* The article reports on a game between Washington Freedom and Seattle Orcas in the 8th fixture of MLC 2024.
* Seattle Orcas were bowled out for 124 runs by Washington Freedom, with Saurabh Netravalkar and Lockie Ferguson taking 7 wickets combined.
* In the chase, Washington Freedom's Travis Head was dismissed for a duck in the first over by Imad Wasim.
* However, Rachin Ravindra, the next batter, hit 17 runs in a single over against Imad Wasim, including a 77-metre six and a boundary through the square in the off-side.

title: [Watch] Glenn Maxwell's Struggle Continues; Provides Catching Practice To Heinrich Klaasen
body:
Glenn Maxwell falls for 10 (11) vs SEO [x.com]

Glenn Maxwell's poor form continues as he falls for 10(11) against the Seattle Orcas in match 8 of Major League Cricket season 2 between Seattle Orcas and Washington Freedom in Dallas.

During a 125-run chase after winning the toss and bowling first, Washington Freedom found themselves in a spot of bother after a few quick wickets in the middle. They found themselves 43/3 when Glenn Maxwell came to bat on the final ball of the powerplay.

After losing another wicket at 53, Maxwell tried to consolidate and take Freedom through. However, when Harmeet Singh came in to bowl the 10th over, he tried to take on the left-arm spinner by giving himself room and hitting one over the covers for a six.

The incident occurred at 9.1 when Harmeet came in to bowl his 2nd over and pitched a full delivery on the middle-off line where the Australian batter tried to give himself room and mishit the ball which went straight up in the air and Orcas skipper, Heinrich Klaasen who was fielding in the point region made no mistake in back-tracking and catching it.

Watch: Maxwell cheap dismissal off Harmeet Singh

With Maxwell's wicket, the Washington-based franchise was reduced to 64/5 with 61 required from 65. However, Sri Lanka-born wicketkeeper, Lahiru Milantha, and all-rounder Obus Pienaar took it upon themselves to win WF the match by 5 wickets with 8 balls to spare.
summary:
**Match Details:** Match 8 of Major League Cricket season 2 between Seattle Orcas and Washington Freedom in Dallas.

**Key Moment:** Glenn Maxwell, playing for Washington Freedom, was dismissed for 10 (11) by Harmeet Singh of Seattle Orcas, which reduced Freedom to 64/5 while chasing a target of 125.

**Turning Point:** Despite the setback, Washington Freedom's Lahiru Milantha and Obus Pienaar guided their team to a 5-wicket victory with 8 balls to spare.

title: [Watch] Quinton de Kock Replicates Yuvraj Singh's Signature Flick Shot In MLC 2024
body:
Quinton de Kock' audacious six off Marco Jansen [X.com]

Quinton de Kock demonstrated his prowess during the 8th match of the ongoing Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 match between Seattle Orcas and Washington Freedom at Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas on July 11.

The South African wicket-keeper batter, representing the Orcas, delivered a remarkable performance against pacer Marco Jansen.

In the fourth over of the Seattle Orcas' innings, de Kock, who eventually scored 24 runs off 19 balls, executed a stunning six off Jansen, evoking memories of India's legend Yuvraj Singh.

The delivery, full and angled at the pads, was expertly flicked by Quinton de Kock over the deep midwicket fielder, marking the first maximum of the day.

Watch - Quinton de Kock smashed Marco Jansen for a six

Despite de Kock's efforts, Seattle Orcas were bowled out for a modest total of 124. Washington Freedom, led by Steve Smith, chased down the target with ease, winning by five wickets.

Looking ahead, Heinrich Klaasen's Seattle Orcas will now face against San Francisco Unicorns on July 15, while Washingston Freedom will square off against Los Angeles Knight Riders on July 14.
summary:
**Match Details**: The 8th match of MLC 2024 was played between Seattle Orcas and Washington Freedom at Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas on July 11.

**Notable Performance**: Quinton de Kock, representing Seattle Orcas, scored 24 runs off 19 balls and hit a stunning six off Marco Jansen, reminiscent of Yuvraj Singh's style.

**Match Result**: Despite de Kock's efforts, Seattle Orcas were bowled out for 124. Washington Freedom, led by Steve Smith, chased down the target with ease, winning by five wickets.

**Upcoming Matches**: Seattle Orcas will face San Francisco Unicorns on July 15, while Washington Freedom will play against Los Angeles Knight Riders on July 14.

title: SEO vs WTF Match Prediction Who Will Win Today’s Match 8 Major League Cricket 2024
body:
The Match 8 of the Major League Cricket 2024 will see the clash between Seattle Orcas and Washington Freedom at the Grand Prairie Stadium, Texas on Friday, 12 July 2024. Keep reading to find out the SEO vs WTF Match Prediction Match 8 Major League Cricket 2024.

Match Preview

In Match 6 of Major League Cricket, the Los Angeles Knight Riders batted first and set a competitive total of 168/5 in their allotted 20 overs. However, their efforts were overshadowed by a stellar performance from the Seattle Orcas, who chased down the target with ease, finishing at 169/1 in just 19.5 overs. This commanding display led to a resounding 9-wicket victory for the Orcas.

Ryan Rickelton played a pivotal role in Seattle’s triumph with an unbeaten 103 off 66 balls, showcasing his exceptional batting prowess. His innings included a mix of elegant strokes and powerful hitting, steering his team towards victory. Supporting him was Quinton de Kock, the wicketkeeper, who contributed a steady 51 not out off 46 deliveries, ensuring a strong partnership that sealed the game early for the Orcas. Nauman Anwar added a quickfire 9 runs from 7 balls, adding to the team’s total with valuable contributions down the order.

On the bowling front, Zaman Khan was instrumental for the Orcas, delivering an impressive spell to claim 2 wickets for just 24 runs in his 4 overs. His ability to strike crucial blows halted the Knight Riders’ momentum during their innings. Harmeet Singh also made significant contributions with the ball, taking 2 wickets for 34 runs in his allotted 4 overs, tightening the grip on Los Angeles’ batting lineup. Cameron Gannon chipped in with a crucial wicket, conceding 26 runs in his 4 overs, further bolstering the Orcas’ dominant performance.

In contrast, Match 5 saw the Washington Freedom making a strong start, reaching 62/0 in just 4 overs against the Texas Super Kings before rain interrupted play, leading to the match being abandoned. Travis Head was in exceptional form, smashing 32 runs off only 12 balls with aggressive strokeplay, setting a blistering pace early on. Captain Steven Smith provided steady support with 26 runs from 13 deliveries, ensuring Washington’s brisk start before weather conditions intervened.

Saurabh Netravalkar proved effective with the ball for the Texas Super Kings, picking up 2 crucial wickets for 33 runs in his 4 overs. His ability to break partnerships and control the run rate was crucial in restricting the Freedom’s scoring rate. Akeal Hosein and Justin Dill also contributed with a wicket each, with Hosein claiming 1 wicket for 32 runs in his 3 overs and Dill taking 1 wicket for 35 runs in his 3 overs, before rain ultimately brought a premature end to what promised to be an intriguing contest.

Prior to that, they experienced a loss followed by another win, demonstrating inconsistency in their form. However, they managed to secure two consecutive wins earlier, indicating periods of strong performance despite occasional setbacks. The team will be aiming to build on their recent success and maintain momentum going forward.

Washington Freedom:

On the other hand, Washington Freedom also displayed a similar pattern in their last five matches, starting with a recent win. This was followed by a loss, then another win, highlighting a fluctuating form. Like the Orcas, they faced consecutive losses before bouncing back with two consecutive victories. This up-and-down form suggests they have the potential to perform well but need to maintain consistency to achieve sustained success in upcoming matches.

The pitch report indicates a surface that offers fast pace and bounce, making it favorable for pace bowlers who can exploit the conditions effectively. While batsmen can expect a decent batting surface, the pitch’s average spin conditions suggest that spin bowlers may find some assistance, but not excessively so. Overall, the pitch promises a balanced contest between bat and ball, with both pace and spin bowlers having opportunities to influence the game.

title: Washington Freedom Triumphs Over Seattle Orcas in Nail-Biting Clash
body:
In a thrilling contest at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, Washington Freedom edged past Seattle Orcas by five wickets in a low-scoring thriller at the 2024 Major League Cricket.

Batting first, Seattle Orcas were bundled out for 124 in 19.4 overs thanks to stellar performances by Lockie Ferguson (4/26) and Saurabh Netravalkar (3/18). Heinrich Klaasen was the standout batter for Seattle, scoring a rapid 51 off 29 balls.

Chasing a target of 125, Washington Freedom encountered early setbacks but were steadied by a crucial unbeaten 63-run stand between Lahiru Milantha (33* off 30) and Obus Pienaar (31* off 30), sealing the win with 10 balls to spare. This victory propels Washington Freedom to the top of the points table, maintaining an unbeaten record in the tournament.

(Disclaimer: With inputs from agencies.)
summary:
**Match Result:** Washington Freedom defeated Seattle Orcas by 5 wickets in a low-scoring thriller at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

**Score:** Seattle Orcas were bowled out for 124 in 19.4 overs, while Washington Freedom chased down the target of 125 with 10 balls to spare.

**Notable Performances:** Lockie Ferguson (4/26) and Saurabh Netravalkar (3/18) starred with the ball for Washington Freedom, while Heinrich Klaasen scored a rapid 51 off 29 balls for Seattle Orcas. Lahiru Milantha (33* off 30) and Obus Pienaar (31* off 30) shared an unbeaten 63-run stand to guide Washington Freedom to victory.

**Tournament Impact:** This win takes Washington Freedom to the top of the points table, maintaining their unbeaten record in the tournament.

title: WATCH: Mitchell Santner hits a mammoth 106-metre six during SFU vs TSK match in MLC 2024
body:
In a league match between the San Francisco Unicorns and the Texas Super Kings in the 2024 Major League Cricket tournament, Mitchell Santner delivered a match-winning performance, punctuated by a monstrous 106-metre six that sealed the victory for his team.

The match, played at the Church Street Park in Morrisville, saw the Texas Super Kings chasing a challenging target of 128 runs set by the San Francisco Unicorns. With the game hanging in the favour of Texas, Santner stepped up to the crease in the 12th over, with his team needing 10 runs off 8.1 overs to secure the win.

Mitchell Santer, the baby-faced assassin

As the tension mounted, Santner faced a delivery from San Francisco’s Hassan Khan. What followed was a moment of sheer brilliance. Santner got under the tossed-up delivery outside off stump and unleashed a monstrous shot that sailed high and long, clearing the boundary by a considerable margin. The ball travelled an astonishing 106 metres, leaving the crowd in awe and the San Francisco fielders in disbelief.

“That six from Santner was an absolute beast,” commented one of the commentators. “He just got under that delivery and sent it into the stratosphere. That’s the kind of shot that can turn a game on its head.”

The mammoth six brought the Texas Super Kings within touching distance of victory, with only 4 runs needed off the 8 overs remaining. Santner and his partner Milind Kumar made light work of the remaining runs, sealing a 7-wicket victory for their team.

Here’s the video

Skipper’s appreciation after the match

“Santner’s six was the turning point of the match,” said the Texas Super Kings captain, Faf du Plessis. Faf also added in the post-match presentation that the experienced all-rounder is an asset to his team, and he expects the same from him every time he comes out on the ground.

Also WATCH: Quinton de Kock’s eye-catching reverse scoop shots during LAKR vs SEO game in MLC 2024

He stated, “It took the wind out of the Unicorns’ sails and gave us the momentum we needed to finish the job. That’s the kind of match-winning contribution we expect from our experienced players.”

The one-sided affair between the San Francisco Unicorns and the Texas Super Kings once again showcased the Santner being an asset in T20 cricket, where the all-rounder’s brilliance with both bat and ball can turn the tide of the game. Santner’s monstrous six will undoubtedly be remembered as one of the highlights of the 2024 Major League Cricket season.
summary:
* The Texas Super Kings defeated the San Francisco Unicorns in a league match of the 2024 Major League Cricket tournament, thanks to a match-winning performance from Mitchell Santner.
* Santner hit a massive 106-metre six in the 12th over, which brought his team within touching distance of victory and turned the game around.
* The Texas Super Kings chased down a target of 128 runs set by the San Francisco Unicorns, winning the match by 7 wickets.
* Santner's captain, Faf du Plessis, praised his performance, saying that the six was the turning point of the match and that he expects similar match-winning contributions from Santner.
* The win highlighted Santner's value as an all-rounder in T20 cricket, where his skills with both bat and ball can change the outcome of the game.

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Washington Freedom to start against MI New York. All you need to know about Season 2
body:
Our Major League Cricket 2024 campaign starts with a mouth-watering clash against defending champions MI New York at Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina, on July 6.

Steve Smith joins our side with a host of exciting players this season and will lead us in the second edition of MLC. Along with Smith, the Australian duo of Travis Head and Glenn Maxwell are also on board and will strengthen our batting.

Travis Head had an excellent outing in the T20 World Cup 2024, finishing as the highest run-getter for Australia and the third-highest overall. The Southpaw amassed 255 runs from seven matches at an excellent average of 42.50 and a strike rate of 158.38.

New Zealand all-rounder Rachin Ravindra and pacer Lockie Ferguson also join the team, alongside home favorites Andries Gous and Saurabh Netravalkar who held fort from last year.

Gous and Netravalkar finished as the highest run-getter and wicket-taker respectively for the USA in the recently concluded T20 World Cup, powering the co-host to the Super 8 stage in their first-ever World Cup.

Ricky Ponting will be our Head Coach for the MLC 2024 season as he takes over the reins from last year’s coach Greg Shipperd. Ponting will be assisted by former Australian batter Cameron White.

What went down for Washington Freedom in MLC 2023?

We finished third in the MLC 2023 standings with six points from three wins and two losses in our group games. In the resulting Eliminator contest against MI New York, we fell short by 16 runs.

Matthew Short was our top run-getter in the 2023 campaign with 152 runs from six outings. Saurabh Netravalkar topped our bowling charts, ranking fifth overall with 10 wickets from six matches, including breathtaking figures of 6/9 against the San Francisco Unicorns.

MLC 2024 Schedule: Washington Freedom matches

Unlike the five league matches, one against each team, which all teams had in MLC 2023, the current edition will see teams play a total of seven league matches. We will face MI New York and Texas Super Kings twice each and play once against the remaining three teams. Here's a look at our schedule for MLC 2024.

Washington Freedom Matches at MLC 2024

MLC 2024: Washington Freedom squad

Our team has progressed well from last year and grown into a stronger unit in the second season. The batting group has a wealth of experience, especially with the Australian trio of Head, Maxwell, and Smith.

Mukhtar Ahmed is a dangerous batter at the top of the order, averaging 28.77 in T20s with a healthy strike rate of 146.18.

Lahiru Milantha is the second wicketkeeper in the squad, along with Andries Gous. The left-handed Milantha is also a useful batter, averaging just under 25 with a strike rate of 136.58.

Glenn Maxwell, Rachin Ravindra, Marco Jansen, and Ian Holland are the all-rounders who provide the much-needed balance to the side. Holland averages 27.55 with the bat in T20s, and his handy medium pace provides a breakthrough every 22.6 balls.

Netravalkar and Ferguson spearhead a pace attack that includes the experienced Andrew Tye. Tye has a tally of 332 wickets from 239 matches at an average of 21.15 and an unbelievable strike rate of 15.4.

Akeal Hosein will headline the spin department. He will be the fourth left-arm spinner in the side, along with Ravindra, Obus Pienaar, and Amila Aponso.

Washington Freedom Squad: Steven Smith (c), Akhilesh Reddy Bodugum, Jack Edwards, Andries Gous, Travis Head, Lahiru Milantha, Mukhtar Ahmed, Justin Dill, Ian Holland, Marco Jansen, Glenn Maxwell, Obus Pienaar, Rachin Ravindra, Amila Aponso, Lockie Ferguson, Akeal Hosein, Saurabh Netravalkar, Andrew Tye, Yasir Mohammad

Where to watch WF vs MINY MLC 2024 LIVE

The LIVE telecast and streaming of the Washington Freedom vs MI New York match will be available on Monumental Sports Network in Washington D.C. and Willow by Cricbuzz in the USA. The match will start at 3:00 PM ET on July 6.

The WF vs MINY match will stream LIVE on the Jio Cinema App and website in India, starting at 12:30 AM IST on July 7.

Where to buy tickets for WF vs MINY?

Tickets for our game against MI New York match are available online at the link here.

Where to buy Washington Freedom’s official jersey?

Our jerseys and merchandise are available online and can be purchased from the link here.

You can also follow us on all social media platforms:

Instagram

Facebook

X

YouTube
summary:
**Team Information:**
The Washington Freedom team will start their MLC 2024 campaign on July 6 against defending champions MI New York at Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina. The team is led by Steve Smith and includes a host of exciting players such as Travis Head, Glenn Maxwell, Rachin Ravindra, and Lockie Ferguson. Ricky Ponting will be the Head Coach, assisted by Cameron White.

**Squad:**
The Washington Freedom squad includes a strong batting lineup with Smith, Head, Maxwell, and Mukhtar Ahmed. The team also has a balanced bowling attack with pace bowlers like Ferguson, Andrew Tye, and Saurabh Netravalkar, and spinners like Akeal Hosein, Obus Pienaar, and Amila Aponso.

**Schedule:**
The team will play a total of seven league matches, including two matches against MI New York and Texas Super Kings, and one match against the remaining three teams.

**Previous Season:**
In MLC 2023, Washington Freedom finished third in the standings with six points from three wins and two losses. They lost to MI New York in the Eliminator contest by 16 runs. Matthew Short was the top run-getter, and Saurabh Netravalkar topped the bowling charts.

**Upcoming Match:**
The Washington Freedom vs MI New York match will be telecast live on Monumental Sports Network in Washington D.C. and Willow by Cricbuzz in the USA, and will stream live on the Jio Cinema App and website in India. Tickets for the match are available online, and fans can also purchase the team's official jersey and follow them on social media platforms.

Los Angeles Knight Riders vs San Francisco Unicorns at Dallas, Major League Cricket 4th Match, Jul 7, 2024 [Twenty20]

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Washington Freedom continue unbeaten run with a five
body:
Lockie Ferguson's splendid spell with the ball powered Washington Freedom to a five-wicket win against Seattle Orcas in their Major League Cricket 2024 match at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Thursday.

Player of the Match, Ferguson registered match-winning figures of 4/26 in four overs to skittle out SO for 124, while Saurabh Netravalkar also impressed, picking up three wickets. SO skipper Heinrich Klaasen top-scored in the contest with 51 off 30 balls.

In response, Lahiru Milantha played a sensible innings to anchor our chase with an unbeaten 30-ball 33, as we reached 127/5 with more than an over remaining. Obus Pienaar also chipped in with an unbeaten 31 off 30 balls.

Netravalkar justified skipper Steve Smith’s decision to bowl first by striking in his first over. Ferguson picked up a wicket in the powerplay, as SO managed 35/2 after the first six overs, with only 16 runs coming from boundaries.

We kept things tight even after the powerplay with Ferguson knocking Quinton de Kock for his second wicket of the match. Smith was in action as he ran out Shubham Ranjane with an excellent fielding effort to break a crucial partnership.

Marco Jansen dismissed dangerman Heinrich Klaasen, who had just reached his half-century and looked in fine touch. Ferguson returned for a double strike in his final over to end his spell with four scalps and Seattle Orcas were all-out with two balls to spare.

Netravalkar rose to the top of the bowling charts of MLC 2024, picking up his eighth wicket of the tournament. The left-arm pacer finished with an incisive spell of 3/18.

Chasing 125, Rachin Ravindra, playing his first match in the MLC, got us off to a quick start, hitting 26 off just 16 balls, which included two sixes and three fours. We reached 47 for the loss of three wickets at the end of the powerplay.

From 64/5, Milantha and Pienaar put their heads down to build a crucial partnership to wrest the initiative back from SO. Their unbroken sixth-wicket partnership of 63 runs from 55 balls helped us cross the line as we remained the only team to be unbeaten in the MLC this year.

With the win, we moved to the top of the MLC 2024 points table with five points from three matches.

We will meet the Los Angeles Knight Riders in our next match at Church Street Park in Morrisville on Sunday.

Seattle Orcas vs Washington Freedom MLC 2024 brief scores: SO 124 in 19.4 overs (Heinrich Klaasen 51, Quinton de Kock 24, Lockie Ferguson 4/26, Saurabh Netravalkar 3/18) vs WF 127/5 in 18.2 overs (Lahiru Milantha 33*, Obus Pienaar 31*, Nandre Burger 2/27, Harmeet Singh 1/15)

Washington Freedom won by five wickets.
summary:
**Match Result:** Washington Freedom won by 5 wickets against Seattle Orcas in their MLC 2024 match at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

**Match Details:**

* Seattle Orcas scored 124 in 19.4 overs, with Heinrich Klaasen top-scoring with 51 off 30 balls. Lockie Ferguson took 4/26 and Saurabh Netravalkar took 3/18.
* Washington Freedom chased down the target, scoring 127/5 in 18.2 overs, with Lahiru Milantha unbeaten on 33 and Obus Pienaar scoring 31*.

**Tournament Standings:** Washington Freedom moved to the top of the MLC 2024 points table with 5 points from 3 matches, remaining the only unbeaten team in the tournament.

**Next Match:** Washington Freedom will face Los Angeles Knight Riders in their next match at Church Street Park in Morrisville on Sunday.

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Washington Freedom keen to extend unbeaten run against Seattle Orcas
body:
Unbeaten Washington Freedom meet Seattle Orcas in their third match of the Major League Cricket 2024 season at the Grand Prairie in Dallas on Thursday.

Our match against SO on July 11 is scheduled to start at 8:30 PM ET (July 12, 6:00 AM IST). The MLC 2024 game will be available to watch on LIVE streaming and broadcast.

We are currently second in the MLC 2024 points table with three points from two games.

Our last match against Texas Super Kings at Morrisville on Monday was abandoned due to rain after we were well-placed after four overs in the chase.

Openers Travis Head and Steve Smith looked in majestic touch and remained unbeaten when rain stopped proceedings. For the second match in running, Saurabh Netravalkar was the star performer for us, with the ball.

WF vs SO form in MLC

Washington Freedom have won two of their last five matches in the MLC coming into this contest. We lost our only encounter against SO, by five wickets, in the MLC 2023 edition.

WF vs SO, MLC 2024: Players to watch out

Netravalkar came up with another inspiring performance picking up 2/33 from four overs to restrict Texas Super Kings to 203/5 after they were looking set for a huge total. He pulled things back dismissing both the openers and bowled a total of 12 dot balls in his spell.

The Australian duo of Smith and Head were destructive at the top giving us an incredible start against TSK. They added 62 runs from just 24 balls, out of which 50 runs came in boundaries, courtesy of the five sixes and boundaries the pair smashed.

Akeal Hosein was impressive with both bat and ball in our last encounter with the Seattle Orcas in MLC 2023. He remained unbeaten on 33 from 22 balls before picking up a wicket with the ball.

Washington Freedom squad

Washington Freedom squad: Steven Smith (c), Akhilesh Bodugum, Jack Edwards, Andries Gous, Travis Head, Lahiru Milantha, Mukhtar Ahmed, Justin Dill, Ian Holland, Marco Jansen, Glenn Maxwell, Obus Pienaar, Rachin Ravindra, Amila Aponso, Lockie Ferguson, Akeal Hosein, Saurabh Netravalkar, Andrew Tye, Yasir Mohammad

Where to watch WF vs SO MLC 2024 LIVE

LIVE telecast and streaming of the Washington Freedom vs Seattle Orcas match will be available on Monumental Sports Network and Willow by Cricbuzz in the USA. The match will start at 8:30 PM ET on July 11.

The WF vs SO match will be streamed LIVE on the Jio Cinema App and website in India starting at 06:00 AM IST on July 12.
summary:
**Upcoming Match**: The Washington Freedom, currently unbeaten and second in the MLC 2024 points table, will face the Seattle Orcas in their third match of the season at the Grand Prairie in Dallas on Thursday, July 11.

**Recent Form**: Washington Freedom have won two of their last five matches in the MLC, with their last match against Texas Super Kings being abandoned due to rain. They lost their only previous encounter against Seattle Orcas by five wickets in MLC 2023.

**Players to Watch**: Saurabh Netravalkar, Travis Head, and Steve Smith are expected to perform well, based on their recent performances. Netravalkar was the star performer in the last match, while Head and Smith looked in good touch with the bat.

**Squad**: The Washington Freedom squad includes players like Steven Smith (c), Travis Head, Glenn Maxwell, Lockie Ferguson, and Akeal Hosein.

title: Willow by Cricbuzz and NBC Sports California partner to present Major League Cricket
body:
Willow by Cricbuzz, known for its extensive live, streaming, and on-demand cricket coverage, has teamed up with NBC Sports Bay Area and NBC Sports California to broadcast five live matches of the San Francisco Unicorns in the Major League Cricket (MLC) season.

Todd Myers, the Chief Operating Officer of Willow by Cricbuzz, remarked, “NBC Sports Bay Area and NBC Sports California are perfect platforms to showcase the San Francisco Unicorns’ Major League Cricket matches. The unforgettable run by USA Cricket in the T20 World Cup ignited a nationwide cricket fandom, and we’re ready to keep that flame burning. Fans can now watch their World Cup heroes play for their hometown team. This partnership will bring these electrifying matches directly to fans, attracting new audiences and further integrating cricket into the Northern Californian sports scene.”

Ben Rodrigues, the Senior Director of Multiplatform Programming at NBC Sports Bay Area and NBC Sports California shared his views on this collaboration, saying: “We are the home for Northern California sports and the Unicorns, along with their Major League Cricket opponents, deliver unique and exciting content for our viewers and partners. We’re pleased to partner with the Unicorns to build on our already robust portfolio of live sports content and further our position as the top source of live sports in the Bay Area and beyond.”

The games streaming on NBC Sports Bay Area and NBC Sports California are:

The partnership aims to capitalize on the growing interest in cricket in the US, following the success of the USA Cricket team in the T20 World Cup. The broadcast will bring the matches directly to fans in Northern California, attracting new audiences and further integrating cricket into the local sports scene.
