title: San Francisco Unicorns Defeat MI New York To Qualify For MLC2024 Playoffs
body:
The Major League Cricket 2024 is going on in the USA, with popular players from different nations joining in the play. The tournament started on 5 July, 2024, the day after USA celebrated its independence and will go on until 28 July. San Francisco Unicorns qualify for playoffs in the Major League Cricket after defeating MI New York in match 16 at Texas.

In a thrilling match at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, Texas, the Unicorns won by three runs. After winning the toss and choosing to bat first, the Unicorns had a rough start as Noshthush Kenjige dismissed Finn Allen off his own bowling.

Here’s What happened at the match

The match was held at the Grand Prairie Stadium, Texas where San Francisco Unicorns won the toss. The team opted to bat first, scoring 148/7 in the first innings of the match. CJ Anderson scored the lowest runs for the team, scoring 59* off 37 balls with a strike rate of 159.46. Hassan Khan scored the second highest runs for the team, hitting 44 runs in 35 balls.

Australia great Pat Cummins scored 13 runs off 12 balls. He did not take any wickets in the 4 overs of his bowling. However, Cummins did not give many runs away. He conceded 27 runs in 4 overs, maintaining an economy rate of 6.8.

The MI New York team was not too far, scoring 145/7 in 20 overs of the game. The match was a very close call for the San Francisco Unicorns, who are witnessing a change of fate. This match was Pat Cummins’ first match of the season, as he came back from vacation.

Dewalt Bravis scored the highest number of runs for MI New York, hitting 56 runs in 36 balls. SFU’s Matthew Short took 3 wickets of the MI New York team. On the other hand, Boult and Nosthush Kenjige were the highest wicket-takers of MI New York. Both these players took 2 wickets each.

Here are the playing XIs of both the teams

MI New York (Playing XI): Ruben Clinton, Monank Patel, Nicholas Pooran(w), Dewald Brevis, Kieron Pollard(c), Romario Shepherd, Sunny Patel, Heath Richards, Rashid Khan, Nosthush Kenjige, Trent Boult

San Francisco Unicorns (Playing XI): Finn Allen, Matthew Short, Josh Inglis(w), Corey Anderson(c), Sherfane Rutherford, Sanjay Krishnamurthi, Hassan Khan, Pat Cummins, Liam Plunkett, Haris Rauf, Brody Couch

Corey Anderson became the Player Of The Match. He achieved this feat after his 59* off 37 balls turned out to be a game changer for SFU who won the match by 3 runs.

title: WATCH: Nosthush Kenjige takes a spectacular catch to dismiss Finn Allen in MLC 2024
body:
In the 16th match of Major League Cricket 2024 (MLC), United States of America cricketer Nosthush Kenjige showcased his exceptional fielding skills with a brilliant caught-and-bowled dismissal of Finn Allen. The match, held between MI New York and San Francisco Unicorns, saw Kenjige make a significant impact right from the start.

Nosthush Kenjige’s breathtaking catch

On the third ball of the first over, Kenjige delivered a short-length delivery directed towards the wicket. Allen, opting for a backfoot shot, attempted to muscle the ball down the ground. However, he failed to generate the necessary power and elevation, and the ball dribbled straight back toward the bowler. Demonstrating exceptional agility and presence of mind, Kenjige stretched out to his right and made a spectacular catch, sending Allen back to the pavilion for just 2 runs. This stunning catch not only highlighted Kenjige’s skill as a bowler but also showcased his impressive fielding abilities.

Kenjige’s performance didn’t stop there. He was instrumental in dismissing both opening batters of the San Francisco Unicorns, taking the wicket of Matthew Short along with Allen. Over his four overs, Kenjige maintained an impressive economy rate of 3.20, conceding only 13 runs and securing 2 wickets.

Here is the video:

Also WATCH: Shehan Jayasuriya hits an unorthodox shot against Haris Rauf in MLC 2024

Despite the exceptional efforts of Kenjige and the MI New York bowlers, the team fell short in their chase. San Francisco Unicorns, batting first, posted a total of 148/7. The standout performance came from their skipper, Corey Anderson, who played a pivotal role with a brilliant half-century, scoring 59 runs off 37 balls, including 4 fours and 2 sixes. His innings set a challenging target of 149 runs for MI New York.

In response, MI New York managed to score 145/7, narrowly missing the target by just 3 runs. Dewald Brevis contributed significantly with 56 runs off 36 balls, but the rest of the batting lineup failed to rise to the occasion, leading to their defeat.
summary:
**Match Details:** The 16th match of Major League Cricket 2024 was played between MI New York and San Francisco Unicorns.

**Notable Performances:**

* Nosthush Kenjige (MI New York) took 2 wickets, including a brilliant caught-and-bowled dismissal of Finn Allen, and maintained an economy rate of 3.20.
* Corey Anderson (San Francisco Unicorns) scored a half-century (59 runs off 37 balls) to help his team post a total of 148/7.
* Dewald Brevis (MI New York) contributed 56 runs off 36 balls in the chase.

**Match Result:** San Francisco Unicorns won the match by 3 runs, with MI New York falling short of the target of 149 runs.

title: WATCH: Glenn Maxwell sends the ball out of the park with a monstrous six against Mohammad Mohsin | MLC 2024, WF vs TSK
body:
Washington Freedom (WF) secured a convincing 42-run victory over Texas Super Kings (TSK) in the 17th match of Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

Washington batters feast on Texas bowling

The Washington batters put on a dominant display, posting a mammoth total of 206/5 in their allotted 20 overs. Openers Steve Smith (57) and Travis Head (53) laid a solid foundation with a half-century partnership.

The highlight of the first innings was a monstrous six from the explosive Glenn Maxwell, who dispatched a Mohammad Mohsin delivery out of the park in the seventh over.

Video of Glenn Maxwell’s big hit:

Also WATCH: Dewald Brevis launches Matthew Short’s delivery for a massive six in MLC 2024

While the Freedom batsmen enjoyed a fruitful outing, credit must be given to the Super Kings’ bowling attack. Young spinner Noor Ahmad impressed with his guile, claiming 3 wickets for 38 runs, while veteran all-rounder Dwayne Bravo kept things tight with 2 wickets for 40 runs.

Texas Super Kings falls short despite Faf du Plessis’ heroics

Chasing a daunting target of 207, Texas crumbled under pressure, eventually being bowled out for 164 runs in 19.5 overs. Faf du Plessis (55) showed some resistance with a well-compiled half-century, but the rest of the batting lineup failed to capitalize.

Rachin Ravindra was the wrecker-in-chief for Washington Freedom, picking up four crucial wickets for just 16 runs. Jasdeep Singh also played a vital role, bagging 3 wickets for 25 runs.

With this victory, the Washington Freedom have solidified their position in the points table. They will play their final league stage match against San Francisco Unicorns on July 22. The Super Kings, on the other hand, face a do-or-die encounter against the bottom-placed Seattle Orcas on July 23. A win for the Super Kings is imperative to secure their qualification for the playoffs.
summary:
* In the 17th match of MLC 2024, Washington Freedom (WF) defeated Texas Super Kings (TSK) by 42 runs at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.
* Washington Freedom scored 206/5 in 20 overs, with Steve Smith (57) and Travis Head (53) providing a strong foundation. Glenn Maxwell also contributed with a massive six.
* Texas Super Kings were bowled out for 164 runs in 19.5 overs, with Faf du Plessis scoring 55. Rachin Ravindra took 4 wickets for 16 runs, and Jasdeep Singh took 3 wickets for 25 runs, to lead Washington Freedom to victory.
* The win solidified Washington Freedom's position in the points table, while Texas Super Kings face a must-win game against Seattle Orcas on July 23 to qualify for the playoffs.

title: San Francisco Unicorns vs Seattle Orcas Prediction
body:
San Francisco Unicorns vs Seattle Orcas Match Prediction & Betting Tips - MLC 2024

San Francisco Unicorns will take on Seattle Orcas at the Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas in Match 18 of the 2024 Major League Cricket. This game gets underway at 20:30 local time on Saturday 20th July 2024.

SFU vs SOR, Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas Pitch Report

This looks like being another pitch in Dallas which provides more assistance for the bowlers than for the batters. Whoever bats first will feel they are very much in the contest if they post 150+.

Read on for team previews, betting tips, latest odds, and match prediction for San Francisco Unicorns vs Seattle Orcas, Major League Cricket 2024

San Francisco Unicorns Team News & Playing 11

SFU Team News

Victories over Seattle Orcas and MI New York in their last two games have seen San Francisco Unicorns move up the table and they are now unbeaten from their last three matches. They will be relishing the chance to lockhorns with the Orcas again who they beat by 23 runs only five days before this fixture.

SFU Team Batting

Even with their top four batters producing just eight runs and seeing the team struggle on 19/4 in the last game, San Francisco Unicorns showed that they have depth in their batting order by going onto win that match. In this fixture, Seattle Orcas will know there is batting ability all the way through the side.

SFU Team Bowling

With the ball, Brody Couch and Matthew Short opened the bowling in their win over MI New York and took five wickets between them. Seven bowlers were used by captain Corey Anderson in that game and we expect a similar number to be called upon in this fixture.

Another win for San Francisco Unicorns will mean they have won three successive games in the tournament.

One point adrift at the bottom of the table, it has not been a happy 2024 MLC for Seattle Orcas who have won just one of their five matches so far in the campaign. They come into this match after a four wicket defeat against Los Angeles Knight Riders in Match 15.

SOR Team Batting

Although most observers would probably pick out the likes of Aaron Jones or Quinton de Kock and Heinrich Klaasen as Seattle Orcas’ best batters, there can be no doubt that opener Ryan Rickelton has been their standout player. He comes into this game after hitting seven fours and six sixes in the last match.

SOR Team Bowling

Seattle Orcas’ bowling unit took six wickets in their last game and they will need to improve on that if they are to stop the strong batting line up of San Francisco Unicorns in this fixture. Cameron Gannon and Harmeet Singh both took two wickets for the Orcas in their last match.

title: MI New York vs San Francisco Unicorns Highlights: San Francisco Unicorns beat MI New York by 3 runs
body:
Right then, that will be it from us for this contest. We hope you enjoyed the coverage. The action continues at the Major League Cricket, 2024. The next match of the competition will see the Texas Super Kings locking horns with the Washington Freedom in Match 17 at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, Texas. That game will be played on July 20th and will start at 6.00 am IST (12.30 am GMT). But as you know, you can always join early for all the build-up. Until then, take care, and cheers!

The skipper of San Francisco Unicorns is also the Player of the Match for his sublime knock. He says that he is pretty happy with the win. Adds that they bat deep and credits Hassan Khan who batted superbly today. Mentions that they need to pick the aggressive options and find the boundary when they can. Shares that he and Hassan Khan spoke well through the middle and got ahead of the game in the latter stages with the bat. Adds that he is happy to perform against the MINY side. Ends by sharing that they were under par with the bat but the guys showed a good fight and it shows the character of the team.

The losing skipper of MI New York, Kieron Pollard says the middle phase with the ball was the one where the opposition got back in the game but they had it covered for a long while with the bat but they gave it away in the end. Adds that around 120 was what they had in mind after their bowling in the first 10 overs but the opposition batted well and posted above 145 making things difficult for them. Says that one has to congratulate the opposition and not try to take credit away from them as they played better on the day. Says that he hasn't done justice to the side himself with his batting not firing and that has cost the team for the majority of the tournament. Closes by saying that the batting unit has not done well throughout the tournament and overall as a batting unit they have let the fans and franchise down but they still have one game to go and they'll look to play that well.

Matthew Short is up for a chat. He says it's a huge win as MI New York is a quality side and they have some brilliant players of T20 format. Credits Corey Anderson and Hassan Khan for that superb partnership that kept them in the game. Mentions that the top order has done well so far apart from today and the middle order stepped up when the side needed them the most and that's a good sign for any side.

Earlier today, the San Francisco Unicorns opted to bat first and posted a fighting score of 148 for 7 in their 20 overs. The Unicorns were reeling at 33 for 5 but the partnership of 87 between skipper Corey Anderson and Hassan Khan (44 off 35) brought them back in the game. Corey Anderson remained unbeaten on 59 off just 37 and played a crucial hand to get his side out of trouble. Nosthush Kenjige and Trent Boult took two each for the MI New York side while Shepherd and Rashid Khan chipped in with one apiece. MI New York have slumped to their fourth loss of the season and have just a game in hand.

San Francisco Unicorns started well with the ball but lost their way in the middle phase of the innings. They, however, came back strong and got into the winning position. Brody Couch and Matthew Short shared five wickets among them while Haris Rauf and Hassan Khan chipped with one apiece. San Francisco Unicorns will be delighted with the win as they came back from behind and took the victory from the jaws of defeat. San Francisco Unicorns have qualified for the playoffs and moved to second position in the table.

Phew! What a cliffhanger we've witnessed in Dallas! San Francisco Unicorns held their nerves and won this game by 3 runs in the end. They become the second team after the Washington Freedom to book a place in the playoffs. Chasing a competitive score of 149 for the win, MI New York lost an early wicket of Ruben Clinton but Pooran and Brevis stuck around and added 77 for the second wicket. Dewald Brevis made an attacking fifty and departed on 56 off 36. The wicket of Brevis put the brakes on scoring for MI New York and they kept losing wickets at regular intervals. Rashid Khan and Heath Richards swung their bats at the backend but failed to take their team over the line.

W

Overs15.4

Score104 - 5

Matthew Short to Romario Shepherd, HOLES OUT! The plan comes off for the Unicorns and Matthew Short gets his third wicket of the match. Comes from round the wicket and bowls it a touch shorter, sliding into the middle. Romario Shepherd looks to bang bang but does not get the desired connection. He gets the height but not distance and gets caught by Hassan Khan at the deep mid-wicket boundary. MI New York have lost half their side now.
summary:
* The next match of the Major League Cricket 2024 will be between the Texas Super Kings and the Washington Freedom on July 20th at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, Texas, starting at 6:00 am IST (12:30 am GMT).

* The San Francisco Unicorns have qualified for the playoffs and moved to second position in the table after a 3-run win against MI New York. They were led by their skipper Corey Anderson, who scored 59 off 37 and was named the Player of the Match.

* MI New York, led by Kieron Pollard, slumped to their fourth loss of the season and have only one game left to play. Pollard acknowledged that his own batting performance has not been up to par and that their batting unit has let the team down throughout the tournament.

* The match saw a remarkable comeback by the San Francisco Unicorns, who were reeling at 33 for 5 but recovered to post 148 for 7 thanks to a partnership of 87 between Corey Anderson and Hassan Khan. They then restricted MI New York to 145 for 9, with Matthew Short and Brody Couch sharing five wickets among them.

title: Major League Cricket: Know MLC 2024 standings and points table
body:
Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 began on Saturday, July 6 and ends on July 24 in the United States of America.

Operated by American Cricket Enterprises (ACE) and sanctioned by USA Cricket, the upcoming edition of MLC will feature six teams vying for the championship title.

Texas Super Kings, Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, and Washington Freedom are the six teams participating in MLC 2024.

This T20 tournament will feature a total of 25 matches, including the playoffs. Each team will play seven league games, with the top four sides at the end of the league stage advancing to the playoffs.

The playoffs will then begin with the Eliminator between the third and fourth-placed teams. The winner of the Eliminator moves on to the Challenger match against the loser of the Qualifier.

The winner of the Qualifier will witness the first and second-placed teams compete for direct entry to the final.

All matches are scheduled to take place at Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas and Church Street Park in North Carolina. The MLC 2024 final is scheduled for Monday, July 29, at Grand Prairie Stadium.

Defending champions MI New York began the ongoing edition of MLC with a six wicket win over Seattle Orcas.

However, Washington Freedom have looked like the strongest team in the tournament and qualified for the MLC 2024 playoffs after staying unbeaten in their first five games of the league.

With that being said, let’s have a look at the Major League Cricket 2024 points table and standings to get a better idea about who the other teams are who are likely to make the playoffs.

Major League Cricket 2024 points table and standings

Teams earn two points for a win and none for a loss. In case a match ends in no result due to inclement weather conditions, both sides get a point each.

Should teams be tied on points at the end of all the league stage games, the side with the better net run rate finishes higher in the standings.

title: Liam Plunkett to leave Surrey for Major League Cricket in United States
body:
Surrey [UK], September 1 (ANI): Surrey and England fast bowler Liam Plunkett will leave Surrey CCC at the end of the season after three years with the club.

Surrey announced on Tuesday that after leaving the club at the end of the season, Plunkett will be heading to the USA, where he will sign with Major League Cricket, an ambitious new T20 league aiming to transform the American cricketing landscape.

Plunkett will also be supporting The Philadelphians, a team in the Eastern Division of Minor League Cricket, which was also recently launched to provide a level below the major league setup - coaching at a new Academy.

The 36-year-old joined Surrey in 2019 - the year in which he played a key role in England's extraordinary World Cup campaign, returning figures of 3/42 in the final that included the wicket of New Zealand captain Kane Williamson.

Speaking to the Surrey CCC website, Liam said: "I would like to thank everyone at Surrey for the support and backing I have received over the last three years. It is an incredible Club, and it was an honour to have represented them."

"Moving onto the next phase of my career, I'm thrilled to have the opportunity to join Major League Cricket and focus my attention on helping to grow the sport in the United States. I've enjoyed a fantastic career with England, and after retiring from international cricket, I am delighted to be able to help build the sport in America in both playing and coaching capacities."

"In addition, I am looking forward to supporting the team closest to our home in the US by being able to play for The Philadelphians in Minor League Cricket," he added.

Surrey CCC Director of Cricket, Alec Stewart, said: "On behalf of everyone at the Club, we wish Liam the very best with his new challenge in America. Whenever he is in London, he will always be welcomed back to visit the Kia Oval." (ANI)
summary:
* Liam Plunkett, a fast bowler, is leaving Surrey CCC to join Major League Cricket, a new T20 league in the USA.
* The league aims to transform the American cricketing landscape.
* Plunkett will also coach at a new academy and play for The Philadelphians, a team in the Eastern Division of Minor League Cricket, which is a level below the major league setup.
* Plunkett is excited to help grow the sport in the United States in both playing and coaching capacities.

title: Bowler Injured After Being Hit on Head In Major League Cricket
body:
Major League Cricket or MLC is currently being played in the United States. A match between San Francisco and Seattle took place recently, during which a fast bowler from San Francisco was struck on the head by the ball. The impact was so severe that the player collapsed on the pitch and sustained a serious injury. A video of the incident has rapidly gone viral on social media.

Also Read: Video: Kiwi Cricketers Likely To Miss IPL 2025 , Reason Revealed

Carmi Le Roux Hit on the Head In Major League Cricket Game

During the Major League Cricket match, San Francisco’s fast bowler Carmi Le Roux was bowling when a Seattle batsman hit a powerful shot off one of his deliveries. The ball struck Le Roux directly on the head, leaving him no chance to avoid it. Blood began to flow from his head following the impact. The match was halted as the field umpire called for medical assistance, and Le Roux was taken off the field. Corey Anderson completed the over after Le Roux was removed from the game.

title: MLC Match 16: San Francisco Unicorns edge out MI New York by 3 runs in thrilling finish
body:

Match Analysis

The San Francisco Unicorns secured a thrilling three-run victory over MI New York in a nail-biting encounter of the 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas.

Key performances included Corey Anderson’s (59*) steady half-century for the Unicorns, Dewald Brevis’ (56) explosive fifty for MI New York, and Pat Cummins’ crucial 19th over for the Unicorns, which helped them defend their total of 148/7, despite Heath Richards’ (23) valiant effort in the final over for MI New York.

MI New York had a staggered start to the run chase as they lost Ruben Clinton (0) to Matthew Short as early as the second over. Opener Dewald Brevis and Nicholas Pooran (26) saw out the powerplay, with MI New York at 31/1.

While the required run rate had crept up, MI New York were set for a comfortable run chase with nine wickets in hand. Brevis looked to pick up the pace after the powerplay and found boundaries at will. The 21-year-old brought up his half-century in the ninth over, smashing Pat Cummins for a six and a four to reach the milestone in just 32 balls.

In the very next over, Brody Couch bagged the crucial wicket of Brevis with the score reading 79/2. Captain Pollard (4) was the next man to fall, trapped LBW by Couch as well. With the required run rate rising, Matthew Short made a vital breakthrough with the wicket of Pooran in the 14th over.

Romario Shepherd (7) and Monank Patel (5) both fell with minimal contributions, leaving MI New York’s Rashid Khan (14*) and Heath Richards with a steep target in the final four overs of the game. Pat Cummins bowled a crucial 19th over, giving away only 5 runs, which was vital for his team’s defense of the total. In the final over, Heath Richards nearly chased the 20 runs needed with two maximums, but Haris Rauf managed to dismiss him on the final delivery, securing a three-run victory for the San Francisco Unicorns.

Earlier in the day, the San Francisco Unicorns had a dismal start to their innings. In quick succession, they lost Finn Allen (0) and Matthew Short (4) to the bowling of Noshtush Kenjige, while Sanjay Krishnamurthi and Josh Inglis were also sent back to the pavilion early. By the end of the powerplay, the Unicorns were languishing at 28/4.

Sherfane Rutherford (15) struck three boundaries before he was run out in the seventh over. It was Hassan Khan (44) and Corey Anderson who executed the repair job for the San Francisco Unicorns. The pair put on 87 runs in 58 balls, with Corey Anderson leading the way with a 33-ball half-century.

Hassan Khan fell in the 17th over when he was cleaned up by the crafty Rashid Khan. Pat Cummins (13) joined Corey Anderson and made a brief contribution before becoming Boult’s second scalp of the day. The San Francisco Unicorns finished on 148/7 in 20 overs.

title: Andre Russell's Short-Pitch Ball Breaks Travis Head's Bat In MLC Match, Video Goes Viral- WATCH
body:
MLC 2024- Andre Russell Breaks Travis Head's Bat, Viral Video: Washington Freedom beat Los Angeles Knight Riders by 8 wickets to register their third won on the trot in Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 on Sunday (July 14). Washington Freedom first bowled out their opponents for 129 with Saurabh Netravalkar and Glenn Maxwell sharing seven wickets between them, they then managed to chase down their target in 16 over.

Other than a clinical performance from Washington Freedom in the match which saw Travis Head (54) and Steve Smith (42*) shine with the bat, a bizarre incident also happened in the fixture as a short-pitch ball from Andre Russell broke Travis Heads' bat. Russell's fiery delivery hit the upper half of Head's bat and broke it, sending it flying away from the batter. The video of the incident soon went viral on social media.

title: MLC Match 15: Seattle Orcas vs Los Angeles Knight Riders - Los Angeles Knight Riders won by 4 wickets
body:
Los Angeles Knight Riders beat Seattle Orcas by 4 wickets, in MLC Match 15 , today, at Church Street Park, Morrisville, USA

Match Summary

Seattle Orcas vs Los Angeles Knight Riders, Match 15, Major League Cricket

Seattle Orcas 142/6 (20 ov)

Los Angeles Knight Riders 143/6 (19.1 ov)

Result - Los Angeles Knight Riders won by 4 wickets

SCORECARD

Runrate

Match Analysis

A crucial half-century from Unmukt Chand (62) ensured the Los Angeles Knight Riders defeated the Seattle Orcas by four wickets and five balls to spare in the 15th match of the 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket at Church Street Park, Morrisville on Wednesday. Ryan Rickelton’s (89) breathtaking 52-ball knock for the Seattle Orcas was ultimately in vain.

Chasing a below-par score, the Los Angeles Knight Riders orchestrated a comfortable run chase. Sunil Narine’s (8) lean run continued when Spencer Johnson dismissed him in the second over, while Jason Roy (26) and Unmukt Chand (62) went on to build an important partnership. At the end of the powerplay, the Los Angeles Knight Riders were 47/1.

The 58-run alliance between Roy and Chand was derailed by Harmeet Singh in the 10th over. Unmukt Chand went on to bring up his half-century in 38 deliveries, comprising three sixes and three fours. In the 17th over, Chand fell to Harmeet Singh, but at 120/5, the Knight Riders were in a strong position.

Nitish Kumar (12) and Saif Badar (18*) came together for a brief partnership before Andre Russell (10) made a quick contribution to ensure the Los Angeles Knight Riders secured victory with balls to spare. Harmeet Singh (2/27) and Cameron Gannon (2/35) were the pick of the Orcas bowling efforts.

Earlier in the day, the Seattle Orcas suffered an early setback when Shehan Jayasuriya (2) was dismissed by Corne Dry. Soon after, Quinton de Kock (0) was run out without troubling the scorers. Opener Ryan Rickelton continued his fine form and quickly accumulated runs as he was joined by Heinrich Klaasen. By the end of the powerplay, the Seattle Orcas were placed at 36/2, with Rickelton having scored 27 of those runs.

In the ninth over, Rickelton shifted into another gear, hammering Waqar Salamkheil for two consecutive sixes and two fours in a 22-run over. Remarkably, no other batsman besides Rickelton had scored a boundary for the Orcas in the first 10 overs. Rickelton brought up his half-century in just 28 deliveries, featuring five maximums and four boundaries. Meanwhile, Klaasen (23) played a more guarded knock, providing stability at the other end until he was unfortunately run out in the 12th over at 90/3.

While Rickelton continued to flourish, striking another six and four fours, the lack of support around him meant the Orcas failed to build any more concrete partnerships. Aaron Jones (9) and Michael Bracewell (5) were castled by the experienced Sunil Narine and Andre Russell before Rickelton would eventually perish just shy of a century, dismissed by Spencer Johnson in the 19th over. The Seattle Orcas finished on 142/6 in 20 overs.

Los Angeles Knight Riders Fall of wickets: 1-13 (Sunil Narine - 2.2 ov), 2-71 (Jason Roy - 9.5 ov), 3-83 (David Miller - 11.1 ov), 4-105 (Nitish Kumar - 13.5 ov), 5-120 (Unmukt Chand - 16.4 ov), 6-140 (Andre Russell - 18.5 ov)

In response, the Los Angeles Knight Riders chased down the target with 5 balls to spare, thanks to Unmukt Chand's half-century (62 off 38 balls). They won the match by 4 wickets, with Saif Badar remaining not out on 18. Harmeet Singh and Cameron Gannon were the pick of the Seattle Orcas' bowlers, taking 2 wickets each.

title: South African bowler Carmi le Roux injured in major league match
body:
South African bowler Carmi le Roux was severely injured when he was struck on the head by the ball during a Major League cricket match in the US.

The accident occurred when Ryan Rickelton, batting for the Seattle Orcas and le Roux’s fellow South African, played a shot that sent the ball directly into le Roux’s head, causing significant bleeding.

Le Roux was quickly taken off the field for medical treatment and was fortunately conscious afterwards, which helped him avoid more serious injury. Despite this, his participation in the remainder of the tournament is now uncertain, although the franchise has yet to issue an official statement regarding his condition.

In le Roux’s absence, American all-rounder Corey Anderson stepped in to complete the remaining overs. The Major League, which began on July 5, is set to conclude with its final match on July 28.
summary:
* A serious injury occurred during a Major League cricket match in the US when a bowler, Carmi le Roux, was struck on the head by the ball.
* The incident led to significant bleeding, and Le Roux's participation in the remainder of the tournament is now uncertain.
* The Major League tournament started on July 5 and is scheduled to conclude on July 28 with its final match.

title: Watch: Rickelton in the runs again in MLC
body:
Ryan Rickelton struck 89 off 52 balls for the Seattle Orcas against the Los Angeles Knight Riders in Major League Cricket on Wednesday.

The Proteas batsman – who scored 103* off 66 balls against the same opponents earlier in the tournament – hit seven fours and six sixes, but didn’t get much support as Seattle posted 142-6.

Quinton de Kock was run out for a duck, while Heinrich Klaassen scored a run-a-ball 23.

LA won by four wickets with five balls remaining despite David Miller being dismissed for two.
summary: In a recent Major League Cricket match, Ryan Rickelton of the Seattle Orcas scored 89 off 52 balls against the Los Angeles Knight Riders, including 7 fours and 6 sixes. Despite his efforts, Seattle only managed to post 142-6, with Quinton de Kock getting out for a duck and Heinrich Klaassen scoring 23 off 23 balls. Los Angeles ultimately won the match by 4 wickets with 5 balls remaining, despite David Miller being dismissed for just 2 runs.

title: Andre Russell’s six helps LAKR win, keeps playoff hopes alive
body:
LAKR all-rounder Andre Russell struck one of his trademark straight sixes, in the ending parts of the Major League Cricket 2024 match between Los Angeles Knight Riders and Seattle Orcas in Morrisville. At that point, LAKR had lost their fifth wicket while chasing a target of 143, needing 23 runs off the remaining 20 deliveries when Russell came in to bat.

With a towering six, the 36-year-old sealed the game by launching a slower leg-cutter from Cameron Gannon straight onto the sightscreen. This decisive shot brought the score to 11 off 11, effectively coming close to the victory.

Even though he was eventually out for 10 off 7 after two balls, the thunderous hit had already done the damage.

LAKR secured victory by four wickets after Russell’s dismissal on the first ball of the final over. With one match left in the round-robin phase, this victory maintained their chances of making the playoffs, placing them in fourth position with five points from six games.

In the tournament so far, Russell has been inconsistent, scoring 94 runs at a modest average of 23.50 and a high strike rate of 159.32 across five innings. The 36-year-old all-rounder has also struggled to take wickets, claiming just one scalp with figures of 1/15 in four overs in this match.

Needing a win to keep their playoff hopes alive, LAKR took on SOR. Russell, breaking out of his wicket-taking slump, delivered a sensational spell of 1/15 in 4 overs, restricting SOR to a modest total of 142/6 in 20 overs.

In the 18th over, he dismissed the dangerous Michael Bracewell, stalling SOR’s late surge. Later, Russell’s crucial six helped LAKR end their three-game losing streak and secure the victory.

A victory over MI New York (MINY) in their final round-robin matchup would all but secure a playoff spot. The two teams are set to face off in Dallas on Sunday, July 21.
summary:
**Match Result:** Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) defeated Seattle Orcas (SOR) by 4 wickets in a match played in Morrisville.

**Key Player Performance:** Andre Russell, an all-rounder for LAKR, played a crucial role in the win. He struck a decisive six to seal the game and also delivered a sensational bowling spell of 1/15 in 4 overs, restricting SOR to 142/6 in 20 overs.

**Tournament Standings:** LAKR has moved to fourth position with five points from six games, keeping their playoff hopes alive. They need to win their final round-robin match against MI New York (MINY) on July 21 to secure a playoff spot.

**Andre Russell's Tournament Performance:** Russell has been inconsistent in the tournament so far, scoring 94 runs at an average of 23.50 and a strike rate of 159.32 across five innings. He has also struggled to take wickets, claiming just one scalp in this match.

title: MLC 2024: Glenn Maxwell gifts POTM award to young fan
body:
Australia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell displayed a heartwarming gesture after Washington Freedom’s match against Los Angeles Knight Riders in the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024. Maxwell, who won the Player of the Match award, decided to give his award to a young fan and even signed an autograph for him.

The clip of Maxwell’s gesture has gone viral on social media. In the video, Maxwell is seen handing over a big box to a delighted young fan after the game. Although Maxwell did not get a chance to bat, he made a significant impact with his bowling.

Maxwell took three wickets, conceding only 15 runs in his spell, helping to restrict the Knight Riders to 129 runs in their first innings. Washington Freedom chased down the target in just 16 overs, losing only two wickets and winning the game by eight wickets.

Washington Freedom shared the video of Maxwell’s generous act on their official X handle, captioning it, “The winner of the hearts award goes to Glenn Maxwell, who graciously gave his POTM award to his fan.”

After the game, Maxwell talked about his performance and the favorable conditions for bowlers. He also expressed his relief at not having to bat.

“We're fortunate with the conditions and Saurabh picking wickets at top. It was nice to get some help from the wicket. There was little bit of spin, little bit of inconsistency. It was a good day and nice to go at the top as well. I'm absolutely loving not having to bat; great to give my body a bit of rest. Smudge (Steve Smith) is doing a great job as a leader and opener, very fortunate to have him,” Maxwell said in the post-match presentation ceremony.
summary:
* The Washington Freedom team defeated the Los Angeles Knight Riders in a recent match, chasing down the target of 129 runs in 16 overs with 8 wickets remaining.
* Glenn Maxwell, an Australian all-rounder playing for Washington Freedom, was awarded Player of the Match for his outstanding bowling performance, taking 3 wickets for 15 runs.
* In a heartwarming gesture, Maxwell gave his Player of the Match award to a young fan and signed an autograph for him, which went viral on social media.
* Maxwell commented on the favorable bowling conditions and expressed relief at not having to bat, praising team leader Steve Smith for his performance as opener.

title: Ravi Shastri predicts winners of Major League Cricket 2024 matches
body:
Major League Cricket (MLC), a popular Twenty20 cricket tournament in the USA, is back with its second season. Cricket, which is second to religion in countries like India has seen an unbelieve spike in American fans, owing to the tournaments recently held here, including the T20 World Cup 2024. MLC, a franchise T20 league, was established in 2019 by American Cricket Enterprises (ACE) in the United States.

The 2024 season, the second edition of the tournament, is being hosted at two venues, Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas and Church Street Park in Morrisville. MI New York, the reigning champions are aiming to defend their title in the tournament that began on July 5 and will come to an end on July 28.

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Unbeaten Washington Freedom Keen to Seal Top
body:
Washington Freedom will be eager to book a place in the top two of the Major League Cricket 2024 standings when they meet Texas Super Kings in a top-of-the-table clash at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Friday.

Our match against TSK on July 19 is scheduled to start at 7:30 PM CT (July 20, 6:00 AM IST). The MLC 2024 game will be available to watch via live streaming and broadcast.

The top two teams in the points table after the group stage will meet each other in the Qualifier, with the winning team getting a chance to directly advance to the final.

Currently, we are on top of the MLC 2024 points table with nine points from five games. A win will help us continue our unbeaten run this season along with guaranteeing a place in the top two of the standings.

We defeated MI New York by a mammoth 94 runs in our last game in Dallas on Tuesday, with Jasdeep Singh making a memorable debut for us in MLC with a three-wicket haul. Travis Head and Andries Gous also shone with half-centuries.

Though Saurabh Netravalkar did not feature in our last match, he continues to be on top of the bowling charts for MLC 2024. The left-arm pacer has 12 wickets from four matches at an average of 9.16 and a strike rate of 7.66. Lockie Ferguson and Glenn Maxwell also feature in the top five of the wicket-takers list with nine and six wickets, respectively.

Meanwhile, Travis Head, after scoring consecutive fifties in the last two matches, is on top of our run-getters list, with captain Steve Smith in second place. Head has accumulated 141 runs at an average of 35.25 and a strike rate of 163.95 to find a place in the top ten of the overall batting charts, along with Smith.

WF vs TSK form in MLC

We enter this game with four wins from the last five matches in MLC 2024, with our previous game against Texas Super Kings getting washed off due to rain.

Washington Freedom's last five matches

WF vs TSK, MLC 2024: Players to watch out

Jasdeep Singh, who came into the side as a replacement for Netravalkar in our last match against MINY, made an instant impact with career-best T20 figures of 3/14 in three overs. He was a tricky customer, surprising batters with his pace and bounce.

Jasdeep bowled 13 dot balls in his spell, piling pressure on the MINY middle order, who succumbed to the rising scoring rate. Ferguson also chipped in with two crucial wickets to skittle MINY.

Meanwhile, Andries Gous scored his first fifty in MLC to anchor our batting and powered us to a dominant total of 182/5 batting first. Coming in to bat during the powerplay, Gous scored 59 off 48 balls before being dismissed on the last ball of the innings.

The fact that three of Gous’ four sixes came against leg spinner Rashid Khan speaks to his class and big-hitting ability. Travis Head displayed his attacking game yet again with a 33-ball 54 to give us a steady start and a solid foundation to go big in the death overs.

The Australian duo of Head and Smith were severe on the Texas Super Kings bowling attack chasing 204, in their last meeting on July 9. But unfortunately, rain played spoilsport as we were well-placed at 62/0 after just four overs.

Washington Freedom squad: Steven Smith (c), Akhilesh Reddy, Jack Edwards, Andries Gous, Travis Head, Lahiru Milantha, Mukhtar Ahmed, Justin Dill, Ian Holland, Marco Jansen, Glenn Maxwell, Obus Pienaar, Rachin Ravindra, Amila Aponso, Lockie Ferguson, Akeal Hosein, Saurabh Netravalkar, Andrew Tye, Yasir Mohammad

Where to watch WF vs TSK MLC 2024 LIVE

LIVE telecast and streaming of the Washington Freedom vs Texas Super Kings match will be available on Monumental Sports Network and Willow by Cricbuzz in the USA. The match will start at 7:30 PM CT on July 19.

The WF vs TSK match will be streamed LIVE on the Jio Cinema App and website in India starting at 06:00 AM IST on July 20.

title: 2024 Major League Cricket season
body:
Second season of Major League Cricket

Cricket tournament

2024 Major League Cricket seasonDates5 – 28 July 2024Administrator(s)American Cricket Enterprises

USA CricketCricket formatTwenty20Tournament format(s)Round-robin and playoffsHost(s)United StatesParticipants6Official websiteMajor League Cricket

← 2023

2025 →

The 2024 Major League Cricket season (also known as MLC 2024, or for sponsorship reasons as 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket) is the second season of Major League Cricket,[1][2] a franchise Twenty20 cricket league established in 2019 by American Cricket Enterprises (ACE) in the United States.[3] The season is being hosted, as was the case of the previous season, at two venues: Grand Prairie Stadium in Grand Prairie, Texas and Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina.[4] The tournament began from 5 July to and the final is scheduled to be held on 28 July 2024, with MI New York as the defending champions.[5]

Background

[edit]

In December 2023, it was announced that the second season of the tournament would begin on 5 July 2024, four days after the conclusion of the 2024 ICC Men's T20 World Cup.[6] This was later moved back a day to 5 July.[7] It was also reported that matches would be played at Grand Prairie Stadium, alongside other venues.[8] By March 2024, MLC had announced that they had signed Cognizant to serve as the season's title sponsor.[9]

On 15 February 2024, the overseas players' retention lists were announced, with the number of overseas slots having been upped to nine.[10] In the following months, teams would go on to select further overseas players, including Australian cricketers Steven Smith and Travis Head.[11][12] The domestic players' draft was virtually held on 21 March 2024, with a total of 20 players being picked by the teams over 10 rounds.[13] An additional draft is scheduled for 16 June in order for teams to complete their squads.[14] The season schedule was released on 7 May, with defending champions MI New York to face the Seattle Orcas in the season opener, and the final set for 28 July.[7]

The full list of season fixtures were released by MLC on 7 May.[15] Later that month, MLC announced that they had obtained official List A status for all tournament fixtures, becoming the second Associate-run league to have it alongside the ILT20.[16]

Teams

[edit]

All the six teams from the previous season will take part this season.

Teams in the 2024 Major League Cricket season Franchise Captain Head coach Los Angeles Knight Riders Sunil Narine Phil Simmons MI New York Kieron Pollard Robin Peterson San Francisco Unicorns Corey Anderson Shane Watson Seattle Orcas Wayne Parnell Pravin Amre Texas Super Kings Faf du Plessis Stephen Fleming Washington Freedom Steve Smith Ricky Ponting

Squads

[edit]

A minimum of 16 players and a maximum of 19 players can be selected by the teams with a maximum of nine overseas players. The teams can also retain their domestic players during the retention window, which was open till 29 February 2024.[17] The teams were allowed to select the remaining domestic players during the draft held on 21 March 2024, and another additional draft held on 16 June 2024.[citation needed]

* The 2024 Major League Cricket season is the second season of the tournament, scheduled to take place from July 5 to July 28, 2024.
* The tournament will feature six teams, with matches played at two venues: Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas and Church Street Park in North Carolina.
* The season will have a round-robin and playoffs format, with the final scheduled to be held on July 28, 2024.
* MI New York is the defending champion of the tournament.

**Teams and Squads**

* The six teams participating in the tournament are: Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, and Washington Freedom.
* Each team has a minimum of 16 players and a maximum of 19 players, with a maximum of nine overseas players.
* The teams have retained some players from the previous season, and additional players were selected through a draft held on March 21, 2024, and another draft scheduled for June 16, 2024.

**Schedule and Fixtures**

* The leading wicket-takers are Saurabh Netravalkar, Lockie Ferguson, Cameron Gannon, Spencer Johnson, and Rashid Khan.

title: Major League Cricket in Morrisville Grows Love for the Sport
body:
BY Kyle Marie McMahon

Cognizant Major League Cricket (MLC) opened its 2024 season in Morrisville on July 5. Despite the sweltering heat, the community packed Church Street Park (5800 Cricket Pitch Way) to watch MI New York defeat the Seattle Orcas by six wickets.

This is just the second season for MLC, which has six teams. MI New York won the inaugural title last year, and while the players hope for a repeat, Head Coach Robin Peterson says, “Last year is last year. Yes, it’s nice to come into a tournament as defending champions, but everybody starts on no points again. We’re very cognizant of the fact we’ve got to go and earn it again and play some good cricket if we’re going to be successful in this competition.”

MLC is a Twenty20 league, which is a shortened format of cricket, designed to be played in a few hours rather than five days. If you are new to the sport, the rules may feel intimidating, but upon arrival, the league provides you with a handout to explain the scoring. For those familiar with baseball, it can be helpful to use it as a comparison for understanding the basics.

As in baseball, there is a fielding team and a batting team. Imagine the area from home plate to the pitcher’s mound. In cricket, this is called the pitch. There is still a pitcher (called a bowler) and a catcher (called a wicket-keeper), but instead of bases, cricket has “wickets,” which are three stumps with connecting sticks on top. The remainder of the fielding team is in the circular field that surrounds the pitch. The fielding team’s goal is to dismiss batters (get an out), which can be done by breaking the wickets or fielding the ball.

The batting team’s goal is to protect the wicket and hit the ball for runs. Two batters take the pitch at a time, standing at opposite wickets. Only one batter will hit the ball, but both will run, and each time they cross the pitch to the opposite wicket, a run is scored. As with all sports, there are special rules around batting, fielding and scoring, but you don’t need to know them all to start enjoying the game.

And with continued investment in Church Street Park, you can expect interest in the sport to continue to grow. Harmeet Singh Baddhan, bowler for the Orcas, loves getting to play here. He says, “Every time we come here, it’s such good hospitality. People love cricket out here. It’s a smaller community, but there’s a lot of love for the game.”

It’s been an exciting and tight race this season, which was expanded to 21 matches, up from 15 last season. Washington Freedom is in first place with seven points, but there are still plenty of games to play. You can still catch the last game in North Carolina on July 17 at 3 p.m. before the season wraps in Grand Prairie, Texas. The round-robin playoffs will start July 24, with the championship game commencing on July 28 at Grand Prairie Stadium. Don’t stress if you weren’t able to make it to a game: the Minor League Cricket season, where you can watch our very own Morrisville Raptors play at Church Street Park, will start soon after.
summary:
**Tournament Details:**

* The 2024 season of MLC started on July 5 in Morrisville.
* MLC is a Twenty20 league, a shortened format of cricket played in a few hours.
* The league has six teams, including MI New York, the defending champions from last season.
* The season has been expanded to 21 matches, up from 15 last season.

**Current Standings:**

* Washington Freedom is currently in first place with seven points.
* The season is still ongoing, with multiple games left to play.

**Upcoming Matches:**

* The last game in North Carolina will take place on July 17 at 3 p.m.
* The round-robin playoffs will start on July 24, with the championship game on July 28 at Grand Prairie Stadium.

**Other Relevant Information:**

* The Minor League Cricket season, featuring the Morrisville Raptors, will start soon after the MLC season.
* Church Street Park in Morrisville has seen continued investment and has been hosting MLC games, with the community showing strong support for the sport.

title: Scary Head Injury Leaves South African Bowler Bleeding In Major League Cricket
body:
The Major League Cricket saw a scary moment take place, as fast-bowler Carmi le Roux was hit on the head by a hard shot from batsman Ryan Rickleton. San Francisco Unicorns bowler le Roux was bowling his second over when Seattle Orcas batter Rickleton’s shot caught him by surprise and slammed onto his head. The nasty blow left le Roux’s face completely bloodied. Thankfully, le Roux was still in his senses despite the hit, and walked off without any help from his teammates.

Bowling the third over of the game, South African Le Roux was smashed on the head by a shot from compatriot Rickleton. Rickleton, a left-hander, had looked to hit it straight, but the shot ended up going straight at the bowler.

Watch: Scary moment in MLC as Carmi le Roux gets hit on the head

Medical staff were rushed on to the ground, but to everyone’s relief, le Roux was able to walk off on his own.

Seattle Orcas at the bottom

After le Roux was taken off, former New Zealand and current USA all-rounder Corey Anderson completed the over. Defending 165, the San Francisco Unicorns were able to restrict Seattle Orcas to just 142, despite missing le Roux.

Former England pacer Liam Plunkett, 39, was the pick of the bowlers, ending the game with figures of 3/26 in four overs.

After that game, the Seattle Orcas suffered another defeat two days later, this time to the Los Angeles Knight Riders. This left the Orcas at the bottom of the Major League Cricket (MLC) season two table. Their fortunes this season are a stark contrast to the previous season, when they had topped the table.

The Orcas are currently on just one victory in five games. Defending champions MI New York are also in trouble, sitting fifth and outside the playoff spots.

The tournament started on July 5, 2024, and the final is set to be played on July 28.
summary:
* In a scary moment, San Francisco Unicorns fast-bowler Carmi le Roux was hit on the head by a hard shot from Seattle Orcas batsman Ryan Rickleton, leaving his face bloodied, but he was able to walk off the field on his own.
* Despite le Roux's injury, the San Francisco Unicorns were able to restrict the Seattle Orcas to 142 and win the game, with Liam Plunkett being the top performer with figures of 3/26 in four overs.
* The Seattle Orcas suffered another defeat two days later to the Los Angeles Knight Riders, leaving them at the bottom of the MLC season two table with only one win in five games.
* Defending champions MI New York are also struggling, sitting in fifth place outside the playoff spots.
* The Major League Cricket tournament started on July 5, 2024, and the final is scheduled to be played on July 28, 2024.

title: LA Knight Riders Triumph Over Seattle Orcas In Major League Cricket 2024 Match
body:
Cricket

-OneArabia

Unmukt Chand's crucial half-century (62) led the Los Angeles Knight Riders to a four-wicket victory over the Seattle Orcas in match 15 of Major League Cricket 2024 at Church Street Park, Morrisville. The win came with five balls remaining on Wednesday (July 17).

Despite Ryan Rickelton's impressive 89 off 52 balls for the Seattle Orcas, his efforts were in vain. The Los Angeles Knight Riders secured their second win in six games, moving to fourth place on the points table. Washington Freedom has already qualified for the playoffs.

The Los Angeles Knight Riders chased a below-par score comfortably. Sunil Narine's lean run continued as Spencer Johnson dismissed him in the second over. However, Jason Roy (26) and Unmukt Chand (62) formed a vital partnership, taking the team to 47/1 by the end of the powerplay.

The partnership between Roy and Chand added 58 runs before Harmeet Singh broke it in the 10th over. Chand reached his half-century in 38 balls, hitting three sixes and three fours. Although he fell to Harmeet Singh in the 17th over, leaving LAKR at 120/5, they remained in control.

Earlier, Seattle Orcas faced early setbacks when Corne Dry dismissed Shehan Jayasuriya (2), followed by Quinton de Kock's run-out without scoring. By the end of the powerplay, they were at 36/2, with Rickelton contributing 27 runs.

Rickelton accelerated in the ninth over, smashing Waqar Salamkheil for two consecutive sixes and two fours in a single over. He reached his half-century off just 28 balls with five sixes and four boundaries.

Lack of Support for Rickelton

Heinrich Klaasen (23) provided some stability but was run out in the 12th over at 90/3. Despite Rickelton's continued aggression, hitting another six and four boundaries, other batsmen failed to support him adequately.

Aaron Jones (9) and Michael Bracewell (5) were bowled by Sunil Narine and Andre Russell respectively. Rickelton was eventually dismissed by Spencer Johnson in the 19th over, leaving Seattle Orcas at 142/6 after their allotted overs.

Final Push by LAKR

Nitish Kumar (12) and Saif Badar (18*) formed a brief partnership before Andre Russell contributed a quickfire 10 runs. This ensured that Los Angeles Knight Riders achieved their target with balls to spare. Harmeet Singh (2/27) and Cameron Gannon (2/35) were notable performers for Seattle Orcas.

Brief Score:

Los Angeles Knight Riders:143/6(Unmukt Chand 62, Jason Roy 27; Harmeet Singh 2/27, Cameron Gannon 2/25)Seattle Orcas:142/6(Ryan Rickelton 82, Heinrich Klaasen 23; Corne Dry 1/8, Andre Russell 1/15)Result:Los Angeles Knight Riders won by four wickets

Story first published: Thursday, July 18, 2024, 13:24 [GST]
summary:
**Match Result:** Los Angeles Knight Riders won by 4 wickets against Seattle Orcas in Match 15 of Major League Cricket 2024.

**Score:** Los Angeles Knight Riders: 143/6, Seattle Orcas: 142/6.

**Key Performers:** Unmukt Chand (62) led the Los Angeles Knight Riders to victory, while Ryan Rickelton's 89 off 52 balls was in vain for Seattle Orcas.

**Tournament Update:** Los Angeles Knight Riders secured their second win in six games, moving to fourth place on the points table, while Washington Freedom has already qualified for the playoffs.

Los Angeles Knight Riders vs San Francisco Unicorns Match Prediction & Betting Tips - MLC 2024

Los Angeles Knight Riders will take on San Francisco Unicorns at Church Street Park, Morrisville in Match 10 of the 2024 Major League Cricket. This game gets underway at 15:00 local time on Saturday 13th July 2024.

LAKR vs SFU, Church Street Park, Morrisville Pitch Report

We have seen teams bowled out for 108 and 127 at Church Street Park and we expect bowlers to have the upper-hand again. A par score should still be over 150 though.

Read on for team previews, betting tips, latest odds, and match prediction for Los Angeles Knight Riders vs San Francisco Unicorns, Major League Cricket 2024

Los Angeles Knight Riders Team News & Playing 11

LAKR Team News

After beginning the tournament with a 12 run victory over Texas Super Kings, Los Angeles Knight Riders have since lost back to back games, both convincingly, against San Francisco Unicorns and Seattle Orcas. However, they have the opportunity to exact revenge on the Unicorns in this match.

LAKR Team Batting

Although they were beaten in the last game by Seattle Orcas, there were some encouraging signs from the batting line up for Los Angeles Knight Riders with former England international opener Jason Roy hitting 69 and David Miller finishing unbeaten on 44. With Sunil Narine and Andre Russell also in the side, there are plenty of runs in this side.

LAKR Team Bowling

The bowling unit has a lot of work to do to improve on their performance in the last game which saw only Spencer Johnson pick up a wicket from the six bowlers used. Shakib Al Hasan will be desperate to be more economical on Saturday after leaking runs at 11.50 runs per over in the last match.

LAKR Team Form

Los Angeles Knight Riders won their opening match but are now looking to avoid their third successive defeat.

Los Angeles Knight Riders Predicted Playing 11

Jason Roy, Sunil Narine (c), Unmukt Chand (wk), Shakib Al Hasan, David Miller, Andre Russell, Saif Badar, Nitish Kumar, Corne Dry, Spencer Johnson, Ali Khan

San Francisco Unicorns Team News & Playing 11

SFU Team News

Two games into the 2024 Major League Cricket, San Francisco Unicorns have won one and lost one. They began with a six wicket victory over their opponents in this game, Los Angeles Knight Riders, before losing to Texas Super Kings in Match 7.

SFU Team Batting

Finn Allen and Matthew Short were the key batters for San Francisco Unicorns in their opening game victory over Los Angeles Knight Riders with both hitting half-centuries. Josh Inglis, Jake Fraser-McGurk and captain Corey Anderson, make up a powerful top five in this match.

SFU Team Bowling

Brody Couch and Haris Rauf will both be looking forward to bowling at the LA batters again in this game after picking up a two-wicket haul in the head to head in Match 4. Hassan Khan impressed with two wickets of his own in the last game against Texas.

SFU Team Form

San Francisco Unicorns won their opening match by six wickets but were well beaten by seven wickets in Match 7.

San Francisco Unicorns Predicted Playing 11

Finn Allen, Jake Fraser-McGurk, Matthew Short, Josh Inglis (wk), Corey Anderson (c), Sanjay Krishnamurthi, Hassan Khan, Liam Plunkett, Haris Rauf, Brody Couch, Abrar Ahmed
summary:
**Match Details**

* Match 10: Los Angeles Knight Riders vs San Francisco Unicorns
* Date: Saturday, 13th July 2024
* Time: 15:00 local time
* Venue: Church Street Park, Morrisville

**Pitch Report**

* The pitch is expected to favor bowlers, with teams bowled out for 108 and 127 in previous games.
* A par score is expected to be over 150.

**Team Previews**

* Los Angeles Knight Riders: Lost their last two games after winning the opening match. Jason Roy and David Miller showed encouraging signs in their last game, but the bowling unit needs to improve.
* San Francisco Unicorns: Won their opening match, lost their second game, and now face Los Angeles Knight Riders again. Finn Allen and Matthew Short were key batters in their opening game victory, while Brody Couch and Haris Rauf impressed with the ball.

**Predicted Playing 11**

* Los Angeles Knight Riders: Jason Roy, Sunil Narine (c), Unmukt Chand (wk), Shakib Al Hasan, David Miller, Andre Russell, Saif Badar, Nitish Kumar, Corne Dry, Spencer Johnson, Ali Khan
* San Francisco Unicorns: Finn Allen, Jake Fraser-McGurk, Matthew Short, Josh Inglis (wk), Corey Anderson (c), Sanjay Krishnamurthi, Hassan Khan, Liam Plunkett, Haris Rauf, Brody Couch, Abrar Ahmed

title: Major League Cricket matches streaming on Bally Sports in Texas, California
body:
GRAND PRAIRIE, Texas — Fans of Major League Cricket in North Texas will be able to watch the Texas Super Kings, home or away, through Bally Sports Southwest and the Bally Sports app.

Willow by Cricbuzz and Bally Sports announced Friday its streaming and linear distribution partnership. Under this agreement, Bally Sports West/SoCal and Bally Sports Southwest will deliver regional Major League Cricket matches featuring the LA Knight Riders and Texas Super Kings to their hometown fans.

The season will be played throughout the month of July at two venues in the United States: Grand Prairie Stadium in Grand Prairie, Texas, and Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina.

Following three weeks of matches, the top four seeds will compete in the post-season tournament. Seeds 3 and 4 will compete in Eliminator and seeds 1 and 2 will compete in Qualifier. The winner of Qualifier will advance to Championship with the loser going into the Challenger match. The winner of Eliminator will advance to the Challenger match and the loser of Eliminator will be eliminated.

The winner of the Challenger match will then advance to the Championship to take on the winner from the Qualifier match.

2024 Texas Super Kings MLC Matches on Bally Sports Southwest:

Friday, July 5 vs. Los Angeles Knight Riders at 7:30 p.m. CT

Monday, July 8 vs. Washington Freedom at 2:00 p.m. CT

Wednesday, July 10 vs. San Francisco Unicorns at 2:00 p.m. CT

Friday, July 12 vs. MI New York at 2:00 p.m. CT

Sunday, July 14 vs. MI New York at 7:30 p.m. CT

Friday, July 19 vs. Washington Freedom at 7:30 p.m. CT

Tuesday, July 23 vs. Seattle Orcas at 7:30 p.m. CT

2024 LA Knight Riders MLC Matches on Bally Sports West/SoCal:

Friday, July 5 vs. Texas Super Kings at 7:30 p.m. CT

Sunday, July 7 vs. San Francisco Unicorns at 7:30 p.m. CT

Tuesday, July 9 vs. Seattle Orcas at 7:30 p.m. CT

Saturday, July 13 vs. San Francisco Unicorns at 2:00 p.m. CT

Sunday, July 14 vs. Washington Freedom at 2:30 p.m. CT

Wednesday, July 17 vs. Seattle Orcas at 2:00 p.m. CT

Sunday, July 21 vs. MI New York at 7:30 p.m. CT

“Our partnership with Bally Sports arrives at a pivotal time when cricket is capturing the hearts of Americans, fueled by the T20 World Cup’s dramatic impact,” said Todd Myers, COO of Willow by Cricbuzz. “Now, fans in Texas and Southern California can rally behind their teams, celebrating the international stars they admired during the World Cup right in their backyard. With this effort, we’re not just expanding cricket’s footprint; we’re weaving it into the fabric of local communities, offering fans a personal stake in the global excitement of cricket.”

For a look at the full Major League Cricket schedule, click here.

Major League Cricket playoff schedule

Eliminator

Seed 3 vs. Seed 4

July 24 at Grand Prairie Stadium

Qualifier

Seed 1 vs. Seed 2

July 25 at Grand Prairie Stadium

Challenger

Loser Qualifier vs. Winner Eliminator

July 26 at Grand Prairie Stadium

Championship

Winner Qualifier vs. Winner Challenger

July 28 at Grand Prairie Stadium

Major League Cricket ticket information

Tickets for all matches will go on sale in the coming weeks and can be purchased through the official Major League Cricket website. Fans are encouraged to secure their tickets early by registering for the pre-sale to ensure they don't miss out on the action after sell-out crowds in 2023.
summary:
**Partnership and Broadcasting**: Major League Cricket has partnered with Willow by Cricbuzz and Bally Sports to broadcast matches featuring the Texas Super Kings and LA Knight Riders on Bally Sports Southwest and the Bally Sports app.

**Schedule and Venues**: The season will take place throughout July at two venues in the US: Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas and Church Street Park in North Carolina.

**Teams and Matches**: The Texas Super Kings will play 7 matches, and the LA Knight Riders will play 7 matches as well. The schedule includes matches against teams such as the Washington Freedom, San Francisco Unicorns, MI New York, and Seattle Orcas.

**Post-season Tournament**: The top 4 seeds will compete in the post-season tournament, with seeds 3 and 4 playing in the Eliminator, and seeds 1 and 2 playing in the Qualifier. The winner of the Qualifier will advance to the Championship, and the winner of the Eliminator will play in the Challenger match. The winner of the Challenger match will then play in the Championship.

** playoff Schedule**:

* Eliminator: July 24 at Grand Prairie Stadium
* Qualifier: July 25 at Grand Prairie Stadium
* Challenger: July 26 at Grand Prairie Stadium
* Championship: July 28 at Grand Prairie Stadium

**Ticket Information**: Tickets for all matches will go on sale soon and can be purchased through the official Major League Cricket website. Fans are encouraged to register for the pre-sale to ensure they don't miss out on the action.

title: Washington Freedom vs Los Angeles Knight Riders Preview & Prediction
body:
Click here for today’s sports betting tips from our expert analysts!

League leading Washington Freedom, captained by Steve Smith, come into their fourth match of the 2024 Major League Cricket campaign on the back of one game with no result due to the weather and two victories thus far. The Los Angeles Knight Riders, on the other hand, have majorly dipped since beginning their campaign with a victory.

DATE & TIME: Sunday 14th July, 2024 - USA ET – 3:30pm / USA PT – 12:30pm / West Indies – 2:30pm / UK – 8:30pm / South Africa – 9:30pm / Monday 15th July, 2024 - Pakistan – 12:30am / India – 1:00am / Bangladesh – 1:30am/ Australia – 5:30am

VENUE: Church Street Park, Morrisville, North Carolina, United States

WEATHER: 35c or 95 F with clear, sunny skies

HOW TO WATCH ON TV: USA – Willow TV / West Indies – TBA / UK – TNT Sports / South Africa – ESPN / Pakistan – A Sports / India – TBA / Bangladesh – TBA / Australia – N/A

HOW TO WATCH ONLINE: USA – Willow TV / West Indies – TBA / UK – TNT Sports app / South Africa – ESPN+ app / Pakistan – A Sports / India – TBA / Bangladesh – TBA / Australia – Amazon Prime Video

WASHINGTON FREEDOM FORM: THE IMPRESSIVE WASHINGTON

Led by Steve Smith, the Washington Freedom have a generally very impressive squad in this season’s Major League Cricket competition and that has reflected in the results with victories over last season’s finalists, MI New York and the Seattle Orcas. Even in their game that was eventually washed out, they were on 62-0 off just four overs in the hunt for 204 against the Texas Super Kings.

LAST THREE: WAWLL

LOS ANGELES KNIGHT RIDERS FORM: BACK TO BAD HABITS

The Los Angeles Knight Riders finished rock-bottom in the Major League Cricket table last season but they managed to win their opening game against the aforementioned Texas Super Kings. Since then, though, they have been handily beaten by both the San Francisco Unicorns and Seattle Orcas so are under pressure as they head into this one at Church Street Park in Morrisville.

LAST THREE: ALLWW

WASHINGTON FREEDOM BETTING ANALYSIS

Travis Head has had an inconsistent opening set of matches and was dismissed for a two-ball duck in a low-scoring victory over the Orcas the other day. It is and will remain a rarity for the Australian to miss out too often, though, and against what is a fairly weak LAKR attack, backing Head to cash in as the Freedom’s top scorer would seem a reasonable shout.

It was an impressive display with the ball the other day in that win against Seattle as they bowled them out for just 124 in 19.4 overs. Lockie Ferguson had bowled really well until that point but failed to take wickets so the New Zealander picking up 4-26 will please him greatly. Ferguson continuing his good form with two or more wickets here seems likely.

LOS ANGELES KNIGHT RIDERS BETTING ANALYSIS

LAKR have really struggled to get off the mark with any sort of a flyer so far. Even their 12-run win over TSK was an unlikely defence of just 162. There is a lot of onus on David Miller to continue where he left off against Seattle Orcas whereby he scored 44 off just 22. Miller to be their top batter in the match seems the best bet for every LAKR match.

Bowling-wise, LAKR are fairly ineffective and lack any real thrust and incision, reliant on an ageing attack that includes the likes of Sunil Narine, Andre Russell, Shakib Al Hasan and Ali Khan. Their one dynamic weapon with the ball remains Spencer Johnson and he should pretty much always be backed to be their top bowler in a game.

WASHINGTON FREEDOM VS LOS ANGELES KNIGHT RIDERS EXPERT PREDICTION

This one does actually appear to be a bit of a mismatch. Having a victory already in this tournament, which is better than they had at this stage of last season, is a small improvement and yet still flattering to what is an average LAKR side. This could end up being quite one sided on what should be a dry and difficult pitch but one that should suit the impressive Freedom top order. A comfortable Washington Freedom victory is to be expected.
summary:
**Match Details:**
The Washington Freedom, led by Steve Smith, will face the Los Angeles Knight Riders in their fourth match of the 2024 Major League Cricket campaign on July 14, 2024, at Church Street Park, Morrisville, North Carolina, United States.

**Recent Form:**
The Washington Freedom have won two matches so far, defeating MI New York and the Seattle Orcas, while one game against the Texas Super Kings was washed out due to weather. The Los Angeles Knight Riders, on the other hand, won their opening game but have since been defeated by the San Francisco Unicorns and Seattle Orcas.

**Key Players:**
For Washington Freedom, Travis Head is expected to score well against the Los Angeles Knight Riders' weak attack, while Lockie Ferguson is likely to continue his good form with the ball. For Los Angeles Knight Riders, David Miller is expected to be their top batter, while Spencer Johnson is their top bowling prospect.

**Prediction:**
The article predicts a comfortable Washington Freedom victory, citing the team's impressive squad and form, while the Los Angeles Knight Riders are expected to struggle due to their average performance so far in the tournament.

title: MLC 2024: Rain Forces Abandonment of MI New York vs Texas Super Kings Clash
body:
oi-Aditya K Halder

The much-anticipated clash between MI New York and Texas Super Kings in the Major League Cricket -- MLC 2024 -- ended in disappointment as rain forced the match to be abandoned without a single ball being bowled at Church Street Park, Morrisville.

The persistent rain not only prevented any play but also precluded the toss, resulting in both teams sharing a point each.

With no improvement in the points table due to the washout, Texas Super Kings maintained their second spot with four points from four matches and a Net Run Rate (NRR) of 1.242. MI New York, sitting in third place, now have three points from three matches with a superior NRR of 1.472.

Texas Super Kings, who had previously been at the bottom of the table, had recently climbed up the ranks after a convincing seven-wicket victory. This win had briefly positioned them at the top before Washington Freedom's five-wicket triumph over Seattle Orcas relegated them to the second spot.

Despite the washout, Texas Super Kings will be eager to continue their upward trajectory and retain their winning momentum as they prepare for their next encounter against MI New York on Sunday.

MI New York, on the other hand, were looking to bounce back from a narrow defeat against Washington Freedom, where they lost by four runs via the Duckworth-Lewis-Stern (DLS) method.

The rain-affected match at Morrisville denied them the opportunity to regain their momentum. Nevertheless, they will be keen to secure a victory in their upcoming rematch against the Texas Super Kings, this time set to be played in Dallas.

The abandonment of the match due to rain underscores the unpredictable nature of cricket and the impact of weather on the sport. Fans and players alike were left frustrated as the elements took precedence over the game. Both teams will now look forward to their next face-off, hoping for clear skies and a chance to compete.

As the Major League Cricket 2024 progresses, every point becomes crucial, and both Texas Super Kings and MI New York will be eyeing their next clash with determination to improve their standings and continue their pursuit of the championship.
summary:
**Match Abandoned Due to Rain**: The match between MI New York and Texas Super Kings in the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 was abandoned without a single ball being bowled due to persistent rain at Church Street Park, Morrisville.

**Points Table Update**: Both teams shared a point each, with Texas Super Kings remaining in second place with 4 points from 4 matches and a Net Run Rate (NRR) of 1.242. MI New York is in third place with 3 points from 3 matches and a superior NRR of 1.472.

**Next Encounter**: The two teams will face each other again on Sunday, with Texas Super Kings looking to continue their winning momentum and MI New York seeking to bounce back from their recent defeat.

**Tournament Context**: Every point is crucial in the MLC 2024, and both teams will be determined to improve their standings and pursue the championship.

title: Major League Cricket 2024- Match 10, Los Angeles Knight Riders vs San Francisco Unicorns- Cricket Betting Tips and Match Predictions: July 13
body:
Here are the Fantasy Cricket Predictions and Betting Tips for the Major League Cricket Match 10- LA Knight Riders vs San Francisco Unicorns, which will be played on the 13th of July at the Church Street Park, Morrisville.

Points Table

Match 10- LA Knight Riders vs San Francisco Unicorns (Church Street Park, Morrisville)

Current Form LA Knight Riders:

LA Knight Riders are currently placed at the 4th position on points table with 1 win and 2 losses to their credit.

The top run scorer for LA Knight Riders in the Major League Cricket is Jason Roy with 97 runs to his name.

The top wicket taker for LA Knight Riders in the Major League Cricket is Spencer Johnson with 6 scalps under his belt.

LA Knight Riders have lost their previous match against Seattle Orcas by a big margin of 9 wickets.

LA Knight Riders batted first and they posted a total of 168 for 5 in 20 overs. Sunil Narine, Unmukt Chand and Shakib Al Hasan got out cheaply. Jason Roy and David Miller played with a lot of heart and smashed 69 and 44 runs respectively to help LA Knight Riders get to a competitive total of 168 in 20 overs of play.

During the chase, Nauman Anwar got out cheaply. After his dismissal, Ryan Rickelton and Quinton de Kock then played with a lot of courage and intent. Rickelton scored a century and made 103 runs off 66 balls while De Kock scored 51 runs to win the match for Seattle Orcas with 9 wickets in hand.

Most 6's T20

Current Form San Francisco Unicorns:

San Francisco Unicorns are currently placed at the 5th position on points table with 1 win and 1 loss to their credit.

The top run scorer for San Francisco Unicorns in the Major League Cricket is Matthew Short with 91 runs to his name.

The top wicket taker for San Francisco Unicorns in the Major League Cricket is Haris Rauf with 2 scalps under his belt.

San Francisco Unicorns have lost their previous match against Texas Super Kings by 7 wickets.

San Francisco Unicorns batted first and they posted a total of 127 before being bowled out. Finn Allen got them off to a flier but his innings was very short lived as he got out after scoring 10 off 4 balls. Matthew Short also showed a lot of promise in his knock of 33 runs in 15 balls. He also threw his wicket away when his team needed him to stay until the end. After his dismissal, San Francisco Unicorns simply surrendered to the phenomenal bowling performance by Texas Super Kings and they were bowled out for a small total of 127. For Texas Super Kings Mohammad Mohsin picked up 4 wickets.

During the chase, Faf du Plessis and Devon Conway led the chase with good conviction. They scored 32 and 34 runs respectively to almost seal the deal in favor of Texas Super Kings. Mitchell Santner hit the winning runs as Texas Super Kings emerged victorious by 7 wickets.

Batting Stats T20

Let’s have a look at the squads:

San Francisco Unicorns- Pat Cummins, Qais Ahmad, Jake Fraser-McGurk, Matt Henry, Mackenzie Harvey, Lungi Ngidi, Brody Couch, Tajinder Singh, Josh Inglis, Matthew Wade, Jahmar Hamilton, Chaitanya Bishnoi, Smit Patel, David White, Corey Anderson, Finn Allen, Carmi le RouxLiam Plunkett, Sanjay Krishnamurthi, Haris Rauf, Shadab Khan

Los Angeles Knight Riders- Martin Guptill, Jaskaran Malhotra, Alex Carey, Spencer Johnson, Saif Badar, Ali Sheikh, Andre Russell, David Miller, Unmukt Chand, Bhaskar Yadram, Ali Khan, Rilee Rossouw, Shadley van Schalkwyk, Sunil Narine, Jason Roy, Shakib Al Hasan, Gajanand Singh, Lockie Ferguson, Adam Zampa, Nitish Kumar

Wicket Takers T20

* San Francisco Unicorns are 5th on the points table with 1 win and 1 loss. Their top run scorer is Matthew Short with 91 runs, and top wicket taker is Haris Rauf with 2 wickets. They lost their previous match against Texas Super Kings by 7 wickets.

Los Angeles Knight Riders and San Francisco Unicorns will lock horns in the Match 10 of Major League Cricket 2024 on Sunday, 14 July 2024, at Church Street Park, Morrisville. Keep reading to find out the Major League Cricket 2024 Match 10 LAKR vs SFU Dream11 Prediction Prediction Today.

In the sixth match of the Major League Cricket series, the Los Angeles Knight Riders scored 168 for 5 in their allotted 20 overs. The Seattle Orcas successfully chased down the target, achieving 169 for 1 in 19.5 overs. This remarkable performance led the Orcas to a convincing 9-wicket victory.

The Los Angeles Knight Riders put up a total of 168/5 in their 20 overs. Jason Roy led the charge with a well-played 69 off 52 balls. David Miller contributed an unbeaten 44 from 22 deliveries, while wicketkeeper Unmukt Chand added 18 runs off 21 balls. Among the bowlers, Spencer Johnson took 1 wicket for 28 runs in his 4 overs. In Match 7 of the Major League Cricket series, the San Francisco Unicorns were bowled out for 127 in 17.5 overs. The Texas Super Kings chased down the target, reaching 128 for 3 in just 12.5 overs, securing a 7-wicket victory.
