title: After World Cup Buzz, Major League Cricket Finds Footing in U.S.
body:
After many U.S. sports fans got their first taste of elite cricket during this summer’s ICC Men’s T20 World Cup hosted partially in Florida, New York, and Texas, the country’s burgeoning professional competition is making noticeable strides in its second season.

Major League Cricket will finish its 21-match schedule this week before a four-team playoff crowns a new champion. While the league has six teams from coast to coast, all matches have been played at two cricket-specific venues in Texas and North Carolina. Still, attendance is tracking to potentially surpass the 70,000 fans who showed up for the inaugural season in 2023.

MLC’s media rights are held by a niche cricket-focused channel called Willow by Cricbuzz. But the broadcaster struck deals with mainstream regional sports networks in each team’s market in an effort to attract more fans.

Dallas: Bally Sports Southwest

Los Angeles: Bally Sports SoCal

Washington, D.C.: Monumental Sports Network

San Francisco: NBC Sports Bay Area

Seattle: Root Sports

New York: YES Network

Willow took a similar approach during the T20 World Cup to get more exposure.

Money Game

Teams in MLC operate under a $1.15 million salary cap. While that’s well under the roughly $12 million that franchises can spend annually in the world’s richest cricket competition, the Indian Premier League, it’s not far off from other global leagues like Cricket Australia ($2 million) and The Hundred ($1.3 million) in the U.K.

“The money is good. But also the product’s good,” says Liam Plunkett (above, far right), a bowler for the San Francisco Unicorns who was a member of the England team that won the 2019 Cricket World Cup. “I think if the product wasn’t rolled out and the standard wasn’t good, people wouldn’t be that interested in coming across.”

Plunkett has remained impressed with the quality of play two seasons in. “I think there were a lot of teething problems leading up to it, but when the competition started, it felt like you could be playing anywhere in the world,” he says.

Big Ambitions

Before this season, San Francisco made a splash when it signed Australia national team captain Pat Cummins to a four-year contract. Have those moves been difficult to make? “Surprisingly not,” Anand Rajaraman, a co-owner of the Unicorns, tells Front Office Sports. “I think everybody in the cricket world is excited about the possibility of the U.S. market.”

Plunkett echoes that sentiment. “There’s definitely opportunities,” he says of being in the U.S. “Are you looking to play some good cricket? But also, are you looking to do some business deals and build yourself even further as a brand?”
summary:
**League Progress**: The MLC is in its second season, with 21 matches scheduled to be completed this week, followed by a four-team playoff to determine the champion.

**Attendance and Viewership**: Despite all matches being played in two venues in Texas and North Carolina, attendance is expected to surpass the 70,000 fans from the inaugural season in 2023. The league has partnered with mainstream regional sports networks to broadcast games, potentially increasing viewership.

**Team Operations**: The six teams in the league operate under a $1.15 million salary cap, comparable to other global leagues like Cricket Australia and The Hundred in the UK.

**Player Experience**: Liam Plunkett, a bowler for the San Francisco Unicorns, praises the quality of play in the league, saying it feels like playing anywhere in the world. He also notes that the money is good, and the league offers opportunities for players to build their brand.

**Signings and Recruitment**: The league has made significant signings, including San Francisco's four-year contract with Australia national team captain Pat Cummins. Co-owner Anand Rajaraman notes that the cricket world is excited about the US market, making it relatively easy to attract top talent.

title: Meet The Billionaires Banking On An American Cricket League
body:
Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella, Reliance chairman Mukesh Ambani, and other deep-pocketed investors worth a collective $126 billion own franchises in Major League Cricket. But launching a new major sports league in the United States has long been a sticky wicket.

By Sofia Chierchio, Contributor

Inside a crowded cricket stadium in Bangalore, India, as the Indian Premier League prepared to begin its inaugural match in April 2008, Anurag Jain gazed at the owner’s balcony as a familiar Hindi song pumped up the many fans in attendance. “Someday, I want to play that song and stand on the balcony like that guy,” he recalls saying. “It wasn’t about vanity; it was about bringing this sport that my family and friends enjoyed together to [America]—my home.”

In India, cricket is widely considered the most popular sport in the country, both by participation and viewership. Yet as successful as it may be in the UK and other former British colonies, the sport has hardly gained a foothold in the United States. But the 62-year-old Jain—chairman of Access Healthcare, a Dallas-based healthcare company—and a group of deep-pocketed investors—including Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella, Reliance Industries chairman Mukesh Ambani, Indian actor Shah Rukh Khan and Jain’s co-owner, Texas real estate developer Ross Perot Jr.—are betting they can finally change that.

In 2019, American Cricket Enterprises (ACE), the San Francisco-based parent company of Major League Cricket (MLC), pledged $1 billion to develop the sport in the U.S. Three years later, MLC secured $120 million in funding. With just six teams—New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Seattle, Texas and Washington, DC—the inaugural 2023 season attracted some 70,000 fans across its games, generating an exceedingly modest $8 million in revenue. With its sophomore season, which began on July 5, underway, MLC is looking to capitalize on surging global interest in the sport, which was bolstered by Team USA’s upset of Pakistan in the Men’s T20 Cricket World Cup in June.

“We're very serious as a collective,” says former Microsoft executive Sanjay Parthasarathy, who co-owns the Seattle Orcas with Nadella. “We're seasoned businesspeople. So, we have a discipline, a business discipline. We're running this like a startup. We're pinching pennies. We've got to invest in the right places so we're not throwing money around for sure.”

MLC’s backers, many of whom are of Indian descent, don’t have to look too far to find a model for success. Established in 2008, the Indian Premier League (IPL) revolutionized cricket by adopting the T20 format, a shorter, more dynamic version of the game. Traditional cricket matches can last for days, but T20 cricket condensed the action into three and a half hours of energetic play, making it more appealing to a wider audience. And the value of IPL clubs has skyrocketed in recent years, with the average value of the league’s 10 teams crossing $1 billion in 2022, according to Forbes’ most recent valuations.

And much as Major League Soccer had to overcome the fact that American soccer fans can already watch the world’s best leagues in the United States, the MLC has to contend with an fanbase that is already tuning in to IPL matches on Willow TV, the main broadcaster of cricket in the US.

“The Commonwealth Diaspora has always looked at sports differently than the core American audience,” Parthasarathy says of the TV challenges. “There is an intersection between the diaspora and the hardcore American sports, so there’s a lot of opportunity to be tapped into. That’s the core; it doesn’t mean that’s where we end.”

For now, according to some owners, the goal for this season is simply to build on the product that debuted last year. The league also has a five-year broadcast partnership with Willow, its most substantial source of revenue. MLC also generates income from ticket sales and sponsorships, taking a page out of the Formula 1 playbook. “One of the biggest sources of income are the logos plastered on our jerseys,” Jain says. “In fact, I think we are the first team to get all of our logo spots sold this year, which I think is an amazing achievement.”

But if cricket is going to be successful in America, a massive investment in infrastructure is needed. Veteran Silicon Valley venture capitalist Anand Rajaraman, co-owner of the San Francisco Unicorns, estimates that a single purpose-built stadium in the Bay Area would cost at least $30 million.

“You’ve got to have world-class places where people can train and play,” Parthasarathy emphasizes. “You can’t play on a baseball diamond because one of the big aspects of cricket is the pitch. It’s got to be well done and done the right way. Those facilities are really important, and I see that happening over the next 10 years.”

In addition to infrastructure for stadiums, many MLC owners believe that attracting a broader cricket audience goes hand-in-padded-glove with cultivating domestic talent. According to MLC rules, of the 11 cricketers on the pitch, at least five must be American players. Sanjay Govil, founder of the Maryland-based Infinite Computer Solutions and owner of the Washington Freedom, believes this strategy allows homegrown talent to learn from some of the best international coaches and players.

Cricket is expected to get another major boost when it makes its Olympic return in 2028 after a 128-year hiatus. Taking place in Los Angeles, the increased attention could be monumental in growing the new league.

“I think it's extremely important that the world sees cricket at that stage,” Jain claims. “You’ll see how cricket grows because of the Olympics, but most important to us, it's coming here, it's coming to our country.”

MORE FROM FORBES

ForbesIPL Cricket Team Values Would Soar With A $30 Billion Saudi InvestmentForbesThe World's Most Valuable Soccer Teams 2024
summary:
* The MLC has attracted deep-pocketed investors including Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella, Reliance Industries chairman Mukesh Ambani, and others, with a collective net worth of $126 billion.
* The inaugural 2023 season of MLC had six teams and generated $8 million in revenue from 70,000 fans.
* The league has secured $120 million in funding and aims to capitalize on the growing global interest in cricket.
* MLC is looking to follow the success of the Indian Premier League (IPL), which has revolutionized cricket with the T20 format and has a team value of over $1 billion.
* The league faces challenges in attracting a broader audience, including competing with the IPL, which is already popular in the US.
* To overcome this, MLC is focusing on building a strong product, generating revenue from ticket sales, sponsorships, and broadcast partnerships with Willow TV.
* The league also aims to invest in infrastructure, including building purpose-built stadiums, and cultivating domestic talent, with at least five American players required on each team.
* The return of cricket to the Olympics in 2028, hosted in Los Angeles, is expected to give the sport a major boost and help grow the MLC.

title: Los Angeles Knight Riders vs MI New York Preview & Prediction
body:
Click here for today’s sports betting tips from our expert analysts!

Defeat here for MI New York would knock the reigning champions out of Major League Cricket this year, but victory by enough of a margin to swing the net-run-rate deficit their way would send them into the play-offs at Los Angeles Knight Riders’ expense.

DATE & TIME: Sunday 21st July 2024 - USA ET – 8:30pm / USA PT – 5:30pm / West Indies – 7:30pm / Monday 22nd July 2024 - UK – 1:30am / South Africa – 2:30am / Pakistan - 5:30am / India – 6:00am / Bangladesh – 6:30am / Australia – 10:30am

VENUE: Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas, Texas, United States

WEATHER: Despite high temperatures, there is a chance of thundery showers across the scheduled hours of play.

HOW TO WATCH ON TV: USA – Willow TV / West Indies – TBA / UK – TNT Sports / South Africa – ESPN / Pakistan – A Sports / India – Sony Sports / Bangladesh – TBA / Australia – TBA

HOW TO WATCH ONLINE: USA – Willow TV / West Indies – TBA / UK – discovery+ / South Africa – ESPN+ app / Pakistan – A Sports / India – Sony LIV / Bangladesh – TBA / Australia & New Zealand – Amazon Prime Video

LOS ANGELES KNIGHT RIDERS FORM: ONE MORE WIN ENOUGH TO GUARANTEE ELIMINATOR SPOT.

This season has been an improvement from Los Angeles Knight Riders, but they still have one more hurdle to overcome if they are to avoid a second consecutive Major League Cricket season in which they miss the play-offs. It underlines further the importance of their victory last time out over Seattle Orcas.

LAST THREE: WLA

MI NEW YORK FORM: A REVERSAL OF FORTUNES ESSENTIAL TO SAVE THEIR SEASON.

Losing three games on the spin heading into this final group game has left MI New York on the outside looking in and even beating the Knight Riders here may not be enough for them to break into the top four. A significant net-run-rate swing is also required for them to overhaul Los Angeles.

LAST THREE: LLL

LOS ANGELES KNIGHT RIDERS BETTING ANALYSIS

Experience is key for Los Angeles Knight Riders in a contest of such magnitude, which could see bettors turn to all-rounder Andre Russell when it comes to investing in their players here. Russell offers value in multiple markets but with MINY forced to play aggressively with the bat in a bid to pile up quick runs, this may play to the strengths of the West Indian. His variations make backing him to accumulate 2+ wickets a shrewd play.

Jason Roy is a player that can so often get whatever team he plays for off to a good start and LAKR will hope for the same on this occasion. Roy struck 27 in a win over rock-bottom Seattle Orcas and even if he wasn’t to gain a really big score, even a cameo could be crucial. Therefore, consider backing Roy to put up over 23.5 match runs.

MI NEW YORK BETTING ANALYSIS

We’ve highlighted the big-hitting abilities of Dewald Brevis previously and the young South African didn’t let bettors down against San Francisco Unicorns last time out, striking 56 from 36 balls. Brevis cleared the boundary rope three times and stakes on him to not only score 20+ runs here, but also to hit over 0.5 match sixes has to be favoured in a must-win game.

Trent Boult’s potency with the ball will be crucial both in the powerplay and the death. Early wickets especially has to be seen as essential for MI New York as they look to overhaul their net-run-rate deficit and the left-arm point of difference that Boult provides is ideal on this front. Back the New Zealander to take over 1.5 match wickets here as he did in his last appearance.

LOS ANGELES KNIGHT RIDERS VS MI NEW YORK EXPERT PREDICTION

MI New York has no choice but to play fearlessly and aggressively, knowing that they not only need to win here, but win well to overturn the net-run-rate deficit between them and Los Angeles Knight Riders. This could go one of two ways, with either a fired-up and focused MINY blowing away their opponents, or reckless cricket ultimately costing them due to their hand being essentially forced.

But it’s important to note that LAKR don’t have prior success in this tournament and a bad start here could see doubts creep into the heads of their players. Whereas MINY have been there, done that and won the whole thing, so when it comes to the crunch win or bust games, they know how to get the job done. With that in mind, backing MI New York to win should be seriously considered, the question is whether it will be by enough of a margin to see them through to the play-offs.

title: Why Cummins 'jumped at' MLC and 'hadn't thought' of the Hundred
body:
It's not just about the cricket or the money, Cummins explains, but the opportunity to think about his career after cricket

Matt Roller

22-Jul-2024 • 6 hrs ago

1:50

Cummins: MLC is giving cricketers a platform in the US

Pat Cummins does not make Major League Cricket sound like a tough sell. "It was like, 'do you want to come to the US for a few weeks in summer, be around a team where I'm good mates with a few of the guys, play a bit of golf and play a bit of cricket in a new country'," he tells ESPNcricinfo from Dallas. "I jumped at it."

Yet his lucrative four-year contract with San Francisco Unicorns was a paradigm of change in the cricket world. Cummins had only previously played in one overseas T20 league - the IPL - but his interest was piqued by the identity of the franchise's owners: Anand Rajaraman and Venky Harinarayan, a pair of India-born venture capitalists based in California.

Five injury-ruined years early in his career made Cummins acutely aware that professional sport is transitory. He studied business at Sydney's University of Technology during his prolonged rehabilitation, sits on the Australian Cricketers' Association's board of directors, and has used his platform to advocate for action on climate change.

It is why the owners' Silicon Valley background was the clincher for him. "It's a space that I find super interesting, particularly the venture-capital world," Cummins says. "I potentially see that as something I'd like to do more of post-cricket, so [this is] a way to align with a few of those guys, learn off them over the next few years, be around some of those conversations."

The tournament effectively provides him with a chance to network: since arriving in the US, Cummins has already "informally" discussed potential opportunities over coffee. "If it's something I do enjoy, hopefully I could dive a little bit deeper for the back-end of my career, and then maybe move into that space a bit more professionally after cricket."

"For the guys that play all three formats, you're always trying to make sure you're peaking for those major events - and it feels like there's been about ten major events in the last 18 months, so I haven't really taken much time to reinvest back in my body"

Pat Cummins

Cummins' contract with Unicorns runs until 2027. By then, he will be 34 and closer to the end of his international career. "The intention is definitely to make this a long-term partnership," he says. "Obviously playing for Australia, it's going to clash at certain times. But outside of that, I want to make sure MLC is a real focus."

MLC remains at a nascent stage, with just 25 matches shared across two venues. But its combination of high salaries, a short window, and the novelty of playing in the US have proved attractive. Its pool of overseas players comfortably outstrips that of rival leagues, including the Hundred in England. "I hadn't thought of the Hundred," Cummins admits.

Cummins makes it clear that, as Test and ODI captain, "playing for Australia will come first". Cricket Australia only made him available for four out of six MLC group games this year to manage his workload after the T20 World Cup, and his availability for the 2025 edition will depend on a potential clash with a two-match Test series in the Caribbean.

He has also been rested for Australia's white-ball tour to Scotland and England in September, giving him a prolonged break ahead of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Tellingly, that decision received minimal pushback.

"Everyone's a little bit more realistic about the schedules nowadays," Cummins says. "We spend ten-plus months of the year away on the road, so some tours probably carry a little bit more importance than others. For the guys that play all three formats, you're always trying to make sure you're peaking for those major events - and it feels like there's been about ten major events in the last 18 months, so I haven't really taken much time to reinvest back in my body."

1:38

Cummins explains why he will miss the September tour to England

Josh Hazlewood and Mitchell Starc are part of September's tour, but Cummins had long planned to miss it. "That window has always been earmarked as a time to really give my body a rest and do close to a full pre-season," he explains. "I should get six or eight weeks off bowling and then build up again. Once this MLC opportunity came up and we mapped out the plan, it didn't really change much.

"I still get that same amount of break and then just probably start one or two weeks later heading into the summer… I'll get home, I'll have a good six or eight weeks off bowling where I'll get in the gym every day, do some running, and get some strength back into my body. And then we've got a big Test match series [against India] for our home summer, so that'll be the focus."

Cummins has only taken one wicket in three MLC appearances, but has helped Unicorns seal a top-two finish, closing out a win over MI New York on Friday night. "It's a really high standard," he says. "The calibre of players is ridiculous and for a competition in its second season, it's super organised and super competitive… I couldn't speak highly enough of it."

Australia played exclusively in the Caribbean during the T20 World Cup, but Cummins watched the US leg with interest: "That Pakistan-India game looked insane… everyone talks about baseball, basketball and NFL, but there's hundreds of thousands of cricketers here going about their work quietly who are now starting to get a platform."

Unicorns' long-term ambition is to bring MLC to California, with plans to build a stadium in San Jose. "Hopefully that will be ready to go in the next couple of years, and I'll be coming back to San Fran a lot," Cummins says. That sentence alone from Australia's captain is proof that cricket has changed for good.

Matt Roller is an assistant editor at ESPNcricinfo. @mroller98
summary:
* Australian cricketer Pat Cummins has signed a four-year contract with San Francisco Unicorns in the MLC, a decision influenced by the franchise's venture-capitalist owners from Silicon Valley, with whom he wants to learn and network.
* Cummins views MLC as an opportunity to think about his career after cricket, potentially moving into the venture-capital space.
* MLC offers high salaries, a short window, and the novelty of playing in the US, making it attractive to players. The tournament has a strong pool of overseas players, surpassing rival leagues like the Hundred in England.
* Cummins will prioritize playing for Australia, but aims to make MLC a long-term focus, with his contract running until 2027.
* The tournament is still in its early stages, with only 25 matches played across two venues, but has been well-organized and competitive.
* The Unicorns' long-term plan is to bring MLC to California, with a proposed stadium in San Jose, which Cummins hopes to see come to fruition in the next couple of years.

title: MLC 2024 Playoff Qualification Scenario: How Can Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York Qualify For The Last Playoff Spot?
body:
MLC 2024 Playoff Scenario: The 2024 season of the Major League Cricket (MLC) is heading towards its business end with three of the four playoff slots already sealed. Washington Freedom, San Francisco Unicorns and Texas Super Kings have already sealed a place for themselves in the final four, there is a place still up for grabs while two teams Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) and MI New York (MINY) remain in contention.

READ HERE | Major League Cricket 2024: Live Streaming Details, Time, Date, Squads - All You Need To Know

Major League Cricket (MLC 2024) Playoff Qualification Scenario

As things stand, Los Angeles Knight Riders find themselves at the fourth place on the MLC 2024 points table with 5 points from 6 matches while MI New York are placed at the fifth place on the table with 3 points from 6 matches.

For a final spot in MLC 2024, it will be a direct clash between the two teams as they take on each other at the Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas in match number 19 of the tournament.

ALSO READ | Major League Cricket 2024 Complete List Of Fixtures

MI New York will, however, not only have to win but win by a good margin to better Los Angeles Knight Riders' net run rate (NRR). Currently, while Los Angeles Knight Riders' NRR is -0.569, MI New York's NRR is -0.851.

San Francisco Unicorns vs Washington Freedom, Texas Super Kings vs Seattle Orcas are the other remaining league-stage matches of MLC 2024 after which the MLC 2024 Playoff matches will start.

The team that finishes third and fourth will play the Eliminator while the teams that finish first and second play the Qualifier 1. There will be another match between the team that loses Qualifier and the side that wins the Eliminator to decide the second semifinalist. The winner of the first qualifier will await them in the summit clash.
summary:
**Current Playoff Scenario:**

* Three teams have already qualified for the playoffs: Washington Freedom, San Francisco Unicorns, and Texas Super Kings.
* One playoff spot is still available, with Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) and MI New York (MINY) in contention.

**Remaining League Matches:**

* Los Angeles Knight Riders vs MI New York (Match 19) at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas - a direct clash for the final playoff spot.
* San Francisco Unicorns vs Washington Freedom and Texas Super Kings vs Seattle Orcas are the other remaining league-stage matches.

**Playoff Format:**

* The teams that finish third and fourth will play the Eliminator.
* The teams that finish first and second will play Qualifier 1.
* The loser of Qualifier 1 will play the winner of the Eliminator to decide the second semifinalist.
* The winner of Qualifier 1 will await the winner of the second semifinalist in the final.

**Key Statistical Note:**

* MI New York needs to win by a good margin to better Los Angeles Knight Riders' net run rate (NRR) in order to secure the final playoff spot.

title: Major League Cricket 2024 - Match 19, LAKR vs MINY- Cricket Betting Tips and Match Predictions: July 21st
body:
Here are the Fantasy Cricket Predictions and Betting Tips for the Major League Cricket Match 19- LA Knight Riders vs MI New York, which will be played on the 21st of July at the Grand Prairie Stadium, Texas.

Points Table

Match 19- LA Knight Riders vs MI New York (Grand Prairie Stadium, Texas)

Current Form LA Knight Riders:

LA Knight Riders are currently placed at the 4th position on points table with 2 wins and 3 losses to their credit.

The top run scorer for LA Knight Riders in the Major League Cricket is Unmukt Chand with 149 runs to his name.

The top wicket taker for LA Knight Riders in the Major League Cricket is Spencer Johnson with 8 scalps under his belt.

LA Knight Riders have won their previous match against Seattle Orcas by 4 wickets.

Seattle Orcas batted first and they posted a total of 142 for 6 in 20 overs. Except for Ryan Rickelton, no other batter showed any promise whatsoever. The big names like Quinton de Kock, Heinrich Klaasen and Aaron Jones, all failed to get going. Rickelton smashed 89 off 52 balls but he barely got any support at the other end. Once he got out in the 19th over, it was all clear that Orcas will not reach a decent total. They were littled and only scored 142 in 20 overs of play.

During the chase, Sunil Narine as usual got out cheaply. Jason Roy tried his best to take control but he consumed too many balls for his knock of 27 runs. A real game changing innings was played by Unmukt Chand, who smashed 62 runs off 47 balls. He was aided by the lower order batters who contributed healthily and helped LA Knight Riders get over the line in the 20th over with 4 wickets in hand.

Batting Stats T20

Current Form MI New York:

MI New York are currently placed at the 5th position on points table with 1 win and 4 losses to their credit.

The top run scorer for MI New York in the Major League Cricket is Nicholas Pooran with 137 runs to his name.

The top wicket taker for MI New York in the Major League Cricket is Rashid Khan with 7 scalps under his belt.

MI New York have lost their previous match against San Francisco Unicorns by a small margin of 3 runs.

San Francisco Unicorns batted first and they posted a total of 148 for 7 in 20 overs. The top order struggled a lot. Their prime form batters including Matthew Short and Josh Inglis got out cheaply. They were under a lot of pressure from that moment on. The middle order of San Francisco Unicorns came good as Corey Anderson and Hassan Khan smashed 59 and 44 runs respectively to help San Francisco Unicorns get to a strong total of 148 in 20 overs of play.

During the chase, MI New York lost Ruben Clinton quite early into the innings. Dewald Brevis played like a champion and he smashed 56 runs off 36 balls. He instilled the hope for a successful chase. Nicholas Pooran also supported him well, he scored 26 runs but consumed too many balls to get going. It cost the team dearly. The rest of the middle order batters including Romario Shepherd and Monank Patel failed terribly and despite the efforts of Heath Richards, who smashed 24 off 13 balls, Seattle Orcas failed to achieve the target and fell short by 3 runs in the end.

Wicket Takers T20
summary:
**Match 19: LA Knight Riders vs MI New York**

* The match will be played on July 21st at the Grand Prairie Stadium, Texas.
* Current standings: LA Knight Riders are 4th on the points table with 2 wins and 3 losses, while MI New York are 5th with 1 win and 4 losses.

**LA Knight Riders**

**MI New York**

title: MLC 2024 Updated Points Table & Most Runs, Wickets List After Seattle vs San Francisco Match
body:
MLC 2024 Updated Points Table & Most Runs, Wickets List: San Francisco Unicorns (SFU) defeated Seattle Orcas (SOR) by six wickets on July 21 (As per the Indian Standard Time) at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas in the 18th match of the ongoing Major League Cricket (MLC) season 2024. With their victory, San Francisco Unicorns have secured a top-2 finish and have also propelled Texas Super Kings into the playoffs. Seattle Orcas, on the other hand, become the first team to be eliminated from the MLC 2024, leaving MI New York and the LA Knight Riders to battle for the final playoff spot.

SFU won the toss and opted to bowl first and batting first, SOR faced the worst possible start as they lost two wickets on the first two balls of the match. Ryan Rickelton and Aaron Jones fell on consecutive deliveries by SFU’s Carmi le Roux. With the help of Quinton de Kock’s 66-run knock and contributions from Shehan Jayasuriya and Shubham Ranjane, SOR posted the total of 152-7 in 20 overs.

ALSO ON ABP Live | Indian Men's Hockey Team Arrives In Paris For 2024 Olympics, Eyes First Gold Medal In 44 Years

title: Los Angeles Knight Riders vs MI New York highlights: MI New York beat Los Angeles Knight Riders 4 wickets
body:
Right then, that was it from our coverage of the nail-biting qualification match between MI New York and Los Angeles Knight Riders. It was MI New York who took home the win and qualified in the fourth spot for the playoffs. However, we will be back with more coverage of the Major League cricket on 23rd July. It will be a top-of-the-table clash between San Francisco Unicorns and Washington Freedom. The first ball will be bowled at 6 am IST (12.30 am GMT) but our coverage will start much earlier. Until then, goodbye and cheers!

Kieron Pollard the skipper of MI New York is up for a chat. He says that he is happy and congratulates his entire team for their performance. Adds that they were good with the bat in this tournament but the results were not in their favor. Mentions that this win was a complete team performance and it gave a lot of confidence to everyone. Ends by saying that their hard work paid off and will perform well further as well.

Sunil Narine, the captain of the Los Angeles Knight Riders is up for a chat. He says that they were some runs short and the innings by Pooran and Pollard took the game away from them. Jokes that he will have to improve his skills at the toss. Adds that batting first is always tough but it was a good tournament for them. Mentions that they tried their best and appreciates his bowlers for giving it their all. Ends by saying that they will keep fighting and that he is happy with the team balance.

Rashid Khan is the Player of the Match for his impactful bowling spell. He says that the win was a much needed one. Adds that the wickets he took were crucial. Adds that it was all about bowling in the right areas and that went well. Says that everything went perfect for him. Ends by saying that they will look to carry on with the momentum and try to win the next game.

Earlier in the innings, we saw the Los Angeles Knight Riders batters struggling against MI New York. Trent Boult, Nosthush Kenjige, and Rashid Khan got wickets and put the Knight Riders in a tough spot. However, a late boost by Andre Russell took them to a competitive total and gave some relief to their bowlers.

Nicholas Pooran says that he is happy with the win and they believed. Adds that they have been in similar situations before and they did well. He says that Kieron Pollard played the role of finisher well and he has all the experience. Ends by saying that they will give their best in the playoffs.

Los Angeles Knight Riders executed their plan well. The pacers troubled the batters initially and Spencer Johnson gave them the opening wicket. Corne Dry soon followed and cleared the path for the rest of the bowlers. Sunil Narine and Andre Russell put further pressure with quick wickets. Johnson was shown a glimpse of vintage Pollard and that over, changed the momentum of the game. Ali Khan got rid of Pooran but the damage was already done. They couldn't make the cut this year but will hope to make a strong comeback next year.

MI New York had a struggling start to their innings. They had to chase down the target in 18.2 over to qualify and Ruben Clinton couldn’t get going. He succumbed under pressure and so did Dewald Brevis. Nicholas Pooran couldn’t find an ideal partner to attack from both ends as Monank Patel, Heath Richards, and Romario Shepherd also crumbled under pressure. Kieron Pollard was at his best and he hit three sixes in Spencer Johnson’s one over to get his team right back in the game. In the end, Rashid Khan and Kieron Pollard sealed the game in their favor. The defending champions will once again have the chance to compete for the coveted trophy.

MI NEW YORK HAVE MANAGED TO QUALIFY FOR THE PLAYOFFS! After a struggling run so far, the team in blue have made the cut when it mattered the most. The Los Angeles Knight Riders will have to try again next year as the top 4 are sealed in now.

4

Overs16.6

Score134 - 6

Corne Dry to Rashid Khan, FOUR! MI New York have qualified for the play-offs! On a length and on the pads. Rashid Khan gets a faint edge on it and the ball races away to the fine leg fence for a boundary.

0

Overs16.1

Score128 - 6

Corne Dry to Kieron Pollard, Short and on off, Kieron Pollard slaps it back towards the bowler who just manages to get t his right hand to it and drops it. A difficult chance though.

Time Out! MI New York have lost Nicholas Pooran here but it won't matter much. They just need 5 runs off 16 balls to qualify for the playoffs. Rashid Khan comes on the crease now.

W

Overs15.4

Score126 - 6

Ali Khan to Nicholas Pooran, OUT! LBW! The finger goes up and Nicholas Pooran refers again. Length and on middle, Nicholas Pooran looks to slog it but misses and the ball hits his pads. A loud appeal and the finger goes up. Nicholas Pooran refers. Ultra Edge shows no spike and Ball Tracking shows three reds.

6

Overs14.5

Score117 - 5

Spencer Johnson to Kieron Pollard, SIX! Hang on, it's not over yet! Three in a row from Kieron Pollard! Spencer Johnson lands it full and around off, Kieron Pollard is severe on it. He flicks it over square leg for the third six in a row.

1lb

Overs14.2

Score99 - 5

Spencer Johnson to Nicholas Pooran, Length and on leg, sliding away, Nicholas Pooran looks to flick it but misses as it hits the back of his pads. An appeal but turned down. Sunil Narine refers and the replays show that it was missing leg. NOT OUT decision stands! They collect a leg bye.

0

Overs13.5

Score97 - 5

Sunil Narine to Nicholas Pooran, Safe! Flatter one, angling in, on middle and leg, Nicholas Pooran looks to block it but misses. A loud appeal and the finger goes up. He refers. Replays show that there was an inside edge. The onfield decision is reversed to NOT OUT!

W

Overs13.2

Score91 - 5

Sunil Narine to Romario Shepherd, OUT! TAKEN! Another done bites the dust. Lands it outside off, Romario Shepherd looks to play a reverse sweep but gets a top edge. The ball lobs towards Andre Russell at short fine. He takes an easy catch.

W

Overs12.1

Score78 - 4

Andre Russell to Heath Richards, OUT! CAUGHT! Andre Russell strikes on his very first ball. On a length and on off, Heath Richards looks to loft it but the ball hits the upper part of his bat. It goes in the air towards long on. David Miller settles under it and takes a sitter.

0

Overs11.6

Score78 - 3

Sunil Narine to Nicholas Pooran, Full and on middle. Nicholas Pooran blocks it out. That was a good over for MI New York they need to keep the momentum going.

0

Overs11.4

Score77 - 3

Sunil Narine to Heath Richards, Full and angling into the pads. Heath Richards had no clue how to play that one and gets rapped on his front pad.
summary:
* MI New York has qualified for the playoffs by defeating Los Angeles Knight Riders in a nail-biting qualification match.
* Kieron Pollard, the captain of MI New York, credited the team's win to a complete team performance and expressed confidence in their ability to perform well in the playoffs.
* Sunil Narine, the captain of Los Angeles Knight Riders, acknowledged that his team was short on runs and praised his bowlers for their effort.
* Rashid Khan was awarded the Player of the Match for his impactful bowling spell, which helped MI New York secure the win.
* The match saw MI New York struggle initially, but a late boost by Andre Russell and a strong finish by Kieron Pollard and Rashid Khan helped them win the game.
* The next match will be a top-of-the-table clash between San Francisco Unicorns and Washington Freedom on July 23rd.

Overall, the article highlights the exciting qualification match between MI New York and Los Angeles Knight Riders, with MI New York ultimately emerging victorious and securing a spot in the playoffs.

title: MI New York secure final playoff spot with Pollard's power show, eliminating LA Knight Riders
body:
Defending champions MI New York (MINY) secured a spot in the Cognizant Major League Cricket 2024 playoffs with a comfortable 4-wicket victory over the LA Knight Riders (LAKR), who were eliminated based on net run rate.

Match Summary

Los Angeles Knight Riders vs MI New York, Match 19

Los Angeles Knight Riders 130/10 (19.1 ov)

MI New York 134/6 (17 ov)

MI New York won by 4 wickets

SCORECARD

Runrate

Match Analysis

After the bowlers restricted the Knight Riders to 130 at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Sunday, the experience of Kieron Pollard and Nicholas Pooran got the side over the line.

Dewald Brevis (27) provided MINY with a strong start on the batting front. Pooran then anchored most of the chase with an innings of 35 for 28, before being caught LBW by Ali Khan.

However, the finishing touch came from Pollard, who showcased his immense power by smashing three consecutive sixes off Spencer Johnson, effectively sealing the game. He finished with an unbeaten 33 off just 12 balls, striking the ball at a rate of 275, to seal the win.

Earlier, MI New York justified the decision to bowl first after delivering an exceptional bowling performance to bolster their playoff ambitions. They dominated from the powerplay on a slightly slow surface.

Jason Roy started well with a 23-ball 27 at the top, but the Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) struggled to find momentum, with a series of single-digit scores plaguing their middle order.

MINY's bowlers maintained tight lines and lengths, making it difficult for LAKR to break free during the middle overs. Rashid Khan and Trent Boult turned back the clock with their strong showcase, as regular wickets further hampered LAKR's progress, and they appeared on the verge of a subpar total. However, a late onslaught by Russell, who hammered a quickfire 35 from just 21 balls, salvaged the innings and pushed LAKR to a somewhat respectable 130.

With this victory, MINY have completed the playoffs lineup and will now face the Texas Super Kings in what promises to be a thrilling Eliminator clash.

**Key Performers**

MINY will face the Texas Super Kings in the Eliminator clash in the playoffs.

title: MLC 2024: Kieron Pollard stars to take MI New York to Playoffs, Los Angeles Knight Riders Eliminated
body:
oi-Sauradeep Ash

Defending Champions MI New York (MINY) left it late but ultimately secured their place in the Cognizant Major League Cricket 2024 playoffs with a comfortable 4-wicket victory over the LA Knight Riders (LAKR), who have been eliminated on net run rate.

After the bowlers restricted the Knight Riders to 130 at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Monday, the experience of Kieron Pollard and Nicholas Pooran got the side over the line.

Dewald Brevis (27) provided MINY with a strong start on the batting front. Pooran then anchored most of the chase with an innings of 35 for 28, before being caught LBW by Ali Khan.

However, the finishing touch came from Pollard, who showcased his immense power by smashing three consecutive sixes off Spencer Johnson, effectively sealing the game. He finished with an unbeaten 33 off just 12 balls, striking at a rate of 275, to seal the win.

Earlier, MI New York justified the decision to bowl first after delivering an exceptional bowling performance to bolster their playoff ambitions. They dominated from the powerplay on a slightly slow surface.

Jason Roy started well with a 23-ball 27 at the top, but the Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) struggled to find momentum, with a series of single-digit scores plaguing their middle order.

MINY's bowlers maintained tight lines and lengths, making it difficult for LAKR to break free during the middle overs. Rashid Khan and Trent Boult turned back the clock with their strong showcase, as regular wickets further hampered LAKR's progress, and they appeared on the verge of a subpar total. However, a late onslaught by Russell, who hammered a quickfire 35 from just 21 balls, salvaged the innings and pushed LAKR to a somewhat respectable 130.

MLC 2024 Playoffs

With this victory, MINY have completed the playoffs lineup and will now face the Texas Super Kings in what promises to be a thrilling Eliminator clash. On the other hand, Washington Freedom will take on San Francisco Unicorns in the Qualifier 1.

Brief Scores: MI New York (Nicholas Pooran 35, Kieron Pollard 33, Sunil Narine 2/24) beat LA Knight Riders (Jason Roy 27, Andre Russell 35, Rashid Khan 3/22) by 4 wickets.

(An Excerpt from Agency)

**Match Result:** Defending champions MI New York (MINY) secured a 4-wicket victory over LA Knight Riders (LAKR) in a Cognizant Major League Cricket 2024 match, ensuring their place in the playoffs.

**Playoff Scenario:** MINY will face Texas Super Kings in the Eliminator clash, while Washington Freedom will take on San Francisco Unicorns in Qualifier 1.

**Key Performances:**

* Nicholas Pooran scored 35 off 28 balls for MINY
* Kieron Pollard finished with an unbeaten 33 off 12 balls, striking at a rate of 275
* Rashid Khan took 3/22 for MINY
* Andre Russell scored a quickfire 35 from 21 balls for LAKR

title: MLC 2024 Playoff Scenario: How can Knight Riders and MI Qualify for the Last Playoff Spot?
body:
oi-Sauradeep Ash

The 2nd season of the Major League Cricket is entering its business stage as three teams have qualified for the playoffs.

Washington Freedom and San Francisco Unicorns have qualified for the playoffs and have the top two places sorted. They will now play in the Qualifier 1. Texas Super Kings have also managed to get to the playoffs.

Out of the Six teams, four teams are to advance to the playoffs. Seattle Orcas are already eliminated, and now Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) and MI New York (MINY) will fight out for the solitary remaining spot.

MLC 2024 Playoff Qualification Scenario

Los Angeles Knight Riders are currently placed 4th in the table with 5 points in six matches. MI New York are 5th in the table with 3 points in six matches.

It will be a direct battle between LAKR and MINY as they take on each other in their final group stage match on Monday (July 22). New York has the Net Run Rate (NRR) of -0.851, while LAKR currently has an NRR of -0.569.

How can LAKR qualify for MLC 2024 Playoffs?

A win for the LA Knight Riders ensures their qualification to the playoffs. If the Knight Riders lost to MI New York, they can't lose by a margin of more than 10 runs.

How can MINY qualify for MLC 2024 Playoffs?

If MI New York bat first and score 200 runs, MI New York will have to win the match by a margin of more than 10 runs to get past LAKR's net run rate. After bowling out LAKR for 130 runs, MI New York will have to chase down the target within 18.2 overs to qualify for MLC playoffs.
summary: The 2nd season of the Major League Cricket is nearing its playoffs stage, with three teams (Washington Freedom, San Francisco Unicorns, and Texas Super Kings) already qualified. The top two teams, Washington Freedom and San Francisco Unicorns, will play in Qualifier 1. Seattle Orcas have been eliminated, and Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) and MI New York (MINY) are fighting for the remaining spot. LAKR and MINY will face off in their final group stage match on Monday, with LAKR needing a win to qualify or not losing by more than 10 runs if they lose. MINY, on the other hand, needs to bat first, score 200 runs, win by more than 10 runs, and chase down the target within 18.2 overs to overtake LAKR's net run rate and qualify for the playoffs.

title: Imad Wasim’s all-round performance in vain as San Francisco Unicorns knockout Seattle Orcas
body:
The San Francisco Unicorns clinched a decisive six-wicket victory over the Seattle Orcas in the 18th match of Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024.

Chasing a manageable target of 153 runs, the Unicorns showcased remarkable batting skills, securing the win with 5.4 overs to spare. This triumph earned the Unicorns a spot in the playoffs, while the Orcas were eliminated from the tournament.

After being put to bat first, the Orcas struggled to establish partnerships. Quinton de Kock was the standout performer, scoring a brisk 62 runs off 33 balls, featuring 8 fours and 3 sixes.

Despite his efforts, the rest of the batting lineup faltered, with the Orcas reaching 116-7 in 16 overs. Imad Wasim added a quick 17 runs off 11 balls, including two fours, to help the Orcas post a total of 152/7 in their 20 overs.

For the Unicorns, pacers Pat Cummins and Haris Rauf were expensive, with Cummins conceding 45 runs in four overs and Rauf giving away 32 runs in his four overs without taking a wicket. However, Carmi le Roux (3/14) and Hassan Khan (3/5) were the standout bowlers.

In response, the Unicorns had a flying start with a blistering opening partnership between Finn Allen and Matthew Short.

Imad Wasim managed to break the partnership by dismissing Short for 19. The Pakistan all-rounder ended with figures of 1-20 in fours overs.

Allen, who was named Player of the Match, played a scintillating innings, scoring 77 runs off just 30 balls, including 8 fours and 6 sixes.
summary:
* The San Francisco Unicorns won the 18th match of MLC 2024 against the Seattle Orcas by 6 wickets, securing a spot in the playoffs and eliminating the Orcas from the tournament.
* The Orcas scored 152/7 in 20 overs, with Quinton de Kock top-scoring with 62 runs off 33 balls.
* The Unicorns chased down the target with 5.4 overs to spare, thanks to a blistering opening partnership between Finn Allen and Matthew Short, and Allen's scintillating innings of 77 runs off 30 balls, earning him the Player of the Match award.
* Standout bowlers for the Unicorns included Carmi le Roux (3/14) and Hassan Khan (3/5).

title: MLC 2024: Finn Allen takes San Francisco Unicorns into the playoffs; knockout Seattle Orcas
body:
San Francisco Unicorns secured a convincing 6-wicket victory over Seattle Orcas in the 18th match of the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024. Chasing a modest target of 153 runs, the Unicorns displayed exceptional batting prowess to seal the win with 5.4 overs to spare.

With this win, the Unicorns have booked a place into the playoffs, while the Orcas are now officially out of the tournament.

Seattle Orcas falter despite Quinton de Kock’s blitz

Opting to bat first after losing the toss, the Orcas struggled to build partnerships. No. 3 Quinton de Kock was the lone bright spot, scoring a well-compiled 62 runs off just 33 balls, including 8 fours and 3 sixes. However, the rest of the batting lineup faltered, with only Shehan Jayasuriya (31 off 33) managing to cross the 30-run mark.

Veteran fast bowler Pat Cummins was expensive for the Unicorns, conceding 45 runs in his four overs, but the disciplined bowling attack, led by Carmi le Roux (3/14) and Hassan Khan (3/5), restricted the Orcas to a total of 152/7 in their 20 overs.

Also WATCH: Pat Cummins and Corey Anderson star in the comedy of errors on the pitch in MLC 2024

Finn Allen powers San Francisco Unicorns to victory

In reply, the Unicorns got off to a flying start thanks to a blistering opening partnership between Finn Allen and Matthew Short. Allen, the eventual Player of the Match, smashed a belligerent 77 runs off just 30 balls, peppering the boundaries with 8 fours and 6 towering sixes. While wickets fell at regular intervals after Allen’s departure, contributions from Josh Inglis (24 not out) and Sherfane Rutherford (17 off 8) ensured the Unicorns chased down the target comfortably in 14.2 overs, losing only 4 wickets.

“Yeah, I think the way Camie (le Roux) bowled at the top, we asked him to swing at the top, “ POTM Finn Allen said in the post-match presentation.

“I want to try and be aggressive at the top, put the bowlers under pressure.

“I went a tad too hard today, but it did help us to kill the game. The conditions were a bit balanced for both batters and bowlers.”

On the Unicorns finishing among the top 2, he said: “We’ll get an extra life… have [to compete against] Washington on Monday to finish the league games off.”
summary:
**Match Result:** San Francisco Unicorns won by 6 wickets against Seattle Orcas in the 18th match of MLC 2024.

**Score:** Seattle Orcas scored 152/7 in 20 overs, while San Francisco Unicorns chased down the target in 14.2 overs, losing only 4 wickets.

**Key Performances:**

* Quinton de Kock scored 62 runs off 33 balls for Seattle Orcas.
* Finn Allen scored 77 runs off 30 balls and was named Player of the Match for San Francisco Unicorns.
* Carmi le Roux took 3/14 and Hassan Khan took 3/5 for San Francisco Unicorns.

**Tournament Implications:** The win secured San Francisco Unicorns a spot in the playoffs, while Seattle Orcas are officially out of the tournament.

title: WATCH: Dwayne Bravo’s clever slower ball outsmarts Steve Smith in MLC 2024
body:
The Washington Freedom secured a convincing 42-run victory over the Texas Super Kings in the 17th match of Major League Cricket 2024 (MLC), played at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

Dwayne Bravo Fools Smith

On the fourth ball of the 18th over, with Washington’s score at 186/4, Dwayne Bravo delivered a decisive blow to Smith Smith. Facing the experienced Smith, Bravo bowls a slower delivery that proved a masterclass in deception.

Anticipating a faster ball, Smith had committed himself early and moved significantly outside off stump. Bravo’s slower ball was expertly disguised and delivered with precision, skirting close to the stumps. Brought off balance by the change of pace, Smith attempted to swipe across the line but missed entirely, his shot falling well short of connecting.

However, on the next delivery, he again used a subtle variation in pace and trajectory to induce an error from Smith. This time, Smith misjudged the ball and attempted a shot that resulted in a straightforward catch for Devon Conway behind the stumps. Smith’s innings ended at 57

Here is the video:

Also WATCH: Nosthush Kenjige takes a spectacular catch to dismiss Finn Allen in MLC 2024

Freedom batters shine

Asked to bat first, Washington Freedom posted a strong total of 206/5 on the board. Openers Travis Head and Steve Smith provided a solid foundation with their fifties. Head smashed a quickfire 53, while Smith anchored the innings with a composed 57.

Texas Super Kings were eventually bowled out for 164 in 19.5 overs, falling short of the target by a significant margin. Texas Super Kings’ chase faltered from the beginning. While Faf du Plessis (55) and Calvin Savage (35) offered some resistance, wickets fell regularly. Young spinner Noor Ahmad impressed with his control, taking 3-38, while the evergreen Bravo picked up 2-40 to keep the Texas batsmen in check.

Rachin Ravindra was the pick of the Washington Freedom bowlers, claiming 4-16 in a tidy spell. Jasdeep Singh also chipped in with three wickets.

This victory consolidates Washington Freedom’s position at the top of the MLC 2024 points table. They displayed strong batting and bowling performances to outplay the Texas Super Kings convincingly.
summary:
* In the 17th match of MLC 2024, the Washington Freedom defeated the Texas Super Kings by 42 runs at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.
* The Freedom batted first and scored 206/5, thanks to fifties from openers Travis Head (53) and Steve Smith (57).
* The Super Kings were bowled out for 164 in 19.5 overs, with Faf du Plessis scoring 55 and Calvin Savage contributing 35. 
* Washington Freedom's bowlers performed well, with Rachin Ravindra taking 4-16, Jasdeep Singh claiming 3 wickets, Noor Ahmad taking 3-38, and Dwayne Bravo picking up 2-40.
* This win consolidates Washington Freedom's position at the top of the MLC 2024 points table.

title: 5 Best spells in MLC 2024
body:
The 2024 Major League Cricket is in its final week and every match from here becomes crucial for all teams. Talking about crucial matches, the bowlers play an important role in big matches and help the team to win the tournament.

There have been some top performances by the bowlers in the ongoing season. In the following listicle, we will have a look at the top five bowling figures in MLC 2024.

Best bowling spells in MLC 2024

5. Saurabh Netravalkar - 4/35 against Los Angeles Knight Riders

Playing for Washington Freedom, Saurabh Netravalkar registered his best figures in the 2024 Major League Cricket. The left-arm pacer took four wickets by conceding 35 runs in 3.4 overs as Washington Freedom bowled Los Angeles Knight Riders for 129 runs in Morrisville on July 14th. Washington chased the target with ease in 16 overs at the loss of two wickets.

4. Ali Khan - 4/33 against Texas Super Kings

Ali Khan’s match-winning spell helped Los Angeles Knight Riders to register a 12-run win against Texas Super Kings in Dallas on July 5th. Defending a total of 162/7, LAKR restricted TSK for 150/8 with Ali taking four wickets, conceding 33 runs in four overs.

3. Lockie Ferguson - 4/26 against Seattle Orcas

Washington Freedom pacer, Lockie Ferguson registered the spell of 4/26 in a five-wicket win against Seattle Orcas in Dallas on July 11. Washington Freedom bowled out Seattle Orcas for 124 runs with Ferguson taking four wickets, conceding 26 runs in four overs. In reply, Washington chased the target in 18.2 overs at the loss of five wickets.

2. Rachin Ravindra - 4/16 against Texas Super Kings

Playing for Washington Freedom, Rachin Ravindra delivered one of the best spells in MLC 2024 in a match against Texas Super Kings in Dallas on July 19th. After posting 206/5 on board, Washington Freedom bowled TSK out for 164 in 19.5 overs with Ravindra taking four wickets in his 3.5 overs.

1. Mohammad Mohsin - 4/13 against San Francisco Unicorns

Texas Super Kings spinner has registered the best figures of MLC 2024 so far in a match against San Francisco Unicorns in Morrisville on July 10th. Batting first, San Francisco were bowled out for 12.5 overs, with Mohsin taking four wickets in 3.5 overs. In reply, TSK chased the target in 12.5 overs at the loss of three wickets.

title: Complete Major League Cricket (MLC) Centuries List
body:
Kicking off cricket in the United States of America has been a dream for many years and that dream was finally realised in 2023 when the first edition of the Major League Cricket (MLC) competition was played. And right from that first season, we saw big sixes, high scores, electrifying fielding, and much more.

While we’ve spoken about the top bowlers and batters in this league, we’re going to list down all Major League Cricket centuries on this page. Since it’s a global league with top T20 players signed from USA and around the world, you’ll find players from different countries being a part of the MLC centuries list. Keep reading for more details…

The first ever Major League Cricket century was scored by South Africa’s Heinrich Klaasen, proving why he’s known as one of the best cricketers in the world in this format. And right after him a few days later, we saw another highly sought T20 batter in Nicholas Pooran who bagged himself an MLC century, doing so in the all-important MLC 2023 final.

SEE ALSO: List of top online sports betting websites

Post that, we saw a couple of more South African players (Faf du Plessis and Ryan Rickelton) getting MLC centuries and when we last updated this page, there were a total of four (4) centuries in this league. See below for our Major League Cricket all centuries list, last updated 21st July 2024, towards the end of the MLC 2024 season:

Major League Cricket centuries list

Sr.NameTeamDateScore1Heinrich Klaasen 🇿🇦Seattle Orcas25 Jul 2023110(44)*2Nicholas Pooran MI New York30 Jul 2023137(55)*3Faf du Plessis 🇿🇦Texas Super Kings8 Jul 2024100(58)4Ryan Rickelton 🇿🇦Seattle Orcas9 Jul 2024103(66)*5TBDTBDTBDTBD

That century from Nicholas Pooran remains the best in the MLC tournament’s history for multiple reasons. Not only was it scored at a 250 strike rate but it came in an important final when his team was down initially. It’s also the highest score in MLC’s short history so far, getting 137* in just 55 deliveries.

Till date, Seattle Orcas is the only franchise to have multiple entries in the MLC centuries list thanks to tons from Klaasen and Rickelton. A few teams are few to enter this list but considering there’s plenty of successful seasons to come over the years, we expect more entries in this list over the years.

Three of the four centuries scored in this tournament have ended on a winning note while Faf’s centuries in MLC 2024 went in vain as the match was washed out due to rain after his century in the first innings. This page will be updated in real-time so for all updates on MLC centuries over the seasons, remember to stay tuned to ReadScoops.com.

Signup to CBET.gg and get 200% exclusive welcome sports bonus

summary:
**Overview**: The first edition of the MLC tournament was played in 2023, featuring big sixes, high scores, and electrifying fielding.

**Centuries**: The article lists the centuries scored in the MLC tournament as of July 2024. There are four centuries scored by four players: 

1. Heinrich Klaasen (South Africa) - 110* (44) for Seattle Orcas on July 25, 2023.
2. Nicholas Pooran (West Indies) - 137* (55) for MI New York in the MLC 2023 final on July 30, 2023.
3. Faf du Plessis (South Africa) - 100 (58) for Texas Super Kings on July 8, 2024.
4. Ryan Rickelton (South Africa) - 103 (66)* for Seattle Orcas on July 9, 2024.

**Notable Records**: Nicholas Pooran's century remains the highest score in MLC history, achieved at a strike rate of 250. Seattle Orcas is the only franchise with multiple centuries (by Klaasen and Rickelton). 

**Future Updates**: The article promises to update the list of centuries in real-time as the tournament progresses.

title: MLC 2024: San Francisco Unicorns vs Washington Freedom Match 20 Top 5 Bowlers to Bet On

title: Kieron Pollard Meets Fan Hit by Ball, Takes Selfie and Signs Autograph
body:
In the cricket world, cricket enthusiasts are enjoying another thrilling edition of the Major League Cricket. The entire USA is down in cricket fever. In the last match, LA Knight Riders and Mumbai Indians New York locked horns in the 19th match. But After the match, Kieron Pollard’s kind gesture to a fan grabbed the limelight.

MI New York Triumph over LA Knight Riders:

On the 19th match of the MLC 2024, MI New York and LA Knight Riders locked horns. After struggling in last few games, MI bounced back. In a crucial match for MI New York, their key players delivered to secure a spot in the MLC 2024 playoffs. Rashid Khan was outstanding with 3 wickets for 22 runs, limiting LAKR to 130 runs. MI New York chose to bowl first on a slow pitch, and Trent Boult made an early impact by dismissing Sunil Narine in his first over.

The dismissal of Unmukt Chand during the middle overs was crucial, given the importance of spin on the pitch. By the halfway point, LAKR struggled at 62 for 4. MI New York’s spinners combined for 5 wickets for 44 runs in eight overs, causing a collapse in the LAKR innings.

MI New York’s chase started well with Dewald Brevis scoring 27 off 19 balls, hitting five boundaries. However, both he and opening partner Ruben Clinton were out by the end of the 36-run PowerPlay. Kieron Pollard then sealed the victory with a powerful performance, smashing Spencer Johnson for three consecutive sixes.

Pollard’s Heart-Winning Gesture:

During the match, a ball hit a fan’s shoulder after Kieron Pollard hit a giant six. At the post-match presentation, Pollard inquired about the fan. Later, he met the fan, signed an autograph, and took a selfie with them. The video of this interaction went viral, winning the hearts of netizens.

Defending champions MI New York clinched a spot in the Major League Cricket 2024 playoffs with a solid 4-wicket win over the LA Knight Riders. This victory has finalized the playoffs lineup, setting up an exciting Eliminator match against the Texas Super Kings. The game will take place at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Thursday.
summary:
**Match Details**

* The 19th match of the MLC 2024 was played between LA Knight Riders and Mumbai Indians New York (MI New York).
* MI New York won the match by 4 wickets, securing a spot in the playoffs.

**Match Highlights**

* Rashid Khan took 3 wickets for 22 runs, limiting LA Knight Riders to 130 runs.
* Trent Boult dismissed Sunil Narine in his first over.
* Unmukt Chand's dismissal during the middle overs was crucial for MI New York.
* MI New York's spinners combined for 5 wickets for 44 runs in 8 overs, causing a collapse in the LA Knight Riders innings.
* Dewald Brevis scored 27 off 19 balls, hitting 5 boundaries, in MI New York's chase.
* Kieron Pollard sealed the victory with a powerful performance, smashing 3 consecutive sixes.

**Playoffs Update**

* MI New York has clinched a spot in the playoffs with this win.
* The playoffs lineup is finalized, with MI New York set to face the Texas Super Kings in the Eliminator match at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Thursday.

**Off-the-Field Gesture**

* Kieron Pollard showed a heartwarming gesture by inquiring about a fan who was hit by a ball during the match, signing an autograph, and taking a selfie with them, which went viral on social media.

title: WATCH: Glenn Maxwell’s switch hit falters against Rashid Khan during WAF vs MINY in MLC 2024
body:
In a thrilling encounter at the 2024 Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament, Australian all-rounder Glenn Maxwell lost his wicket to Afghanistan‘s Rashid Khan, trying a rash shot on a crucial game point. The match between Washington Freedom and MI New York saw Rashid’s guile and deception prove too much for the usually reliable Steve Smith and Maxwell.

Glenn Maxwell’s aggression goes in vain

Maxwell, known for his antics on the pitch, creative shots, and aggressive batting, has won many accolades with this style of play. However, Maxwell could not execute it in front of Rashid at that particular moment.

Afghanistan’s legendary spinner delivered a masterclass in spin bowling, dismissing Washington Freedom’s skipper Smith and the destructive Maxwell. Bowling over the wicket, Rashid deceived Maxwell’s creative gameplay with a normal googly, which the Australian batter failed to read. The ball sneaked past Maxwell’s bat, crashing into the stumps and providing a crucial breakthrough for MI New York.

Here’s the video

Match summary

Washington Freedom secured a convincing 94-run victory over MI New York in their MLC encounter, booking their place in the playoffs. Batting first, Washington Freedom posted a challenging total of 182/5 in their 20 overs, with Travis Head and Andries Gous scoring half-centuries. Despite losing Maxwell to a brilliant delivery from Rashid, Rachin Ravindra’s late onslaught propelled Washington Freedom to a competitive score.

In reply, MI New York’s batting lineup crumbled under the pressure, with only two batters reaching double digits. Jasdeep Singh was the pick of the bowlers for Washington Freedom, claiming 3/14 with his pace. The other pacers, Marco Jansen and Saurabh Netravalkar, also made crucial contributions, taking two wickets each.

Also WATCH: Imad Wasim’s stunning one-handed catch dismisses Mukhtar Ahmed during SEO vs WAF in MLC 2024

MI New York’s disappointing performance

MI New York’s batting lineup failed to fire, with only two batters reaching double digits. The top six batters managed scores of 0, 3, 4, 2, 4, and 4, which is unacceptable in a T20 chase. The pitch had some assistance for the fast bowlers, and Washington Freedom’s pacers took full advantage of it.

Washington Freedom’s all-round performance proved too much for MI New York, who struggled with both bat and ball. The victory secured Washington Freedom’s place in the playoffs and highlighted their potential to go all the way in the tournament.
summary:
**Match Result:** Washington Freedom defeated MI New York by 94 runs, securing their place in the playoffs.

**Key Performances:**

* Travis Head and Andries Gous scored half-centuries for Washington Freedom.
* Rachin Ravindra's late onslaught helped Washington Freedom post a competitive score.
* Jasdeep Singh was the pick of the bowlers for Washington Freedom, claiming 3/14 with his pace.
* Marco Jansen and Saurabh Netravalkar also made crucial contributions, taking two wickets each.
* Rashid Khan delivered a masterclass in spin bowling, dismissing Steve Smith and Glenn Maxwell with his guile and deception.

**Notable Moments:**

* Glenn Maxwell lost his wicket to Rashid Khan while trying a rash shot, showcasing Rashid's skill and deception.
* Washington Freedom's pacers took advantage of the pitch conditions, with Jasdeep Singh, Marco Jansen, and Saurabh Netravalkar making crucial contributions.

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Washington Freedom seal top two spot with clinical win over Texas Super Kings
body:
All-round performances by Glenn Maxwell and Rachin’s 4-fer helped Washington Freedom beat Texas Super Kings by 42 runs in their penultimate group match of the Major League Cricket 2024 season at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Friday.

Maxwell took 3/42 with the ball as we dismissed TSK for 164. Rachin Ravindra registered his best figures in T20 cricket with impressive stats of 4/16, while Jasdeep Singh finished with three wickets as we continued our unbeaten run this season. Earlier, Maxwell scored 34 off 23 balls to power us to 206/5.

Travis Head smashed his third consecutive fifty to lead us to the highest total by any team in the MLC this season. Head amassed 53 off just 22 balls, hitting eight fours and two sixes. Meanwhile, our skipper Steve Smith scored 57 off 40 balls, including three sixes and two fours, to top-score in the contest.

Batting first, Head got into the act quickly with two boundaries in the first over of the innings. The southpaw continued unabated, scoring five fours and a six in just 10 balls, reaching his fifty in only 20 balls.

Head’s carnage pushed us to 74/2 at the end of the sixth over, equaling the second-highest powerplay score of MLC 2024. Although we lost three wickets in quick succession, Maxwell and Smith rebuilt our innings, adding 58 off 42 balls and taking us past the three-figure mark.

Maxwell was severe on the spinners, hitting all his boundaries—three sixes and a four—against the slower bowlers. After a cautious start, Smith shifted gears effortlessly, reaching his first fifty of the MLC in style with a reverse hit for four.

Smith, who was at 24 off 25 balls initially, smashed 33 runs off the next 14 balls before getting dismissed in the penultimate over. Obus Pienaar provided the finishing touches, scoring an unbeaten 21-ball 33 to take us past 200. Noor Ahmad picked up 3/38 for Texas Super Kings whereas Dwayne Bravo got two wickets.

In response, Maxwell once again provided the crucial breakthrough dismissing Devon Conway. However, TSK raced to 76/1 at the end of the powerplay.

But we bounced back, picking up four wickets and conceding just 29 runs in the next six overs. Player of the Match Jasdeep dismissed TSK skipper du Plessis, who was looking in good nick, immediately after his fifty, to tilt the odds heavily in our favour.

Once Marcus Stoinis holed out in the deep to be Jasdeep’s third victim, there was no looking back as we romped home for our fifth victory of the season. Jasdeep recorded figures of 3/25 to round off a clinical bowling display.

With 11 points from six matches, we continue to be on top of the MLC 2024 points table.

We are up against the San Francisco Unicorns in our last league match at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Monday.

Washington Freedom vs Texas Super Kings MLC 2024 brief scores: WF 206/5 in 20 overs (Steve Smith 57, Travis Head 53, Noor Ahmad 3/38, Dwayne Bravo 2/40) vs TSK 164/10 in 19.5 overs (Faf du Plessis 55, Calvin Savage 35, Rachin Ravindra 4/16, Jasdeep Singh 3/25).

Washington Freedom won by 42 runs.
summary:
**Match Result:** Washington Freedom defeated Texas Super Kings by 42 runs in their penultimate group match at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

**Washington Freedom's Performance:**

* Travis Head scored 53 off 22 balls, smashing his third consecutive fifty.
* Steve Smith top-scored with 57 off 40 balls, including three sixes and two fours.
* Glenn Maxwell scored 34 off 23 balls and took 3/42 with the ball.
* Rachin Ravindra registered his best figures in T20 cricket with 4/16.
* Jasdeep Singh finished with three wickets and was named Player of the Match.

**Texas Super Kings' Performance:**

* Faf du Plessis scored 55, while Calvin Savage contributed 35.
* Noor Ahmad picked up 3/38, and Dwayne Bravo got two wickets.

**League Standings:** Washington Freedom continues to top the MLC 2024 points table with 11 points from six matches.

**Next Match:** Washington Freedom will face San Francisco Unicorns in their last league match on Monday at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Washington Freedom look to continue winning run against San Francisco Unicorns in dress rehearsal of Qualifier
body:
Washington Freedom will look to gain a psychological edge over the San Francisco Unicorns in their last league game of the Major League Cricket 2024 season at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Monday.

Our match against SFU on July 22, a dress rehearsal for the Qualifier of MLC 2024, is scheduled to start at 7:30 PM CT (July 23, 6:00 AM IST). The MLC 2024 game will be available to watch via live streaming and broadcast.

With a comprehensive 42-run win over the Texas Super Kings, our unbeaten run in MLC 2024 continued. We are on top of the points table with 11 points from six games.

Travis Head and Steve Smith came up with contrasting half-centuries, while Rachin Ravindra picked up four wickets, and Glenn Maxwell and Jasdeep Singh each got three in an all-round performance against TSK.

Despite missing the last two matches for us, Netravalkar continues to top the bowling charts in MLC 2024 with 12 wickets from just four matches at an average of 9.16 runs and an astonishing strike rate of 7.66.

Meanwhile, Travis Head and captain Steve Smith continue their run in the top-five batters list this season.

Head has amassed 194 runs from six matches at an average of 38.80 and an impressive strike rate of 179.62 to be third on the overall list, whereas Smith is one run below at fourth with 191 runs. He has an unbelievable average of 63.66, the highest for any player this season, and a strike rate of 136.42.

WF vs SFU form in MLC

Coming into this contest, we are unbeaten in our last five matches in the MLC, winning four of them, with one game washed off due to rain. We beat the San Francisco Unicorns by 30 runs in Morrisville in the 2023 season in our only meeting against them to date.
