title: Watch: Pat Cummins Smashed For Six Off First Ball In Major League Cricket
body:
Earlier this year, the World Cup-winning Australia captain confirmed that he had signed a deal to play in the second season of Major League Cricket in the USA, with the San Francisco Unicorns.

Cummins missed the side's first three matches as he took an extended rest following the 2024 T20 World Cup, which saw Australia fail to make the semifinals. He arrived in time to make his MLC debut in the Unicorns' fourth match of the campaign, against Seattle Orcas.

San Francisco batted first and scored 165-7. Matthew Short top-scored with a solid 56, and quickfire contributions came from Finn Allen (34) and Sanjay Krishnamurthi (30). Cummins batted at No.8, and remained not out on six.

In the run chase, Seattle had made a sedate start, getting to 22-0 in 4 overs. Cummins came on to bowl the fifth over, and started with a fullish off-cutter on leg-stump. Left-hander Ryan Rickleton duly obliged the loosener, swinging through the line and sending the ball over long-on to welcome Cummins.

The over ended up going for 14 runs. Cummins did recover, though, and finished with 1-35 from his four overs, dismissing Shehan Jayasuriya in the 11th over. San Francisco ended up winning by 23 runs, with Liam Plunkett named Player of the Match for his 3-26.

Watch Pat Cummins get hit for six off his first ball in Major League Cricket here
summary:
* Australian captain Pat Cummins made his debut in the Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament in the USA, playing for the San Francisco Unicorns.
* Cummins missed the first three matches of the season due to an extended rest after the 2024 T20 World Cup.
* In his debut match against the Seattle Orcas, San Francisco batted first and scored 165-7, with Matthew Short top-scoring with 56.
* Cummins batted at No.8 and remained not out on six.
* In the run chase, Cummins bowled his first over, conceding 14 runs, but recovered to finish with 1-35 from four overs, dismissing Shehan Jayasuriya.
* San Francisco won the match by 23 runs, with Liam Plunkett named Player of the Match for his 3-26.

title: Seattle Orcas vs San Francisco Unicorns Live Score:
body:
Right then, this is it from Match number 13 where the momentum shifted back and forth in favor of both sides, but eventually, it was the San Francisco Unicorns who held their nerves and emerged victorious. Up next in the Major League Cricket, 2024 is another exciting clash in Match number 14. It will be MI New York going tooth and nail against Washington Freedom at the Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas. That game will be played on July 17th, Wednesday and the first ball will be bowled at 6 am IST (12.30 am GMT). Till then take care, and cheers!

Corey Anderson, the victorious skipper of San Francisco Unicorns says that it was a good outing overall. Says that the new ball came on nicely but mentions that when it slowed down, it got tough to play the strokes. Appreciates Sanjay Krishnamurthi and says that he is a young lad and he played a good crucial cameo. On Pat Cummins, he says that Cummins is a world class player and just to have him in the group is a huge luxury. Adds they will plan how to plan the next game at Dallas and would look to get on a roll now.

Heinrich Klaasen, the captain of Seattle Orcas says that they didn't bat well once again and lost key players at the back end. Says they need to close games out responsibly. Says the bowlers have been fantastic but the batters need to step up big time. He says a win here and there can hopefully flip things for them.

Liam Plunkett wins the PLAYER OF THE MATCH Award for his brilliant bowling figures (4-0-26-3). He says that the way the Seattle Orcas batted inside the powerplay, it looked like going one way but after the break, they came back strongly. Adds it got more and more tough to get along as the ball got older. Ends up saying it was all about trying to execute their plans and maximizing that phase.

Matthew Short is in for a chat. He says that it felt nice to bat there. Adds that he feels good about batting in the first six overs. Mentions that Ryan Rickelton and Quinton de Kock were in form but the wicket was in his favour. Says that Rickelton was in fine form but thinks the wicket was spinning and was a bit skiddy as well. Adds they have been a bit unlucky with the rain. Says in a short tournament like this, every game is critical. Says that they are looking forward to their following games and will look to win them.

Earlier in the game, the Unicorns were asked to bat first and had a bit of a rocky start. JFM was gone in a flash, but then Matthew Short and Finn Allen teamed up for a fireworks display, smashing 75 runs together and sending the score rocketing. But the game twisted as both fell in quick succession and suddenly the boundaries dried up. Cameron Gannon and Imad Wasim spotted their chance and pounced. While their teammates were getting a bit of a hammering. They snagged three wickets each, tightening the screws on the Unicorns' innings. Just when it looked like the Unicorns might fizzle out, Krishnamurthy charged in for some last-minute heroics. His late blitz helped push the total to a respectable 165, which realistically made the difference in the end.

On the flip side, the Unicorns must have felt that they were short of 10-15 runs. They needed a wicket desperately but couldn't get any breakthrough inside the restrictions. As many as six bowlers were used in the powerplay but they couldn't find that scalp. But the tide turned dramatically when Plunkett finally cracked the code, grabbing the first wicket. Short quickly followed suit, and then Cummins, despite leaking runs, struck gold by dismissing the well-set Jayasuriya. This trio of wickets swung the momentum, with the Unicorns cleverly using slower deliveries to keep the Orcas off-balance. The bowlers then literally ran through the opposition lineup giving away next to nothing and closed up in fine fashion.

However, as the innings progressed, the Orcas found themselves lagging behind the asking rate with Jayasuriya too, back in the hut. Just when they needed a steady partnership to ease the mounting pressure, they kept losing quick wickets with all the hitters back in the hut without any impact. The inning that once looked in absolute command suddenly lost its momentum in a jiffy in the mid overs and just couldn't recover from the collapse.

Done and dusted! The San Francisco Unicorns seal the deal winning this clash by 23 runs and climbing to the third spot. A job well done by the Men in Orange and Blue. The Seattle Orcas on the other hand will be gutted with the way things panned out for them towards the second half of the chase. The Seattle Orcas kicked off their chase of 166 with a measured approach. Shehan Jayasuriya and Ryan Rickelton got things rolling nicely, forming a steady opening partnership and pouncing on any loose deliveries. Jayasuriya, in particular, was the aggressor in chief as he was timing the ball to perfection, making it look effortless. Even as wickets tumbled at the other end, Jayasuriya stood firm, notching up a solid resilient half-century.

The Orcas are heading up for their third defeat of the season here and it would be interesting to see how they recover from this in their latter games. However, this game was really under control in the first half with Jayasuriya going hammer and tonks, but they certainly lost the momentum in the next half.

Pat Cummins (3-0-30-1) is back into the attack to bowl the last over of his quota. With 33 runs needed off the 11 remaining deliveries, and all the recognised batters into the sheds, the chances of Orcas getting through have zeroed now.

With Harmeet Singh back in the hut, the tensions further deepen and things have gotten precarious for the Orcas now. They still need 38 off the last 18 remaining deliveries. Cameron Gannon is the next batter in at number 8. Haris Rauf (2-0-23-0) is back into the attack.

W

Overs16.6

Score128 - 6

Liam Plunkett to Harmeet Singh, OUT! TAKEN! Matthew Short with an excellent running catch at deep mid-wicket. Short, on middle, Singh pulls it from closer to the body and hence, he fails to generate the requisite power and the distance as gets the timing completely wrong. It carries towards deep mid-wicket where Matthew Short takes a sharp catch running to his left.

4

Overs16.5

Score128 - 5

Liam Plunkett to Harmeet Singh, FOUR! Edgy but they will take it! Short, on off, Singh looks to pull it but gets a top edge as the ball flies over short fine for a boundary.

Strategic Break! This has been a fabulous comeback from the San Francisco Unicorns with the ball. What looked like a lopsided affair at the beginning of the chase, has turned out to be a nail biting one. With all the big hitters back in the hut, Orcas are still in the hunt of 53 off the last 30 remaining deliveries. Every bowler from the Unicorns has struck timely scalps and helped their team sneak back into the contest. Will Corey Anderson and Co manage to squeeze their opposition further, or will Harmeet Singh play a heroic here? Let's find out together. Corey Anderson (2.2-0-13-1) to continue after the break.

1

Overs14.5

Score110 - 5

Pat Cummins to Harmeet Singh, On a length and on off, Singh looks to flick it but gets a leading edge as the ball carries and lands safely at mid on. They cross.

4

Overs14.3

Score109 - 5

Pat Cummins to Harmeet Singh, FOUR! They need more of these! Touch short and on off, Harmeet Singh looks to pull it but gets a top edge as the ball goes over the keeper's head for a boundary.
summary:
Match 13: San Francisco Unicorns won against Seattle Orcas by 23 runs. The Unicorns batted first and set a target of 166, which the Orcas failed to chase down. Liam Plunkett was awarded Player of the Match for his excellent bowling figures of 4-0-26-3.

In the match, the Unicorns had a rocky start but recovered thanks to a partnership between Matthew Short and Finn Allen. Sanjay Krishnamurthi's late cameo helped push the total to 165. The Orcas struggled to chase down the target, losing wickets regularly, and eventually fell short.

The Unicorns' captain, Corey Anderson, praised his team's performance and credited Liam Plunkett and Pat Cummins for their crucial contributions. On the other hand, Seattle Orcas' captain, Heinrich Klaasen, lamented his team's batting woes and hoped for a turnaround in their next games.

Next up is Match 14 between MI New York and Washington Freedom at the Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas, scheduled for July 17th, at 6 am IST (12.30 am GMT).

title: Prime Video snags exclusive 2024 MLC season broadcast rights for ANZ
body:
Prime Video and Cognizant Major League Cricket (MLC) today announced a partnership to grant Prime Video exclusive broadcast rights in Australia and New Zealand for the 2024 MLC season. All 25 matches will be available on Prime Video in Australia and New Zealand from 6 July – 29 July local time (5 July – 28 July in the USA) at no extra cost to a Prime or Prime Video membership.

The announcement comes off the back of a hugely entertaining ICC Men’s T20 World Cup, which saw co-host USA progress to the Super Eight stage in their tournament debut. The second season of MLC will provide a stage for the best international T20 superstars to compete alongside the USA’s top domestic players from six major cities: Dallas, San Francisco, New York City, Seattle, Los Angeles, and Washington D.C. Across the six teams, eight Australian players and five New Zealander players have been confirmed to participate in the tournament. Key signings include:

Australian Test and ODI captain Pat Cummins joins the San Francisco Unicorns alongside bowler Josh Inglis, batter Jake Fraser-McGurk, and New Zealand all-rounder Matt Henry.

Seattle Orcas have nabbed Kiwi batsman Michael Bracewell and bowler Lance Morris.

Washington Freedom have secured Ricky Ponting as coach, as well as Australian batters Steve Smith, Travis Head, and Glenn Maxwell. New Zealand’s bowlers Rachin Ravindra and Lockie Ferguson are also named in the squad.

MI New York will see batter Tim David and bowler Trent Boult return for a second season.

Australian bowler Adam Zampa will join the Los Angeles Knight Riders.

“At Prime Video, we are always looking for ways to deliver more value to our customers across our movies, TV series and live sports offerings,” said Hushidar Kharas, head of Prime Video Australia and New Zealand. “The feedback from cricket fans in Australia for our first major event, ICC Men’s T20 World Cup, has been really positive and we are delighted to expand our live sports offering through the Cognizant Major League Cricket. We are also excited to offer our customers in New Zealand the first live sports event included in their Prime Video membership.”

“We are thrilled to announce Prime Video as our broadcast partner for Cognizant Major League Cricket in New Zealand and Australia,” said MLC’s CEO, Vijay Srinivasan. “This partnership marks a significant milestone in our journey to grow the season, which is in it’s second year, as well as bring the excitement of cricket to fans across the globe. Prime Video has solidified its position as a premier destination for cricket enthusiasts in Australia and New Zealand, showcasing major events such as the World Cup and acclaimed series such as The Test. MLC eagerly anticipates joining this platform, poised to contribute thrilling cricket action to its global audience through Prime Video’s extensive reach and expertise.”

Prime Video is a premier entertainment destination where millions of viewers around the world can enjoy their favourite content. It has demonstrated its commitment to delivering premier sports viewing to Australian and New Zealand audiences through a series of acclaimed documentaries. These include The Test S1-S3, Making Their Mark, Shane, Warriors on the Field, and Kick Like Tayla. In Australia, Prime members cheered on the Australian team in the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup, who made it to the Super 8. The T20 World Cup Women’s tournament will commence in October this year.

Since 2019, Prime Video has commissioned 29 Amazon Originals in Australia — The Test S1-S3, LOL: Last One Laughing Australia with Rebel Wilson, a series of 10 stand-up comedy specials, Back to the Rafters, Luxe Listings Sydney S1 – S3, The Moth Effect, Making Their Mark, Warriors on the Field, Kick Like Tayla, award-winning, feature-length documentary Burning, Head Above Water, Class of ’07, Deadloch, The Lost Flowers of Alice Hart, the lifestyle special Hugh van Cuylenburg: G.E.M, a series of five stand-up comedy specials, Hot Potato: The Story of the Wiggles, Neighbours, Five Blind Dates, Dance Life, the upcoming The Office, The Narrow Road to the Deep North and Top End Bub.

Prime members in Australia and Prime Video customers in New Zealand will be able to watch all live MLC matches anywhere and anytime on their Prime Video app for smart TVs, mobile devices, Fire TV, Fire TV stick, Fire tablets, Apple TV, and stream online. In the Prime Video app, Prime Video customers can download matches on their mobile devices and tablets and watch anywhere offline at no additional cost.
summary:
**Partnership and Broadcast Rights**: Prime Video has secured exclusive broadcast rights in Australia and New Zealand for the 2024 MLC season, with all 25 matches available on Prime Video at no extra cost to Prime or Prime Video membership.

**Tournament Details**: The second season of MLC will begin on July 6th in Australia and New Zealand (July 5th in the USA) and will feature six teams from six major cities in the USA: Dallas, San Francisco, New York City, Seattle, Los Angeles, and Washington D.C.

**Player Signings**: Notable players participating in the tournament include:

* Australian Test and ODI captain Pat Cummins (San Francisco Unicorns)
* Australian players Jake Fraser-McGurk, Josh Inglis, Steve Smith, Travis Head, Glenn Maxwell, and Adam Zampa
* New Zealand players Matt Henry, Michael Bracewell, Lance Morris, Rachin Ravindra, Lockie Ferguson, and Trent Boult
* Ricky Ponting will coach the Washington Freedom team

**Availability**: Prime members in Australia and Prime Video customers in New Zealand can watch all live MLC matches on the Prime Video app on various devices, including smart TVs, mobile devices, and tablets, with the option to download matches for offline viewing at no additional cost.

title: MLC: MI New York Suffer Huge 94-run Loss Against Washington Freedom
body:
MI New York: Impressive half-centuries by Travis Head and Andries Gous, backed by a dominant bowling performance helped Washington Freedom thrash MI New York by 94 runs in their fifth match of the Major League Cricket 2024 at the Grand Prairie Stadium.

Head scored 54 off 33, while Gous smashed 59 off 48 to power Washington Freedom to 182/5 in 20 overs. Their bowlers then ran riot, skittling MI New York for just 88 runs, securing a commanding victory by 94 runs. With this win, Washington Freedom became the first team to qualify for the Playoffs of the second season, consolidating their lead at the top of the points table with nine points in five matches.

MI New York had a terrible start to their run chase as Washington Freedom bowlers ran riot. They were 25/5 by the end of the Powerplay. Steven Taylor (0 off 3), Monank Patel (4 off 6), Dewald Brevis (2 off 5), Shayan Jahangir (3 off 9) and Nicholas Pooran (4 off 6) had lost their wickets cheaply by the sixth over. Skipper Kieron Pollard (4 off 9) and Rashid Khan (7 off 6) followed them back to the pavilion as by the ninth over MI New York had scored 56/7.

Trending

Romario Shepherd and Trent Boult displayed some resilience, as they added 33 runs off 16 balls. Shepherd, the last hope for New York, was dismissed in the 11th over after scoring 25 off 14 balls. Maxwell then wrapped things up for Washington, taking two wickets in the 14th over. He removed Boult (16 off 13) on the first ball and Ehsan Adil (0 off 2) on the third to bowl out MI New York to just 88.

After being asked to bat first, the Washington team had a decent start, thanks to their openers, Steve Smith and Travis Head. However, Smith couldn't capitalize as he was dismissed by Rashid Khan in the fifth over, scoring 8 off 10. Head then took charge and built a solid partnership with Andries Gous. Their timely boundaries and steady play helped Washington cross the 100-run mark in the 11th over.

However, Head's blistering knock of 54 off 33 balls, featuring nine fours and two sixes, came to an end in the next over when he was caught by Rashid Khan at long-on off Romario Shepherd. Glen Maxwell soon followed Head back to the pavilion, despite being given a lifeline in the 15th over when Taylor dropped him at mid-off. Rashid Khan eventually dismissed Maxwell in the 16th over, with him managing to score 15 off 14 balls. After 16 overs, Washington stood at 133/3, with Andries Gous still in the middle.

Washington finished their innings strongly, as they scored 49 runs in the last four overs, thanks to the free-flowing strokes of Andries Gous and Rachin Ravindra. Gous reached his half-century in the 19th over, while Ravindra smashed two sixes and a four off Boult in the same over, producing as many as 23 runs.

However, Head's blistering knock of 54 off 33 balls, featuring nine fours and two sixes, came to an end in the next over when he was caught by Rashid Khan at long-on off Romario Shepherd. Glen Maxwell soon followed Head back to the pavilion, despite being given a lifeline in the 15th over when Taylor dropped him at mid-off. Rashid Khan eventually dismissed Maxwell in the 16th over, with him managing to score 15 off 14 balls. After 16 overs, Washington stood at 133/3, with Andries Gous still in the middle.

Also Read: Akram ‘hopes’ Indian Team Will Travel To Pakistan For Champions Trophy

Brief Scores: Washington Freedom 182/5 (Andries Gous 59 off 48, Travis Head 54 off 33, Kieron Pollard 2-14 in 2 overs) beat MI New York 88/10 (Romario Shepherd 25 off 14, Trent Boult 16 off 13, Jasdeep Singh 3-14 in 3 overs) by 94 runs.

title: [Watch] Maxwell's Stumps Go For A Cartwheeling As Rashid Khan Outfoxes Him In MLC 2024
body:
Maxwell was bowled by Rashid [X]

Afghanistan's legendary spinner Rashid Khan weaved his magic in MI New York's group-stage encounter against Washington Freedom in the ongoing Major League Cricket.

The talismanic tweaker got the prized scalps of Steven Smith and Glenn Maxwell, proving MI New York with crucial breakthroughs.

Watch - Rashid bamboozles Maxwell with a beauty!

After dismissing Washington's skipper Steve Smith, Rashid Khan outfoxed destructive batter Glenn Maxwell with a peach.

The incident occurred during the 16th over of Washington's innings when they were cruising towards a fighting total, courtesy of blistering knocks from Travis Head and Andries Gous. However, Rashid's timely strike brought a sigh of relief to the MI camp as he castled Maxwell.

From over the wicket, Rashid bowled a well-disguised googly, which Maxwell failed to read. The batter had already made his mind to play an aggressive reverse sweep shot.

However, as he couldn't read the variation, the Aussie batter was early onto his shot, with the ball sneaking past his bat to disturb the furniture.

Despite losing Maxwell at the stroke of death overs, Washington Freedom powered themselves to 182/5 in 20 overs, thanks to Rachin Ravindra's hitting masterclass.
summary:
* The match was a group-stage encounter between MI New York and Washington Freedom in the ongoing Major League Cricket tournament.
* Rashid Khan, playing for MI New York, took crucial wickets of Steven Smith and Glenn Maxwell, providing breakthroughs for his team.
* Rashid Khan bowled a well-disguised googly to dismiss Maxwell, who failed to read the variation and was early onto his shot, resulting in him being bowled.
* Despite Maxwell's dismissal, Washington Freedom managed to score 182/5 in 20 overs, thanks to Rachin Ravindra's hitting.

title: MLC 2024 Match 15, SEA vs LAKR | Playing 11 Prediction, Cricket Tips, Preview & Live Streaming
body:
LAKR are fourth on the MLC points table (Twitter)

The upcoming clash in Match 15 of Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 will see Seattle Orcas (SEA) lock horns with Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) at Church Street Park in Morrisville on Thursday, July 18.

In their previous meeting earlier in the tournament, the Orcas overpowered the Knight Riders, clinching a decisive nine-wicket victory.

SEA vs LAKR: Team Previews

Seattle Orcas

Seattle Orcas have been floundering in troubled waters throughout the tournament, managing to scrape together only a single win from their four outings, accompanied by three defeats.

Currently anchored at the bottom of the MLC 2024 points table, their previous game added to their woes as they fell short by 23 runs against the San Francisco Unicorns.

Despite a promising start, where openers Ryan Rickelton and Shehan Jayasuriya stitched together a 76-run stand, the team's innings capsized after their dismissal, limping to 142/6 in their pursuit of chasing 166-run target.

The Orcas need their key players like Quinton de Kock and captain Heinrich Klaasen to stabilize their middle order with better performances and steer the team towards calmer waters.

With their backs against the wall, they must pull out all the stops in this must-win game, especially since their sole victory came against the Knight Riders.

Los Angeles Knight Riders

Meanwhile, Los Angeles Knight Riders haven't fared much better, eking out just one win from their five matches, along with three losses and one washout.

Positioned fourth in the standings, they are captained by Sunil Narine, but their last outing was a forgettable affair, as they crumbled to 129 all out against Washington Freedom.

The team's heavy hitters, including Jason Roy, Narine, Shakib Al Hasan, and David Miller, failed to light up the scoreboard, leading to an easy chase by Washington in just 16 overs.

The Knight Riders boast a formidable bowling attack and need their batters to step up to the plate if they hope to salvage their playoff aspirations.

Facing a critical juncture, the Knight Riders must win this clash or risk their playoff dreams slipping through their fingers.

Church Street Park has presented a challenging wicket for batters this MLC season, with its slow nature and tendency to favour spinners. Teams have generally struggled to rack up high scores here. title: Australia Selector Backs Morris, Richardson For Summer Season Despite Injury Concerns
body:
Major League Cricket: Australia selector George Bailey has long-term plans for pacers Lance Morris and Jhye Richardson, after missing out on the white-ball tour of the UK. The duo were given Cricket Australia central contracts earlier this year.

Morris missed the whole winter season due to a stress fracture in his back, and he is currently undergoing further rehabilitation for the same. It is a recurrence of what transpired following his exclusion from the Ashes trip in the 2022–2023 season.

The pacer had earlier sustained a side strain in his second ODI match, which curtailed his summer. He had been due to play for Seattle Orcas in ongoing Major League Cricket before scans revealed a hot spot in his back and as a result, he was not selected for the Scotland and England trip.

Trending

"Lance is still working through his return to play and getting himself right recovering from that stress fracture of the back," ESPNcricinfo quoted national selector George Bailey as saying. "Know he's progressing well, he's feeling good, he's starting to get to that point where he wants some cricket and think he's going to get a hell of a lot of it over the summer and that will be really exciting to see him back.

"Felt a little bit like with him, that we wanted to set him up for success in the long term as opposed to pushing that too early then potentially risking what we think is something that could be really exciting across this summer and beyond," he added.

On the other hand, Richardson is "fit and firing" as per Bailey after his disrupted stints in the Indian Premier League and domestic season due to a side strain. He last played for Australia against Sri Lanka in mid-2022.

"Jhye is in a similar boat. He's fit and firing now, and again looking for match opportunities. I think he'll get opportunities again across the summer. For both [him and Morris] I think it's getting through the season fit and then hopefully maximising the amount of cricket they play. Some of that will be domestic, hopefully, there will be some international opportunities [and] Australia A opportunities, then I think we set them up for success in the long term," he said.

Australia's national selector added that the dominance of the pace trio of Pat Cummins, Mitchell Starc, and Josh Hazlewood with Scott Boland making inroads with some stunning performances in Test cricket.

"Jhye is in a similar boat. He's fit and firing now, and again looking for match opportunities. I think he'll get opportunities again across the summer. For both [him and Morris] I think it's getting through the season fit and then hopefully maximising the amount of cricket they play. Some of that will be domestic, hopefully, there will be some international opportunities [and] Australia A opportunities, then I think we set them up for success in the long term," he said.

Also Read: Akram ‘hopes’ Indian Team Will Travel To Pakistan For Champions Trophy

"Clearly some of the decisions made around this series is around priortising and getting guys right for what will be a really big summer and for some guys this is an opportunity to get a little bit more work into what they are going to need to be ready for that," he concluded.

title: Washington Freedom Crush MI New York to Secure Playoff Spot in MLC 2024
body:
Impressive half-centuries by Travis Head and Andries Gous, along with a dominant bowling performance, led Washington Freedom to a crushing victory over MI New York by 94 runs in their fifth match of the Major League Cricket 2024 at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Tuesday. Head scored 54 off 33 balls, while Gous smashed 59 off 48 to power Washington Freedom to 182/5 in 20 overs. The bowlers then skittled MI New York for just 88 runs, securing a commanding win. Washington Freedom's victory makes them the first team to qualify for the Playoffs of the second season, consolidating their lead at the top of the points table with nine points from five matches.

MI New York faced a disastrous start in their run chase as Washington Freedom bowlers wreaked havoc. By the end of the Powerplay, they were reeling at 25/5. Steven Taylor (0 off 3), Monank Patel (4 off 6), Dewald Brevis (2 off 5), Shayan Jahangir (3 off 9), and Nicholas Pooran (4 off 6) had all fallen cheaply by the sixth over. Skipper Kieron Pollard (4 off 9) and Rashid Khan (7 off 6) followed soon after, leaving MI New York struggling at 56/7 by the ninth over. Romario Shepherd and Trent Boult showed some fight, adding 33 runs off 16 balls. However, Shepherd, New York's last hope, was dismissed in the 11th over after scoring 25 off 14 balls. Maxwell wrapped things up for Washington in the 14th over, taking two wickets, including Boult (16 off 13) and Ehsan Adil (0 off 2), bowling out MI New York for just 88.

After being asked to bat first, Washington got off to a solid start, courtesy of their openers Steve Smith and Travis Head. However, Smith was dismissed by Rashid Khan in the fifth over, scoring 8 off 10. Head then took charge, forming a solid partnership with Andries Gous. Their timely boundaries and steady play helped Washington cross the 100-run mark in the 11th over. Head's blistering knock ended in the 12th over when he was caught by Rashid Khan off Romario Shepherd, having scored 54 off 33 balls. Glen Maxwell soon followed, despite being given a lifeline in the 15th over when Taylor dropped him at mid-off. Rashid Khan eventually dismissed him in the 16th over, with Maxwell managing to score 15 off 14 balls. After 16 overs, Washington stood at 133/3, with Gous still anchoring the innings.

Washington finished their innings strongly, adding 49 runs in the last four overs, thanks to the free-flowing strokes of Andries Gous and Rachin Ravindra. Gous reached his half-century in the 19th over, while Ravindra smashed two sixes and a four off Boult, producing 23 runs in the same over. Ravindra was dismissed by Kieron Pollard in the final over after a quickfire 31 off 14 balls. Gous was caught on the last ball of the innings, having scored a crucial 59 off 48, helping Washington post a formidable total of 182/5. Brief Scores: Washington Freedom (Andries Gous 59 off 48, Travis Head 54 off 33, Kieron Pollard 2/14 in 2 overs) beat MI New York (Romario Shepherd 25 off 14, Trent Boult 16 off 13, Jasdeep Singh 3/14 in 3 overs) by 94 runs.

(With inputs from agencies.)
summary:
* Washington Freedom defeated MI New York by 94 runs in their fifth match of the Major League Cricket 2024 at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.
* Travis Head scored 54 off 33 balls, while Andries Gous scored 59 off 48 to power Washington Freedom to 182/5 in 20 overs.
* Washington Freedom's bowlers dominated MI New York, skittling them out for just 88 runs, with Jasdeep Singh taking 3 wickets for 14 runs.
* This victory makes Washington Freedom the first team to qualify for the Playoffs of the second season, with 9 points from 5 matches and a lead at the top of the points table.

title: MLC 2024: Washington Freedom reaches the playoffs with thumping win over MI New York
body:
The Washington Freedom unleashed their offensive might at Grand Prairie Stadium on Wednesday, thrashing MI New York by a resounding 94 runs in the 14th match of the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024.

Washington Freedom feast on batting bounty

Asked to bat first, Washington got off to a shaky start. Skipper Steve Smith departed after scoring just 8 runs. No. 3 Andries Gous and opener Travis Head stitched together a crucial partnership of 73 runs, laying the foundation for a big total.

Gous, known for his aggressive strokeplay, smashed 59 runs off just 48 balls, peppering the Grand Prairie night with 4 sixes and 3 fours. Head, the ever-reliable left-hander, played a composed innings, scoring 54 runs off 33 balls, including 9 fours and two sixes.

The middle order continued the momentum. Glenn Maxwell, though dismissed cheaply for 15, provided a quickfire cameo with a towering six. The young gun Rachin Ravindra impressed with a whirlwind knock of 31 runs off just 14 deliveries, finding the boundary twice on the on-side and twice over the ropes. The Washington batting order displayed remarkable depth, with even lower-order batters contributing valuable runs to propel the team to a formidable total of 182/5 in their allotted 20 overs.

MI New York falters in face of bowling blitz

Chasing a stiff target of 183, MI New York’s hopes for victory evaporated quickly. Both openers, Steven Taylor and Shayan Jahangir, fell cheaply, leaving the middle order with a mountain to climb. None of the remaining batters could manage to build a significant partnership, succumbing to the pressure applied by the Freedom bowlers.

Jasdeep Singh was the wrecker-in-chief for Washington, picking up 3 crucial wickets for just 14 runs in his 3 overs. The right-arm medium pacer displayed exceptional control and swing, exposing the vulnerabilities in the New York batting line-up. Lockie Ferguson and Marco Jansen provided excellent support, claiming 2 wickets apiece. The Washington bowling attack, with a mix of pace and spin, never allowed the New York batters to settle, restricting them to a paltry 88 runs in just 13.3 overs.

Also WATCH: Imad Wasim’s stunning one-handed catch dismisses Mukhtar Ahmed during SEO vs WAF in MLC 2024

Dominant Washington Freedom qualifies for the playoffs

This emphatic victory consolidates Freedom’s position at the top of the MLC 2024 points table. Their clinical performance with both bat and ball leaves a strong message for the rest of the competition. Washington Freedom are now the first team to reach the playoffs of the second season. MI New York, on the other hand, will need to go back to the drawing board and address their batting woes to bounce back in the tournament.
summary:
**Match Result:** Washington Freedom defeated MI New York by 94 runs in the 14th match of the MLC 2024.

**Batting Performance:** Washington Freedom scored 182/5 in 20 overs, with Andries Gous scoring 59 runs off 48 balls and Travis Head scoring 54 runs off 33 balls. Glenn Maxwell and Rachin Ravindra also contributed to the team's total.

**Bowling Performance:** Jasdeep Singh took 3 wickets for 14 runs, while Lockie Ferguson and Marco Jansen claimed 2 wickets each. The Washington bowling attack restricted MI New York to 88 runs in 13.3 overs.

**Tournament Implications:** Washington Freedom has qualified for the playoffs, consolidating their position at the top of the MLC 2024 points table. MI New York needs to address their batting issues to bounce back in the tournament.

title: Glenn Maxwell Wins Hearts with Heartwarming Gesture at MLC 2024
body:
In a touching display of sportsmanship, Australian all-rounder Glenn Maxwell won the hearts of fans worldwide during the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024. After Washington Freedom’s match against Los Angeles Knight Riders, Maxwell, who had been awarded the Player of the Match (POTM), chose to give his award to a young fan, a gesture that quickly went viral on social media.

Stellar Performance on the Field

Maxwell’s performance was instrumental in Washington Freedom’s victory. Although he did not get a chance to bat, his bowling was exceptional. He took three crucial wickets while conceding only 15 runs, effectively limiting the Knight Riders to a total of 129 runs in the first innings. Washington Freedom chased down the target in just 16 overs, losing only two wickets, and secured an eight-wicket victory.

The Heartwarming Moment

The clip of Maxwell giving his POTM award to a fan was shared by Washington Freedom on their official X (formerly Twitter) handle. The heartwarming video shows Maxwell handing over a big box to a young fan and signing an autograph for him. The gesture was praised widely, with fans and followers lauding Maxwell for his kindness.

“The winner of the hearts award goes to Glenn Maxwell, who graciously gave his POTM award to his fan,” Washington Freedom captioned their post.

Social Media Reaction

The post quickly gained traction, with many expressing their admiration for Maxwell’s gesture. Such acts of kindness enhance the connection between players and fans, showcasing the spirit of the game beyond the boundaries of the cricket field.
summary:
* The article highlights a heartwarming moment during the MLC 2024 tournament when Australian all-rounder Glenn Maxwell, playing for Washington Freedom, gave his Player of the Match (POTM) award to a young fan after a match against Los Angeles Knight Riders.
* Maxwell's exceptional bowling performance helped Washington Freedom secure an eight-wicket victory, taking three crucial wickets while conceding only 15 runs.
* The gesture was widely praised on social media, with fans and followers lauding Maxwell for his kindness and sportsmanship.
* Washington Freedom shared a video of the heartwarming moment on their official social media handle, showing Maxwell handing over the POTM award to the young fan and signing an autograph for him.

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Washington Freedom Target Playoff Spot With a Win Over MI New York
body:
Washington Freedom will look to complete a double over MI New York and enter the Playoffs of the Major League Cricket 2024 when both teams meet at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Tuesday.

Our match against MI NY on July 16 is scheduled to start at 8:30 PM ET (July 17, 6:00 AM IST). The MLC 2024 game will be available to watch via LIVE streaming and broadcast.

We continue to remain unbeaten in MLC 2024 and are on top of the points table with seven points from four games.

We beat the Los Angeles Knight Riders by eight wickets in our last match in Morrisville on Sunday. Glenn Maxwell and Saurabh Netravalkar picked up seven wickets amongst themselves whereas Travis Head hit a swashbuckling half-century to make short work of the chase.

Netravalkar has 12 wickets from just four matches and stands on top of the bowling charts of MLC 2024 with an enviable average of 9.16 runs per wicket. The left-arm pacer has an unbelievable strike rate of 7.66, which means he picks up a wicket in under every eight balls he delivers.

Meanwhile, captain Steve Smith, after his unbeaten 42 against LAKR in the last match, occupies fifth place among all batters in MLC 2024 with 126 runs from four outings at an astonishing average of 126.00 and a strike rate of 140.00.

WF vs MI NY form in MLC

Washington Freedom have won three of their last five matches in the MLC, with one game washed off due to rain, coming into this contest. We beat MI NY by four runs in a rain-affected match at Morrisville on July 6 to kick-start our 2024 campaign.

WF vs MI NY, MLC 2024: Players to watch out

Player of the Match Maxwell bowled a miserly spell and was successful too, picking up 3/15 in his four overs in our last match against Los Angeles Knight Riders. He bowled a total of 14 dot balls and conceded just one boundary in his entire spell to restrict the opposition to a modest score.

The ever-consistent Netravalkar came to the fore again with a game-changing spell of 4/35 against LAKR. He was also the stand-out bowler in our opening game against MI NY this season with a spell of 3/24 in four overs.

Travis Head scored his first half-century in MLC in our last game with an entertaining 32-ball 54. He showcased his wide array of shots and aggressive intent smashing six sixes and two fours during his knock.

Steve Smith was instrumental in our previous win against MI NY remaining unbeaten on 46 of just 28 balls. He plundered 22 runs off Anrich Nortje’s first over which proved crucial as we were ahead of the DLS par score by four runs when rain stopped play.

Washington Freedom squad: Steven Smith (c), Akhilesh Reddy, Jack Edwards, Andries Gous, Travis Head, Lahiru Milantha, Mukhtar Ahmed, Justin Dill, Ian Holland, Marco Jansen, Glenn Maxwell, Obus Pienaar, Rachin Ravindra, Amila Aponso, Lockie Ferguson, Akeal Hosein, Saurabh Netravalkar, Andrew Tye, Yasir Mohammad

Where to watch WF vs MI NY MLC 2024 LIVE

LIVE telecast and streaming of the Washington Freedom vs MI New York match will be available on Monumental Sports Network and Willow by Cricbuzz in the USA. The match will start at 8:30 PM ET on July 16.

The WF vs MI NY match will be streamed LIVE on the Jio Cinema App and website in India starting at 06:00 AM IST on July 17.

In their last match, they beat the Los Angeles Knight Riders by eight wickets, with Glenn Maxwell and Saurabh Netravalkar taking seven wickets between them and Travis Head scoring a half-century.

Saurabh Netravalkar is currently the top bowler in the tournament, with 12 wickets from four matches at an average of 9.16 runs per wicket and a strike rate of 7.66. Captain Steve Smith is fifth among all batters, with 126 runs from four outings at an average of 126.00 and a strike rate of 140.00.

title: Rewriting Cricket’s Narrative: How Major League Cricket is Transforming the Sport in the United States
body:
In the United States, there have always been four primary sports that ruled over all others — football, baseball (obviously), basketball, and hockey. That said, another new competition is just beginning to flex its muscles and gain respect from fans across the country — Major League Cricket (MLC). MLC T20 cricket league launched in 2022 to bring Cricket on similar lines to major sports leagues in the USA.

Meaning of MLC for Cricket in the United States

Cricket is no new entrant to the U.S. sporting landscape; it is undoubtedly a niche sport upheld as an elitist and unattainable spectator sport compared to the other major leagues. However, the rise of MLC may well see that story shift. The league has started to promote Cricket at a scientific level, hack new audiences, and enrich the local role of American Cricket on the professional stage.

MLC plans to tap into a broad audience and introduce Cricket in a traditional form by setting up franchise-based teams across important metropolitan centers. The league’s efforts to groom home-grown talent and the arrival of some international stars are likely to help increase young American cricketers decide they want to be part of their nation side, creating new fanbases for the sport around America.

Partnership with Global Environment: Major League Cricket

Beyond the U.S., MLC has more significant ideas. The General Manager of the league has already announced strategic partnerships with established cricket boards and leagues around the globe, including Cricket West Indies, Cricket Australia, and Emirates Cricket Board. These international connections have allowed MLC to bring on the best global players and coaches, as well as technical expertise in new Netball tactics, raising the standard of play.

Depending on how successful MLC is, the impact on the wider game could be huge for Cricket worldwide. While the league has long been a hit in South Africa, its growing appeal stateside could make it a blueprint for Cricket to establish itself in other non-traditional markets and broaden its global reach.

Also Read: Major League Cricket (MLC): Showcasing the Rise of Cricketing Titans with Grandest Stage

Challenges and Opportunities of MLC

While MLC enters with some encouraging noise, several headwinds ensure the league has its work cut out for it in trying to stay stateside long-term. This will involve massive infrastructure spending, from building world-class cricket stadiums to practice facilities and creating audiences around the game.

The league also has to lure in American sports fans who are used to a quicker pace and higher scores than the kind dished out by so much soccer. The content and depth of the story created by this will ultimately determine MLC’s success, in conjunction with good marketing efforts to commercialize it.

Impact on the USA Economy of Major League Cricket

The birth of Major League Cricket represents a historic moment for the game of cricket in America and can have an enormous economic impact!!! The league is expected to have a significant economic impact on America as it continues to grow and makes its mark in North America.

The future operation of these facilities is expected to provide an economic boost in the long run, while their construction will create work in the short term. Furthermore, better availability of quality cricket infrastructure can aid the genesis and flourishing of the sport at grassroots levels by enhancing financial paybacks.

Major League Cricket has the capacity to transfer this wealth into the American economy by leveraging professional cricket and may transform itself into a national economic powerhouse, creating jobs, revenue generation, and ancillary industry development. As the league develops further and more rapidly, its economic influence is expected to be a key determinant of both sustainability in the long run and success everywhere else.

Conclusion

Major League Cricket will become a turning point in the global proliferation of Cricket; wait. By launching a new professional league here, MLC seeks to change the dynamic of how Cricket is played in this country and lead American cricketers by example while capturing the attention and imagination — and wallets — of sports fans throughout the USA. As the league keeps evolving and expanding, its contribution to future Cricket will be watched by everyone in their homes worldwide.
summary:
**Launch and Objective**: The MLC T20 cricket league was launched in 2022 with the aim of promoting cricket in the United States, similar to major sports leagues in the country.

**Impact on Cricket in the USA**: The MLC is expected to popularize cricket in the US, making it more accessible and appealing to a broader audience, and potentially creating new fanbases around the country.

**International Partnerships**: The league has formed partnerships with established cricket boards and leagues globally, including Cricket West Indies, Cricket Australia, and Emirates Cricket Board, allowing it to bring in top international players and coaches.

**Challenges and Opportunities**: While the league faces challenges such as infrastructure spending and attracting American sports fans, it also presents opportunities for cricket to establish itself in non-traditional markets and broaden its global reach.

**Economic Impact**: The MLC is expected to have a significant economic impact on the USA, creating jobs, revenue generation, and ancillary industry development, with potential to transform itself into a national economic powerhouse.

**Conclusion**: The MLC has the potential to be a turning point in the global proliferation of cricket, changing the dynamic of how cricket is played in the US, and contributing to its future growth and popularity worldwide.

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Washington Freedom March into the Playoffs with a Huge Win over MI New York
body:
Jasdeep Singh registered his career-best T20 bowling figures as Washington Freedom became the first team to qualify for the Playoffs of the Major League Cricket 2024 season with a 94-run win over MI New York at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Tuesday.

Player of the Match Jasdeep picked up 3/14 in three overs as MI NY folded out for 88, their lowest total in the history of MLC, in pursuit of 183. Marco Jansen also ended with impressive figures of 2/18 off four overs whereas Lockie Ferguson and Glenn Maxwell got two wickets each.

Travis Head got to his second consecutive half-century to power us to 182/5 in 20 overs. The southpaw hit nine fours and two sixes in his 33-ball 54. Andries Gous top-scored in the contest with 59 off 48 balls, his knock laden with four sixes and three fours.

Batting first, Head got us going with a four and six off Trent Boult in the fourth over as we reached 45/1 at the end of the powerplay. The Aussie continued his aggressive ways hitting three boundaries against spinner Nosthush Kenjige in the ninth over.

Head smashed a six and two fours in the next over to get to his fifty in just 28 balls. Gous also showcased his big-hitting ability with two sixes off Rashid Khan as we got to the 100-run mark after 11 overs. The pair added 73 runs for the second wicket in just 45 balls before Head was caught in the deep for 54.

Gous got to his fifty in the penultimate over before Rachin Ravindra injected the much-needed impetus pummeling 20 runs, including two sixes and a four. Ravindra hit 31 off only 14 balls as we went past the 180-run mark.

For MI NY both Rashid Khan and skipper Kieron Pollard picked up two wickets apiece.

We got to a great start with the ball as Marco Jansen sent back Steven Taylor off the third ball of the innings. Jasdeep Singh got two wickets in his first two overs, in identical fashion, as the MI NY batters perished to mistimed shots.

Jansen got another and soon Nicholas Pooran also holed out in the deep as MI NY collapsed to 25/5 at the end of the powerplay. Jasdeep picked up his third wicket of the night to dismiss Pollard to make things worse for the batting side.

Though Romario Shepherd and Boult showed some resistance, it only delayed the inevitable as we bundled MI NY for just 88 runs and continued our unbeaten run in the MLC 2024 season. Ferguson and Maxwell ended with 2/16 and 2/20, respectively.

We are currently on top of the MLC 2024 points table with nine points from five matches.

Next up, we will meet the Texas Super Kings in our next match at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Friday.

Washington Freedom vs MI New York MLC 2024 brief scores: WF 182/5 in 20 overs (Andries Gous 59, Travis Head 54, Kieron Pollard 2/14, Rashid Khan 2/39) vs MI NY 88/10 in 13.3 overs (Romario Shepherd 25, Trent Boult 16, Jasdeep Singh 3/14, Marco Jansen 2/18).

Washington Freedom won by 94 runs.
summary:
**Match Result:** Washington Freedom defeated MI New York by 94 runs to become the first team to qualify for the Playoffs of the Major League Cricket 2024 season.

**Washington Freedom's Performance:**

* Batting: Travis Head scored 54 off 33 balls, and Andries Gous top-scored with 59 off 48 balls to help Washington Freedom post 182/5 in 20 overs.
* Bowling: Jasdeep Singh registered his career-best T20 bowling figures of 3/14, while Marco Jansen, Lockie Ferguson, and Glenn Maxwell took two wickets each to restrict MI New York to 88/10 in 13.3 overs.

**MI New York's Performance:**

* Batting: Romario Shepherd scored 25, and Trent Boult scored 16, but the team was bowled out for their lowest total in MLC history.
* Bowling: Rashid Khan and Kieron Pollard took two wickets each.

**Tournament Standings:** Washington Freedom is currently at the top of the MLC 2024 points table with nine points from five matches.

title: Major League Cricket 2024 arrives on Prime Video for Australian & New Zealand viewers
body:
Prime Video and Cognizant Major League Cricket (MLC) have teamed up to provide exclusive broadcast rights for the 2024 MLC season in Australia and New Zealand.

The season, scheduled from July 6 to July 29 local time (July 5 to July 28 in the USA), will include all 25 matches accessible at no extra charge to Prime or Prime Video members.

The second season of Major League Cricket (MLC) will feature top international T20 players and prominent domestic talents from six major US cities: Dallas, San Francisco, New York City, Seattle, Los Angeles, and Washington D.C. Among the participating teams, eight Australian and five New Zealand players will be prominently represented.

Key signings for the upcoming season include:

Australian Test and ODI captain Pat Cummins joins the San Francisco Unicorns alongside Josh Inglis, Jake Fraser-McGurk, and New Zealand’s Matt Henry.

The Seattle Orcas have signed Kiwi batsman Michael Bracewell and bowler Lance Morris.

Washington Freedom, coached by Ricky Ponting, features Australian stars Steve Smith, Travis Head, and Glenn Maxwell, along with New Zealand bowlers Rachin Ravindra and Lockie Ferguson.

MI New York welcomes back Tim David and Trent Boult for their second season.

Australian bowler Adam Zampa joins the Los Angeles Knight Riders.

Hushidar Kharas, Head of Prime Video Australia and New Zealand, says, “At Prime Video, we are always looking for ways to deliver more value to our customers across our movies, TV series, and live sports offerings.The feedback from cricket fans in Australia for our first major event, ICC Men’s T20 World Cup, has been really positive, and we are delighted to expand our live sports offering through the Cognizant Major League Cricket. We are also excited to offer our customers in New Zealand the first live sports event included in their Prime Video membership.”

MLC CEO Vijay Srinivasan remarked, “We are thrilled to announce Prime Video as our broadcast partner for Cognizant Major League Cricket in New Zealand and Australia. This partnership marks a significant milestone in our journey to grow the season, which is in its second year, as well as bring the excitement of cricket to fans across the globe. Prime Video has solidified its position as a premier destination for cricket enthusiasts in Australia and New Zealand, showcasing major events such as the World Cup and acclaimed series such as The Test. MLC eagerly anticipates joining this platform, poised to contribute thrilling cricket action to its global audience through Prime Video’s extensive reach and expertise.”

Prime Video, a leading entertainment platform, provides millions of viewers worldwide with access to their favorite content. It has dedicated itself to offering top-tier sports entertainment to Australian and New Zealand audiences through acclaimed documentaries such as The Test (Seasons 1-3), Making Their Mark, Shane, Warriors on the Field, and Kick Like Tayla.
summary:
* The 2024 MLC season will be exclusively broadcasted on Prime Video in Australia and New Zealand from July 6 to July 29.
* The season will feature 25 matches, which will be accessible to Prime or Prime Video members at no extra charge.
* The tournament will include top international T20 players and domestic talents from six US cities: Dallas, San Francisco, New York City, Seattle, Los Angeles, and Washington D.C.
* The participating teams will feature a total of 13 Australian and New Zealand players, including notable signings such as Pat Cummins, Steve Smith, Glenn Maxwell, and Trent Boult.
* The teams and their notable players are:
	+ San Francisco Unicorns: Pat Cummins, Josh Inglis, Jake Fraser-McGurk, and Matt Henry
	+ Seattle Orcas: Michael Bracewell and Lance Morris
	+ Washington Freedom: Steve Smith, Travis Head, Glenn Maxwell, Rachin Ravindra, and Lockie Ferguson
	+ MI New York: Tim David and Trent Boult
	+ Los Angeles Knight Riders: Adam Zampa

title: Washington Freedom vs Texas Super Kings Preview & Prediction
body:
Click here for today’s sports betting tips from our expert analysts!

Off the back off an impressive opening game win, a well-rounded Washington Freedom squad continue their 2024 Major League Cricket campaign against a Texas Super Kings looking to bounce back from an opening game defeat.

DATE & TIME: Monday 8th July, 2024 - USA ET – 3:30pm / USA PT – 12:30pm / West Indies – 2:30pm / UK – 8:30pm / South Africa – 9:30pm / Tuesday 9th July, 2024 - Pakistan – 12:30am / India – 1:00am / Bangladesh – 1:30am / Australia – 5:30am

VENUE: Church Street Park, Morrisville, North Carolina, United States

WEATHER: 33c or 91.4 F with the possibility of a thunderstorm

HOW TO WATCH ON TV: USA – Willow TV / West Indies – TBA / UK – TNT Sports / South Africa – ESPN / Pakistan – A Sports / India – TBA / Bangladesh – TBA / Australia – N/A

HOW TO WATCH ONLINE: USA – Willow TV / West Indies – TBA / UK – TNT Sports app / South Africa – ESPN+ app / Pakistan – A Sports / India – TBA / Bangladesh – TBA / Australia – Amazon Prime Video

WASHINGTON FREEDOM FORM: A STRONG SQUAD

In their opening game of the tournament, the Washington Freedom managed to defeat defending champions MI New York in Morrisville with a four-run DLS victory. MI New York scored 154-9 with US international Saurabh Netravalkar taking 3-24 off his four overs before Steve Smith’s unbeaten 46 from 28 balls saw Freedom home by a slender margin before the rain came.

LAST THREE: WLLWW

TEXAS SUPER KINGS FORM: EXPERIENCED IN ABUNDANCE

The Texas Super Kings, built with the help of so-called ‘Dad’s Army’ Indian Premier League franchise Chennai Super Kings, began their season with a 12-run loss to last season’s wooden spoon outfit Los Angeles Knight Riders in Dallas with Devon Conway’s 53 runs from 39 deliveries not enough to see TSK reach the target of 163.

LAST THREE: LLLWL

WASHINGTON FREEDOM BETTING ANALYSIS

The Washington Freedom have a squad heavily influenced by Australians with aforementioned captain Steve Smith leading the likes of Travis Head and Glenn Maxwell among others. Head missed out with just one run from seven balls against MI New York but that is not expected to be a common occurrence for their Test number five and Head to top score for Freedom is always a good bet.

With the ball, they have a well-rounded attack, too, with plenty of spin options but also the pace of Marco Jansen, Lockie Ferguson and Saurabh Netravalkar. Ferguson took 1-28 the other day and his bowling has been difficult to hit for a while now, famously taking 3-0 from four overs for New Zealand against Papua New Guinea last month, so Ferguson to be Freedom’s best bowler in this one would be a good shout.

TEXAS SUPER KINGS BETTING ANALYSIS

As mentioned, there is experience throughout the TSK side but the downside to that is there is perhaps not bundles of energy and that was shown in their fairly slow chase the other day. If they are to up the tempo then a lot will rest on the shoulders of Aaron Hardie and Marcus Stoinis. Stoinis didn’t have the best of starts with two from six but if he gets going he is a formidable hitter and Stoinis to hit two or more sixes in any innings, especially one where he needs to respond, would be a reasonable expectation.

In the bowling department, the Super Kings lack a bit of quality experience with Zia-ul-Haq their best bowler from the other day, taking 2-16. Spin is likely to be their biggest threat against the likes of Head and Smith, and even Maxwell, though, so Mohammad Mohsin, despite going wicket-less the other day, would be tipped to take two or more wickets here.

WASHINGTON FREEDOM VS TEXAS SUPER KINGS EXPERT PREDICTION

There are quite a few issues in the Texas Super Kings side and there is probably too much reliance on the opening pair of Faf du Plessis and Devon Conway to score their runs. That means they will likely take their time to get set and TSK having the better opening stand, or at least the biggest with the pace of Head’s innings likely to be a major factor in the game, would be a good bet but Washington Freedom, albeit not overly convincing against MI New York the other day, would still be viewed as favourites for the match.
summary:
**Match Details**

* Date: Monday, July 8, 2024
* Time: Various times depending on the region (listed in the article)
* Venue: Church Street Park, Morrisville, North Carolina, United States
* Weather: 33°C (91.4°F) with a possibility of a thunderstorm

**Teams**

* Washington Freedom: Coming off a 4-run DLS victory over MI New York in their opening game, with a strong squad led by Steve Smith.
* Texas Super Kings: Lost their opening game to Los Angeles Knight Riders by 12 runs, with an experienced team built with the help of Chennai Super Kings.

**Form**

* Washington Freedom: WLLWW in their last five games
* Texas Super Kings: LLLWL in their last five games

**Key Players**

* Washington Freedom: Steve Smith, Travis Head, Glenn Maxwell, Marco Jansen, Lockie Ferguson, and Saurabh Netravalkar
* Texas Super Kings: Aaron Hardie, Marcus Stoinis, Faf du Plessis, Devon Conway, Zia-ul-Haq, and Mohammad Mohsin

**Prediction**

* Washington Freedom are favored to win the match, despite not being overly convincing in their opening game win over MI New York.

title: Sony Sports Network acquires exclusive television rights
body:
Culver Max Entertainment Private Limited, who owns and operates Sony Sports Network, the leading sports broadcaster in India, is delighted to announce the acquisition of exclusive television rights for T20 cricket spectacle Major League Cricket (MLC) for one year in India. The second edition of the league will kickstart with reigning champions MI New York facing Seattle Orcas in the opener at Church Street Park, Morrisville and will be live telecast in India 6th July 2024. The grand finale of the tournament will be played at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas and will be live telecast in India on 29th July 2024.

A major share from the ongoing cricket revolution in the United States can be attributed to MLC, which has attracted eyeballs of India’s evergreen cricket fraternity. The participation from Indian cricket franchises Mumbai Indians, Kolkata Knight Riders and Chennai Super Kings brings a whole new level of excitement for fans of the respective teams. Some of the most popular cricketers including Quinton de Kock, Marcus Stoinis, Nicholas Pooran are expected to feature in the upcoming edition of the league.

The MLC’s second season features an all-star lineup of announcers, including the former captain of the Indian national cricket team and great batsman Sunil Gavaskar, Pakistani legendary bowler Wasim Akram, former New Zealand and Auckland cricketer Danny Morrison, alongside Daren Ganga, Pommie Mbangwa, Matthew Hayden, Chris Morris, Natalie Germanos, Scott Styris, and Mike Haysmen.

The inaugural edition of MLC attained critical success with six teams participating i.e. San Francisco Unicorns, Washington Freedom, Texas Super Kings, Seattle Orcas, Los Angeles Knight Riders and MI New York. Team MI New York was crowned champions after they defeated Seattle Orcas in the final played at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas. Nicholas Pooran, who featured for the champions, registered 388 runs and was adjudged the Player of the Season last year.

With the acquisition of television rights for Major League Cricket, Sony Sports Network has asserted its solid footprint in broadcasting cricket properties. The broadcaster’s cricket portfolio already boasts of rights for New Zealand Cricket, England Cricket Board, Sri Lanka Cricket & the recent addition of India Tour of Zimbabwe T20I series.

Watch Major League Cricket Season 2 from 6th July 2024, 1:00 AM IST onwards, LIVE on Sony Sports Ten 1 SD & HD & Sony Sports Ten 5 SD & HD channels.
summary:
**Tournament Details**

* The second edition of MLC will start on July 6, 2024, with the opening match between MI New York and Seattle Orcas at Church Street Park, Morrisville.
* The grand finale will be played on July 29, 2024, at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas.
* The tournament will be live telecast in India on Sony Sports Ten 1 SD & HD and Sony Sports Ten 5 SD & HD channels.

**Teams and Players**

* The inaugural edition featured six teams: San Francisco Unicorns, Washington Freedom, Texas Super Kings, Seattle Orcas, Los Angeles Knight Riders, and MI New York.
* MI New York won the inaugural edition, with Nicholas Pooran being adjudged the Player of the Season.
* Popular cricketers like Quinton de Kock, Marcus Stoinis, and Nicholas Pooran are expected to participate in the upcoming edition.

**Announcers**

* The MLC's second season will feature an all-star lineup of announcers, including Sunil Gavaskar, Wasim Akram, Danny Morrison, and others.

**Broadcasting Rights**

* Sony Sports Network has acquired the exclusive television rights for MLC in India for one year.

title: Major League Cricket 2024- Match 4, LAKR vs SFU- Cricket Betting Tips and Match Predictions: July 7
body:
Here are the Fantasy Cricket Predictions and Betting Tips for the Major League Cricket Match 4- LA Knight Riders vs San Francisco Unicorns which will be played on the 7th of July at the Grand Prairie Stadium, Texas.

Batting Stats T20

Match 4- LA Knight Riders vs San Francisco Unicorns (Grand Prairie Stadium, Texas)

Current Form LA Knight Riders:

LA Knight Riders are currently placed at the 2nd position on points table with 1 win to their credit.

The top run scorer for LA Knight Riders in the Major League Cricket is Unmukt Chand with 68 runs to his name.

The top wicket taker for LA Knight Riders in the Major League Cricket is Ali Khan with 4 scalps under his belt.

LA Knight Riders have won their first match of the Major League Cricket against Texas Super Kings by 12 runs.

LA Knight Riders batted first and they posted a total of 162 for 7 in 20 overs. Jason Roy and Sunil Narine got out cheaply. After their dismissals, Unmukt Chand played a fine knock of 68 runs in 45 balls. He hit 6 fours and 3 huge sixes during his innings. Nitish Kumar also played a nice cameo of 26 runs in 17 balls to help LA Knight Riders get to 162 in 20 overs of play.

During the chase, Devon Conway and Faf du Plessis started off really well for Texas Super Kings. They stitched a partnership of 30 runs for the first wicket. A couple of wickets fell in quick succession in the middle order and Super Kings all of a sudden looked in deep waters. Devon Conway kept on batting well and made 53 runs off 39 balls but he barely got any support at the other end as Texas Super Kings were restricted to 150 for 8 in 20 overs, losing the match by 12 runs.

Current Form San Francisco Unicorns:

San Francisco Unicorns played poorly in the previous edition of the Major League Cricket. They finished at the 5th position on points table after league stages. San Francisco Unicorns managed to win only 2 matches out of the 5 games they participated in.

The top run scorer for San Francisco Unicorns in the previous edition was Corey Anderson with 190 runs to his name.

The top wicket taker for San Francisco Unicorns in the previous edition was Liam Plunkett with 7 scalps under his belt.

San Francisco Unicorns have big names in their squad like Pat Cummins, Jake Fraser-McGurk, Matt Henry, Haris Rauf and Josh Inglis. They should be able to make it to the Playoffs easily, considering the strength they have in both batting as well as the bowling department.

Players to look out for:

1. Jake Fraser-McGurk - He is one of the most exciting players in T20 format. Jake Fraser-McGurk played superbly in the recently concluded Indian Premier League and he will look to continue his good form in the Major League Cricket as well.

2. Pat Cummins - He picked up 2 hattricks in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup. Cummins is expected to continue his merry ways with the ball in Major League Cricket.

title: Pooran sparkles again but MI lose
body:
MORRISVILLE, North Caroline (CMC):

NICHOLAS POORAN extended his healthy form in the newly minted Major League Cricket campaign, but his MI New York were left cursing the weather after going down by four runs to Washington Freedom on Saturday.

Having posted 154 for nine from their 20 overs with the left-handed Pooran top-scoring with 44, MI New York watched as Freedom coasted to 55 for one in the eighth over.

Thunderstorms at Church Street Park then forced players from the field for good with Freedom ahead on Duckworth-Lewis-Stern, thanks mainly to a terrible sixth over from South Africa speedster Anrich Nortje, which leaked 22 runs.

Sent in, Mi New York got 28 off 22 balls from opener Ruben Clinton but still found themselves stumbling on 53 for three in the eighth over.

Pooran arrived at number five to shepherd the innings, striking five fours and a six in a 30-ball knock, while Afghan star Rashid Khan blasted a 15-ball 31 with two fours and three sixes to further rally the innings.

West Indies left-arm spinner Akeal Hosein sent down one over, which cost nine runs, while left-arm seamer Saurabh Netravalkar (3-24) and medium pacer Justin Dill (3-33) finished with three wickets apiece.

In reply, Australia’s Steven Smith punched an unbeaten 46 off 28 balls with four fours and three sixes as Freedom recovered from the loss of Travis Head for one in the second over with three on the board, to get their chase back on course.
summary:
* Match: MI New York vs Washington Freedom
* Result: Washington Freedom won by 4 runs (Duckworth-Lewis-Stern method) due to thunderstorms interrupting the game.
* MI New York's score: 154 for 9 in 20 overs, with Nicholas Pooran top-scoring with 44.
* Notable performances: Pooran (44), Rashid Khan (31 off 15 balls), Ruben Clinton (28 off 22 balls).
* Washington Freedom's score: 55 for 1 in 8 overs, with Steven Smith scoring an unbeaten 46 off 28 balls.
* Notable bowlers: Saurabh Netravalkar (3-24), Justin Dill (3-33), Akeal Hosein (1 over, 9 runs).

title: MLC 2024: San Francisco Unicorns Triumph Over LA Knight Riders in Campaign Opener
body:
oi-Aditya K Halder

San Francisco Unicorns began their campaign in the second season of Major League Cricket -- MLC 2024 -- with an impressive six-wicket win over Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Sunday.

This match marked the first defeat of this edition for the Knight Riders, who had begun their campaign with a comeback win over Texas Super Kings in the MLC 2024 opener.

Opting to bat first, the Knight Riders couldn't build substantial partnerships. Opener Jason Roy contributed a brisk 26 off 18 balls before being bowled by Plunkett. Despite small contributions from Sunil Narine (6), Nitish Kumar (20), and David Miller (24), the team struggled to maintain momentum.

Shakib Al Hasan stood out with a solid 35 off 26 balls, but it was Andre Russell's explosive unbeaten 40 off 25 balls that provided a late surge, helping LAKR to a total of 165 for 6 in their 20 overs.

The Unicorns' bowling attack was led by Brody Couch and Haris Rauf, both claiming two wickets each. Couch finished with impressive figures of 2 for 24, while Rauf took 2 for 38. Their disciplined bowling ensured that LAKR's batsmen could never fully capitalize on their starts.

In response, the Unicorns got off to a shaky start, losing Jake Fraser-McGurk early for 9 runs. However, New Zealand opener Finn Allen and Matthew Short took control of the chase.

Allen's aggressive 63 off 37 balls and Short's blistering 58 off 26 balls formed a match-winning partnership of 116 runs for the second wicket. Their combined assault left the LAKR bowlers struggling, particularly targeting Spencer Johnson, who despite taking three wickets, conceded 36 runs in his four overs.

Veteran spinner Sunil Narine managed to take a wicket, finishing with 1 for 39, but the rest of the LAKR bowlers failed to make significant inroads. The Unicorns achieved the target comfortably, reaching 166 for 4 in just 15.2 overs, sealing a comprehensive victory.

With this dominant performance, the San Francisco Unicorns have set a high standard for their season ahead. The LA Knight Riders will need to regroup and strategize better for their upcoming matches to bounce back from this defeat.
summary:
**Match Result:** San Francisco Unicorns won by 6 wickets against Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) in the second season of Major League Cricket (MLC 2024).

**Match Details:** LAKR batted first and scored 165 for 6 in 20 overs, with Shakib Al Hasan scoring 35 and Andre Russell contributing 40*. In response, the Unicorns chased the target down comfortably, reaching 166 for 4 in 15.2 overs, thanks to Finn Allen's 63 and Matthew Short's 58.

**Key Performances:** Brody Couch and Haris Rauf took 2 wickets each for the Unicorns, while Finn Allen and Matthew Short formed a match-winning partnership of 116 runs for the second wicket.

**Takeaways:** This was LAKR's first defeat in MLC 2024, and they will need to regroup and strategize better for their upcoming matches. The San Francisco Unicorns have set a high standard for their season ahead with this dominant performance.

title: MLC: Allen, Short Star As San Francisco Unicorns Down LA Knight Riders By 6 Wickets
body:
San Francisco Unicorns: San Francisco Unicorns registered a comprehensive six-wicket win against LA Knight Riders in the fourth match of the 2024 Major League Cricket.

Electing to bowl first at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, San Francisco Unicorns limited the LA Knight Riders to 165/6, with debutant Broady Couch (2/24) and Harris Rauf (2/38) bagging two wickets each, before blistering half-centuries from Finn Allen (63) and Matthew Short (58) orchestrated a swift run chase for the Unicorns.

Andre Russell’s (40*) late surge proved too little for the LA Knight Riders, whose star batters such as David Miller (24), Shakib Al Hassan (35) and Jason Roy (26) failed to capitalise on their starts.

Trending

San Francisco Unicorns’ run chase saw opener Jake Fraser Mcgurk (9) fall early, caught behind on Spencer Johnson’s bowling. However, Finn Allen looked eager to make a quick meal of the target. The right-handed opener smashed Russell for two consecutive sixes in the fifth over, followed by three consecutive sixes of Shakib Al Hassan in the next over, to complete five maximums in just as many deliveries. At the end of the powerplay the Unicorns were firmly in the driver’s seat with a score of 67/1.

Opener Matthew Short switched gears following the powerplay, striking Corne Dry for two more sixes in the seventh over. In the eighth over, Fin Allen brought up his half-century in 23 deliveries, while Matthew Short continued to clear the ropes with ease, bringing up his half-century soon after in 23 balls too, comprising five sixes and three fours.

When the colossal 116-run stand between Allen and Short was finally dented by Sunil Narine in the 12th over, the Unicorns were cruising to their target, needing only 29 runs in 48 balls. While Finn Allen became Spencer Johnson’s second wicket of the night in the 13th over, Josh Inglis (15), Corey Anderson (11), and Hassan Khan (2) helped the Unicorns reach their target in 15.2 overs.

Spencer Johnson was the leading wicket-taker for the LA Knight Riders with figures of 3/36.

Earlier, San Francisco Unicorns bowlers did well to restrict the LA Knight Riders. By the end of the powerplay, LA Knight Riders were 42/2, having lost the wickets of Sunil Narine (6) and Unmukt Chand (0). Opener Jason Roy (26) looked threatening and cracked four boundaries in his 18-ball stint before he was cleaned up by Liam Plunkett in the seventh over.

The experienced Shakib Al Hassan (35), and Nitish Kumar (20) came together to put on the biggest partnership of the innings. The pair put on 45 runs in 31 deliveries in the middle overs before Abrar Ahmed and Brody Couch dismissed the pair in consecutive overs.

Earlier, San Francisco Unicorns bowlers did well to restrict the LA Knight Riders. By the end of the powerplay, LA Knight Riders were 42/2, having lost the wickets of Sunil Narine (6) and Unmukt Chand (0). Opener Jason Roy (26) looked threatening and cracked four boundaries in his 18-ball stint before he was cleaned up by Liam Plunkett in the seventh over.

Also Read: Akram ‘hopes’ Indian Team Will Travel To Pakistan For Champions Trophy

Brief scores: LA Knight Riders 165/6 in 20 overs (Andre Russell 40*, Shakib Al Hassan 35; Brody Couch 2-24) lost to San Francisco Unicorns 166/4 in 15.2 overs (Finn Allen 63, Matthew Short 58; Spencer Johnson 3/36) by six wickets.
