HOW TO WATCH ON TV: USA – Willow TV / West Indies – TBA / UK – TNT Sports / South Africa – ESPN / Pakistan – A Sports / India – Sony Sports / Bangladesh – TBA / Australia – TBA

HOW TO WATCH ONLINE: USA – Willow TV / West Indies – TBA / UK – discovery+ / South Africa – ESPN+ app / Pakistan – A Sports / India – Sony LIV / Bangladesh – TBA / Australia & New Zealand – Amazon Prime Video

WASHINGTON FREEDOM FORM: UNICORNS WITH LITTLE TIME TO RECOVER FROM DEFEAT

Washington Freedom gained their revenge on the Unicorns for ruining their unbeaten league stage campaign by beating them in the all-important qualifier to book their place in Sunday’s night’s final in Dallas. The win came by seven wickets, the Freedom bowling out San Francisco for 145, before chasing that target down in just 15.3 overs.

LAST THREE: WLW

SAN FRANCISCO UNICORNS FORM: CAN SUPER KINGS SECURE A MUCH-CRAVED HOME FINAL

San Francisco Unicorns may have been put in their place by Washington in a qualifier, but showed huge guts and class to bounce back in the challenger, breaking the hearts of home team Texas Super Kings. The Unicorns made 200/6 in a high-scoring thriller, which they ultimately won by 10 runs, restricting Texas to 190/4.

LAST THREE: WLW

WASHINGTON FREEDOM BETTING ANALYSIS

The two Washington Freedom openers being the second and third highest scoring batters in the tournament is testament to the strength of their top order. Travis Head’s 77 not out in the qualifier took his overall tally to 327, whilst opening partner Steve Smith boasts 248 runs of his own. The smart move would be placing a stake on both via the ‘Team - Top Batter’ and also backing the pair to each record over 30+ match runs.

So often a left-arm pacer can prove worth their weight in gold across the T20 format and Marco Jansen demonstrated that last time out, taking three wickets against San Francisco. Jansen’s height poses an additional threat in regards to generation extra bounce and making a play for the South African to pick up over 1.5 match wickets looks good value.

SAN FRANCISCO UNICORNS BETTING ANALYSIS

Once again, Finn Allen was the star for San Francisco Uniforms in the challenger having accumulated one of his best individual innings in T20 cricket. It was his 101 off 53 balls which ensured an eventual winning total for the Unicorns vs Texas. He will have a huge role to play in the final and on the back of such a brilliant score, is worth backing to accrue over 24.5 match runs here. His six-hitting abilities could also warrant investment, specifically via the ‘Batter Total Match Sixes’ market.

On the bowling front, Hassan Khan has taken three wickets across the play-offs so far and his left-arm orthodox slow bowling has been tricky to deal with from an opposition point of view. You’d expect Hassan to bowl his four-over allocation in the final and a stake on him to pick up 2+ wickets via the ‘Bowler Milestones’ market is worth serious consideration.

WASHINGTON FREEDOM VS SAN FRANCISCO UNICORNS EXPERTPREDICTION

The last time these two teams met, Washington Freedom demonstrated their class in all departments. Outplaying San Francisco with bat and ball, the Freedom have shown why they’ve set the standard throughout this year’s edition of Major League Cricket. Having a world class top order that combines control with aggression has been key to their success, whilst all avenues are well-covered within the bowling department.

Plenty depends on Finn Allen from a San Francisco point of view, but if he was to fail then you would worry about the Unicorns’ depth, particularly if Washington was to take a cluster of early wickets. With just one defeat across the tournament so far, in a game that had precious little at stake from their point of view, Washington Freedom have been outstanding and the expectation is that they will take that final step and emerge triumphant in the second year of Major League Cricket.

The middle-order collapse continued as Sherfane Rutherford (4) and Josh Inglis (18) fell early, extinguishing any hopes of a miraculous chase. Andrew Tye, who was brought in for the final, picked up two pivotal wickets, further tightening the noose around the Unicorns. Rachin Ravindra then cleaned out the tail with an impressive spell, ending with figures of 3/23.

Earlier in the ultimate match of the tournament, the team from Washington lost Head (9) early. Then, Steve Smith (88) took centre stage, anchoring the innings with a masterful knock. He found support in Andries Gous (21), who added a steadying partnership before both Gous and Rachin Ravindra (11) fell without significant contributions. Undeterred, Smith unleashed a barrage of strokes, finding the boundary with ease.

Glenn Maxwell (40) joined Smith and the duo took the game away from the Unicorns with their aggressive batting. A memorable over saw Drysdale concede 28 runs as both Smith and Maxwell went berserk, setting the stage for a massive total.

Smith's departure, followed shortly by Maxwell's, brought Mukhtar Ahmed (19*) to the crease, who contributed a quick cameo with a couple of big hits, pushing the total past the 200-mark. The Freedom ended their innings at 208, a record total for a final.

Brief Scores: Washington Freedom (Steve Smith 88, Glenn Maxwell 40, Pat Cummins 2/35) beat San Francisco Unicorns (Carmi Le Roux 20, Josh Inglis 18, Marco Jansen 3/28) by 96 runs.

title: Washington Freedom crowned Major League Cricket 2024 champions after 96-run victory over San Francisco Unicorns
body:
The Washington Freedom, led by Steve Smith, have been crowned the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 champions after a decisive 96-run victory over the San Francisco Unicorns at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, Texas.

The skipper’s blistering 88 runs off just 52 balls propelled Washington Freedom to a commanding total of 207-5. The bowlers then went on the rampage, bowling out the opposition for a mere 111 runs.

The Unicorns skipper Corey Anderson elected to bowl first after winning the toss. This decision paid off early as Travis Head was dismissed cheaply, leaving the Freedom at a precarious 86-3 midway through the innings. In the second half of the innings, Smith and Glenn Maxwell batted relentlessly and tormented the Unicorns bowlers.

A 22-ball 40-run blitz from Maxwell, along with quick-fire innings from Mukhtar Ahmed and Obus Pienaar, propelled the team past the 200-run mark.

The Washington side displayed clinical efficiency with both their bowling and batting. Meanwhile, the San Francisco Unicorns were overwhelmed by the demanding run rate from the start, losing their top order batsmen within the first five overs.

The left-arm pace of Marco Jansen and Saurabh Netravalkar proved devastating during the powerplay and mounted pressure on the Washington Freedom. Led by Anderson, the side struggled, losing wickets at regular intervals and limping to 68-7 by the halfway mark.

Cameos from Pat Cummins and Carmi le Roux propelled the team to a triple-digit total. However, the match’s outcome soon became inevitable. Rachin Ravindra sealed the victory by claiming his third wicket, dismissing Juanoy Drysdale with the final delivery of the 16th over.

Texas Super Kings skipper Faf du Plessis of the finished the tournament as the top scorer, amassing 420 runs. Meanwhile, Washington Freedom pacer Saurabh Netravalkar was the tournament’s top wicket-taker, claiming 15 dismissals.
summary:
**Champions:** Washington Freedom, led by Steve Smith, won the MLC 2024 championship by defeating the San Francisco Unicorns by 96 runs.

**Final Match:** The final match was played at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, Texas, where Washington Freedom scored 207-5, thanks to Steve Smith's 88 runs off 52 balls and Glenn Maxwell's 40 runs off 22 balls. The Unicorns were bowled out for 111 runs, with Marco Jansen and Saurabh Netravalkar taking wickets during the powerplay.

**Tournament Awards:** Faf du Plessis of the Texas Super Kings was the top scorer of the tournament with 420 runs, while Saurabh Netravalkar of the Washington Freedom was the top wicket-taker with 15 dismissals.

title: MLC 2024: Washington Freedom clinch title after dominating all departments | Major League Cricket, 2024
body:
Washington Freedom’s (WF) dominant run in the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 ended with a deserving win in the final, hammering San Francisco Unicorns (SFU) by a massive margin of 96 runs.

After being asked to bat first, Travis Head and Steven Smith, who have been the best batters of MLC 2024 were not able to give a good start as the former was dismissed for nine in the second over. Captain Smith stood at one end and got great support from Andries Gous, Rachin and Glenn Maxwell, bringing their side into the game.

Maxwell & Smith’s aggressive 83-run partnership between over 11-17 pushed Washington’s potential total from 180 to 200+. Maxwell’s 40 of 22 and final over fireworks from Mukhtar Ahmed and Obus Pienaar resulted in Washington Freedom posting a huge total of 207/5 at the end of 20 overs. Pat Cummins was the pick of the bowlers for San Francisco as he finished with 2/35, while Hassan Khan, Haris Rauf and Juanoy Drysdale picked up a wicket apiece.

Chasing 208, the San Francisco Unicorns lost their youthful top order in the first five overs as Marco Jansen sent back both openers in Jake Fraser-McGurk and Finn Allen early. The Washington bowlers gave no room for San Francisco batters to open their arms as they ran through their batting line-up, bowling them out for just 111 runs and clinching their first-ever MLC Title. Jansen and Rachin picked up three wickets each with Tye taking two and Maxwell and Netravalkar sharing one wicket each.

With complete domination in batting, bowling and fielding, Washington Freedom led by Smith and coached by Ricky Ponting won the second edition of Major League Cricket.

Final: Washington Freedom beat San Francisco Unicorns by 96 runs

Top performers of MLC 2024

Hits of MLC 2024

Travis Head (Washington Freedom)

Travis Head had an outstanding MLC 2024. Making his debut in MLC, Head came in with a huge reputation for being a destructive opener after his heroics in IPL 2024 and ICC T20WC 2024. He lived up to the hype as the South Australian smashed 336 runs at a massive strike rate of 174. He smashed five consecutive fifties and outplayed the oppositions almost single handedly. Apart from winning the championship, he was awarded the “Player of the Tournament” award for his match-winning knocks.

Steven Smith (Washington Freedom)

Steven Smith redeemed himself in T20 cricket through a championship-winning season for Washington Freedom. He stepped up as both batter and captain as he led his team to the title, winning seven of the nine games. With the bat, he proved his mettle as an opener. He smashed 336 runs at an average of 56 with a strike rate of 149, smashing three fifties, with the most important one coming in the final.

Saurabh Netravalkar (Washington Freedom)

Saurabh Netravalkar had an excellent season. He was the highest wicket-taker with 15 wickets in seven innings at an outstanding strike rate of 10.5. The experience of playing the big teams in ICC T20WC 2024 helped Netravalkar become an even better bowler in MLC 2024.

Rashid Khan (MI New York)

Rashid Khan was one of the few positives for the relatively below-par season for inaugural champions MI New York. He showcased his all-round capabilities as he picked up 10 wickets, maintaining a good economy of 6.2. He stepped up the bat, too, scoring 162 runs in seven innings with two fifties. His strike rate of 178 with the bat was the third-best for a batter in MLC 2024.

Misses of MLC 2024

Sunil Narine (LA Knight Riders)

Sunil Narine had a horror season with both bat and ball. With the bat, he scored just 27 runs in six innings at an average of just 4.5, which is the lowest for a batter this season. He did not even reach a double-digit score in any of the six games. As a bowler, he managed just five wickets in six innings, even though he put the batters under pressure with an economy of 6.2. His failure with bat and ball impacted his captaincy as the LA Knight Riders failed to qualify for the playoffs.

Kieron Pollard (MI New York)

Kieron Pollard, too, was another captain who was a burden on his own team during MLC 2024. Leading MI New York, the big West Indian managed just 64 runs in seven innings. He averaged 12.6 and scored at a strike rate of 98, which was un-Pollard-like. He picked up five wickets in seven games as the occasional bowler. His overall performance did not live up to a captain’s standards.

Jake Fraser McGurk (San Francisco Unicorns)

The Victorian sensation Jake Fraser McGurk had an MLC to forget as he was one of the least impactful players for the eventual runners-up, San Francisco Unicorns. In seven innings, he managed just 81 runs at an average of 11.6. He had a below-par strike rate of 126 and failed to cross even 20 runs in the seven innings.

Haris Rauf (San Francisco Unicorns)

Haris Rauf had a quiet MLC 2024, as he managed just four wickets in nine games. His economy was also on the higher side as he gave away runs at 9.1 runs/over. His bowling strike rate of 48.5 was the worst for a bowler in MLC 2024. He went wicketless in six of the nine games.

Breakout performers in MLC 2024

Hassan Khan (San Francisco Unicorns)

The 25-year-old all-rounder Hassan Khan had a breakout performance in MLC 2024. Representing San Francisco Unicorns, the attacking batter came at the lower order (6-8) and smashed 204 runs at an average of 40.8 with a strike rate of 144. With the ball, the left-arm spinner picked up 10 wickets in seven innings with an economy of 7.1 and a strike rate of 13.2. He was a standout performer for his team as he was their highest wicket-taker and second-highest run-scorer over Matt Short, Jake Fraser-McGurk, Josh Inglis and others.

Unique Statistical Milestones

Australian players to score five consecutive fifties in a T20 tournament

David Warner - IPL 2019

Travis Head - MLC 2024

Highest win% for an Australian Captain in T20Is (50+ matches)

64.1 - Ashton Turner

63.3 - Steven Smith

62.2 - Adam Voges

61.3 - Moises Henriques

61.1 - Daniel Christian
summary:
**Final Match:** Washington Freedom (WF) won the MLC 2024 title by defeating San Francisco Unicorns (SFU) by 96 runs in the final. WF posted a total of 207/5 in 20 overs, and SFU was bowled out for 111 runs.

**Top Performers:**

* Travis Head (WF): Player of the Tournament, scored 336 runs at a strike rate of 174, and won the championship with WF.
* Steven Smith (WF): Led WF to the title, scoring 336 runs at an average of 56 with a strike rate of 149.
* Saurabh Netravalkar (WF): Highest wicket-taker with 15 wickets in seven innings at an outstanding strike rate of 10.5.
* Rashid Khan (MI New York): Picked up 10 wickets, scored 162 runs in seven innings with two fifties, and maintained a strike rate of 178 with the bat.

**Breakout Performers:**

* Hassan Khan (SFU): Scored 204 runs at an average of 40.8 with a strike rate of 144, and picked up 10 wickets in seven innings with an economy of 7.1.

**Misses of MLC 2024:**

* Sunil Narine (LA Knight Riders): Had a horror season with both bat and ball, scoring just 27 runs in six innings and managing only five wickets in six innings.
* Kieron Pollard (MI New York): Failed to live up to expectations, scoring just 64 runs in seven innings and picking up five wickets in seven games.
* Jake Fraser McGurk (SFU): Managed just 81 runs in seven innings at an average of 11.6, and failed to cross even 20 runs in the seven innings.
* Haris Rauf (SFU): Managed just four wickets in nine games with an economy of 9.1 runs/over and a bowling strike rate of 48.5.

**Unique Statistical Milestones:**

* Travis Head became the second Australian player to score five consecutive fifties in a T20 tournament, matching David Warner's feat in IPL 2019.
* Steven Smith achieved a win percentage of 63.3 as an Australian captain in T20Is, ranking second behind Ashton Turner.

title: Washington Freedom Makes History in 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket Final Qualification
body:
Washington Freedom secures a spot in the 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket Final after Travis Head and Glenn Maxwell's exceptional performance leads them to victory over the San Francisco Unicorns.

By the Numbers

Washington Freedom bowled out San Francisco Unicorns for 145 before achieving their target in 16 overs.

Travis Head scored his fifth successive fifty in twenty-eight balls during the match.

Yes, But

Despite San Francisco Unicorns' efforts, they fell short against Washington Freedom, now needing to face Texas Super Kings to secure a spot in the finals.

State of Play

Washington Freedom advances to the Cognizant Major League Cricket 2024 finals as the first team to do so.

San Francisco Unicorns will battle against Texas Super Kings for a chance to compete in the summit match.

What's Next

The San Francisco Unicorns will face off against the Texas Super Kings in an intense match to determine the second finalist for the 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket final.

Bottom Line

Travis Head's exceptional performance propels Washington Freedom to the final, setting the stage for an exciting showdown in the 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket final.
summary: The Washington Freedom have secured a spot in the 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket Final, becoming the first team to do so. They defeated the San Francisco Unicorns, bowling them out for 145 and achieving their target in 16 overs. Travis Head scored his fifth consecutive fifty in just 28 balls, and along with Glenn Maxwell, led the team to victory. The San Francisco Unicorns will now face the Texas Super Kings to determine the second finalist for the championship match. The winner of that match will play against the Washington Freedom in the 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket final.

title: Smith and Maxwell Shine as Washington Freedom Clinches Major League Cricket Title
body:
Washington Freedom clinched the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 title with a dominant 96-run victory over San Francisco Unicorns led by Steven Smith and Glenn Maxwell in Dallas.

By the Numbers

Smith scored 88 runs off 52 balls, including six sixes.

Ravindra took 3 wickets for 23 runs, while Jansen also took 3 for 28 runs.

Freedom added 121 runs in the second half of their innings.

Yes, But

Steven Smith's T20I career is likely over after being omitted from Australia's World Cup squad and upcoming matches against Scotland and England.

State of Play

Washington Freedom had five wins in the group stage and progressed directly to the final by defeating Unicorns in the Qualifier.

Freedom's victory marked Ricky Ponting's title win as the coach after departing from Delhi Capitals.

What's Next

Smith's absence from the national squad hints at a shift towards grooming younger talents for Australia's T20 lineup in the future.

Bottom Line

Washington Freedom's emphatic title win, led by Smith and Maxwell, showcases the team's dominance and sets a platform for potential changes in Australia's T20 squad.
summary: The Washington Freedom won the MLC 2024 title by defeating the San Francisco Unicorns by 96 runs in the final match in Dallas. The team was led by Steven Smith, who scored 88 runs off 52 balls, and Glenn Maxwell. Other notable performances included Ravindra taking 3 wickets for 23 runs and Jansen taking 3 for 28 runs. Washington Freedom had a strong group stage, winning five matches and progressing directly to the final. This victory marked Ricky Ponting's first title win as a coach since leaving Delhi Capitals.

title: MLC 2024 Final: Awards & Stats From Season After Washington Freedom Win Major League Cricket Title
body:
oi-Mark Hoover

Steve Smith led from the front as Washington Freedom clinched the Major League Cricket title following a thumping 96-run victory over San Francisco Unicorns in the MLC 2024 Final on Sunday (July 28) at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, Texas.

After skipper Smith smashed 88 off 52 balls to power Washington Freedom to 207/5 in their allotted 20 overs, Marco Jansen and Rachin Ravindra picked three wickets each to bundle out the San Francisco Unicorns for 111 in 16 overs.

Carmi le Roux's unbeaten 20 off 19 balls was the highest score for a San Francisco batter as their top two run-getters from the season Finn Allen and Hassan Khan could only manage 13 runs each.

For Washington Freedom, Jansen (3 for 28) and Ravindra (3 for 23) were the pick of the bowlers, while rest of the bowling attack didn't disappoint either as Saurabh Netravalkar (1 for 33), Andrew Tye (2 for 12) and Glenn Maxwell (1 for 14) also chipped in with wickets.

Earlier, being put into bat, Smith and Maxwell (40 off 22 balls) shared an 83-run stand for the fourth wicket to take Washington past 150 before late unbeaten cameos from Mukhtar Ahmed (19* off 9 balls) and Obus Pienaar (13* off 9 balls) took them to the highest total of the season.

American wicketkeeper-batter Andries Gous also contributed with the bat, scoring 21 off 14 balls as the San Francisco bowling attack that included Pat Cummins couldn't stop the run-flow.

For the Unicorns, Cummins was the pick of the bowlers with 2 wickets for 35 runs, but the rest of the bowling unit conceded upwards of 40 runs in their spells to concede the highest total of the MLC 2024. Here is a look at the award winners and stats from the final and the tournament:

Runners Up: San Francisco Unicorns

Leading Run-Scorer Award: Faf Du Plessis (Texas Super Kings)

MVP of MLC 2024: Travis Head (Washington Freedom)

MLC 2024 Stats & Records
summary:
**Champions:** Washington Freedom won the MLC 2024 title by defeating San Francisco Unicorns in the final by 96 runs.

**Final Match:** Steve Smith led from the front, scoring 88 off 52 balls, helping Washington Freedom post 207/5 in 20 overs. San Francisco Unicorns were bowled out for 111 in 16 overs, with Marco Jansen and Rachin Ravindra picking three wickets each.

**Awards and Recognition:** The award winners include Steve Smith (MVP Award for Final), Mukhtar Ahmed (Power Hitter), Josh Inglis (Play of the Day), Hassan Khan (Domestic Player of the Tournament), Saurabh Netravalkar (Leading Wicket-Taker Award), Faf Du Plessis (Leading Run-Scorer Award), and Travis Head (MVP of MLC 2024).

title: WAS vs SF: Check our Dream 11 Prediction, Fantasy Cricket Tips, Playing Team Picks for Major League Cricket 2024, Final on July 29th
body:
The stage is well set for the second edition of the Major League Cricket grand finale as Washington Freedom will take on San Francisco Unicorns in Monday’s clash. It’s a rematch of the Qualifier where Washington Freedom easily outclassed San Francisco Unicorns by 7 wickets. San Francisco Unicorns made full use of the additional opportunity they got in the Challenger and beat Texas Super Kings by 10 runs to reach their first-ever final.

Match Details:

Washington Freedom vs San Francisco Unicorns, Final

Venue: Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas

Date & Time: July 29th at 6:00 AM IST and July 28th at 7:30 PM Local Time

Live Streaming: Sony Sports Network and JioCinema

What is the Pitch Report for WAS vs SF, Major League Cricket 2024, Final?

The surface has genuine bounce and carry where the batters can play the shots on the rise. It got better for batting during the Challenger between San Francisco Unicorns and Texas Super Kings where a total of 390 runs were scored. It’s not an easy venue to catch the ball during the night time and whoever fields well has more chances of winning the high-voltage clash.

Recent form:

Washington Freedom: Won, Lost, Won, Won, Won

San Francisco Unicorns: Won, Lost, Won, Won, Won

Washington Freedom are expected to win this match.

Travis Head, Steven Smith, Andries Gous (wk), Rachin Ravindra, Glenn Maxwell, Obus Pienaar, Mukhtar Ahmed, Marco Jansen, Lockie Ferguson / Andrew Tye, Saurabh Netravalkar, Ian Holland

Lockie Ferguson is doubtful for the final after suffering a hamstring injury in the Qualifier.

What are the Fantasy Cricket Top Picks, Players for WAS vs SF, Major League Cricket 2024, Final?

Top Pick – Batter

Words aren’t enough to describe, Travis Head’s current form at the moment as he became the first batter in the Major League Cricket to score 5 half-centuries on the trot. He is currently the second leading run-scorer in the tournament with 327 runs in 8 matches and needs another 94 runs to finish at the pole position.

Top Pick – All-Rounder

Glenn Maxwell recorded his first half-century of the tournament in the Qualifier against Unicorns where he struck an unbeaten 54* from just 23 balls. Overall, he made 113 runs and picked up 9 wickets.

Top Pick – Bowler

Saurabh Netravalkar has the uncanny knack of picking wickets and tops the leading wicket-takers chart in the tournament with 14 scalps in 6 matches he played.

Top Pick – Wicketkeeper

Josh Inglis looks in decent touch, having scores of 37, 8, 45, and 24* in his last 4 innings. He is likely to bat at No.4 for Unicorns.

X-Factor:

Rachin Ravindra bowled exceedingly well in the Qualifier against Unicorns, returning with the figures of 4 for 11 in only 2.4 overs he bowled. In 6 matches in the tournament, he scored 88 runs and picked up 9 wickets.

1. Josh Inglis, Andries Gous, Travis Head (c), Finn Allen, Jake Fraser McGurk, Glenn Maxwell, Hassan Khan (vc), Rachin Ravindra, Marco Jansen, Pat Cummins, Saurabh Netravalkar

2. Josh Inglis, Steven Smith, Travis Head, Finn Allen (c), Sherfane Rutherford, Sanjay Krishnamurthy, Glenn Maxwell (vc), Hassan Khan, Marco Jansen, Carmi le Roux, Saurabh Netravalkar

Pre-Match Analysis:

Washington Freedom drilled San Francisco Unicorns by 7 wickets in the Qualifier to reach the final for the first time. It took them only 15.3 overs to chase the modest 145, thanks to merciless hitting from Australia duo Travis Head (77*) and Glenn Maxwell (54*). Special credits to the bowlers who bowled in tandem, especially spinners Rachin Ravindra and Glenn Maxwell who rallied through the middle overs where the latter picked up 4 wickets while Marco Jansen who took the new cherry, claimed 3 scalps despite going 11.5 runs an over. They are a strong batting side with Travis Head firing at the top and with Glenn Maxwell back in form, they are hard to beat. The support from the bowlers is exceptional with Saurabh Netravalkar claiming 14 wickets, the most in the tournament. Lockie Ferguson walked off the field after tweaking his hamstring during the Qualifier contest and it’s a concern for the management if he doesn’t recover on time for the finals.

**Probable Playing XIs**: The probable playing XIs for both teams have been listed, with Travis Head, Steven Smith, and Glenn Maxwell featuring for Washington Freedom, and Finn Allen, Jake Fraser McGurk, and Josh Inglis featuring for San Francisco Unicorns.

**Injury Updates**: Lockie Ferguson is doubtful for the final due to a hamstring injury.

**Fantasy Cricket Tips**: Travis Head, Glenn Maxwell, Saurabh Netravalkar, and Josh Inglis are the top picks for fantasy cricket teams. Rachin Ravindra is an X-factor player to watch out for.

**Pre-Match Analysis**: Washington Freedom has been strong in their previous matches, with Travis Head and Glenn Maxwell in good form. San Francisco Unicorns, on the other hand, have struggled against Washington Freedom, losing to them by 7 wickets in the Qualifier.

title: Major League Cricket: Steve Smith, Glenn Maxwell Lead Washington Freedom To Championship After Stunning Victory In Final
body:
In a spectacular display of power hitting and strategic bowling, Washington Freedom clinched the Cognizant Major League Cricket 2024 trophy with a resounding 96-run victory over the San Francisco Unicorns in the Championship final at Grand Prairie Stadium on Sunday.

Washington Freedom set an imposing target of 208, led by stellar performances from Steve Smith and Glenn Maxwell. Smith's innings was a masterclass in controlled aggression, while Maxwell's explosive batting provided the necessary fireworks to propel the team to a formidable total.

The Unicorns, in response, were immediately put on the back foot. Jake Fraser-McGurk fell early, dismissed for just 3 runs in the third over. The situation worsened when Marco Jansen delivered a crucial blow by removing Finn Allen, who had been the hero in the qualifier with a century, for a mere 13 runs. With the scoreboard reading 30/3, the Unicorns found themselves in deep trouble.

The middle-order collapse continued as Sherfane Rutherford (4) and Josh Inglis (18) fell early, extinguishing any hopes of a miraculous chase. Andrew Tye, who was brought in for the final, picked up two pivotal wickets, further tightening the noose around the Unicorns. Rachin Ravindra then cleaned out the tail with an impressive spell, ending with figures of 3/23.

Earlier in the ultimate match of the tournament, the team from Washington lost Head (9) early. Then, Steve Smith (88) took centre stage, anchoring the innings with a masterful knock. He found support in Andries Gous (21), who added a steadying partnership before both Gous and Rachin Ravindra (11) fell without significant contributions. Undeterred, Smith unleashed a barrage of strokes, finding the boundary with ease.

Glenn Maxwell (40) joined Smith and the duo took the game away from the Unicorns with their aggressive batting. A memorable over saw Drysdale concede 28 runs as both Smith and Maxwell went berserk, setting the stage for a massive total.

Smith's departure, followed shortly by Maxwell's, brought Mukhtar Ahmed (19*) to the crease, who contributed a quick cameo with a couple of big hits, pushing the total past the 200-mark. The Freedom ended their innings at 208, a record total for a final.

Brief Scores: Washington Freedom (Steve Smith 88, Glenn Maxwell 40, Pat Cummins 2/35) beat San Francisco Unicorns (Carmi Le Roux 20, Josh Inglis 18, Marco Jansen 3/28) by 96 runs

TOURNAMENT AWARDS:

WINNERS: Washington Freedom

RUNNERS-UP: San Francisco Unicorns

STAKE MOST VALUABLE PLAYER OF THE TOURNAMENT: Travis Head (Washington Freedom)

ROYAL RICE LEADING RUN SCORER: Faf du Plessis (Texas Super Kings)

WILLOW BY CRICBUZZ LEADING WICKET TAKER: Saurabh Netravalkar (Washington Freedom)
summary:
**Tournament Winner:** Washington Freedom won the Cognizant Major League Cricket 2024 trophy by defeating San Francisco Unicorns in the Championship final by 96 runs.

**Final Match Summary:** Washington Freedom set a target of 208, thanks to stellar performances from Steve Smith (88) and Glenn Maxwell (40). The Unicorns were restricted to 112 runs, with San Francisco's top scorers being Carmi Le Roux (20) and Josh Inglis (18).

**Tournament Awards:** 
- Travis Head (Washington Freedom) was named the Stake Most Valuable Player of the Tournament.
- Faf du Plessis (Texas Super Kings) was the Royal Rice Leading Run Scorer.
- Saurabh Netravalkar (Washington Freedom) was the Willow by Cricbuzz Leading Wicket Taker.

title: Steve Smith Leads Washington Freedom To Maiden MLC Title as WAF Defeat SFU By 96 Runs In Final
body:
MLC 2024 Final: Washington Freedom (WAF) defeated San Francisco Unicorns (SFU) by a whopping margin of 96 runs to clinch the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 final on July 29 (as per the Indian standard time) at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.. Under the leadership of Steve Smith, Washington Freedom won their maiden MLC title. Captain Smith was the man who saved the day for Washington with help of Australian compatriot Glenn Maxwell after they faced an early trouble in the first innings of the match.l

San Francisco Unicorns' captain, Corey Anderson, won the toss and chose to bowl first, putting WAF into bat. The Freedom lost Travis Head early, but Steve Smith remained steady and delivered a game-changing innings.

ALSO ON ABP Live | Paris Olympics 2024, Day 2: Complete List Of Indian Athletes' Results

Smith's Game Changing Innings Leads WAF To Maiden MLC Trophy

The Washington Freedom's captain scored 88 runs off 52 balls, anchoring the innings from one end. He was well-supported by Glenn Maxwell, who added a brisk 40 off 22 balls. Thanks to their impactful performances, the Freedom set a formidable total of 207/5 in their 20 overs.

The San Francisco Unicorns relied on their opening pair, Finn Allen and Jake Fraser-McGurk, to chase down the massive target. However, the Freedom bowlers struck early and maintained pressure throughout the innings. Steve Smith used his bowlers strategically which led them to take wickets consistently , making the final a one-sided contest. In the end, the Unicorns were dismissed for just 111 runs in 16 overs, losing the MLC 2024 final by 96 runs.

Marco Jansen and Rachin Ravindra excelled with the ball for the Freedom, each claiming three wickets. Their crucial performances played a key role in dismantling the Unicorns' batting lineup.

Steve Smith Wins Man Of The Match Award

Steve Smith won the Man of the Match award for his match-winning innings of 88 runs. Smith comlimented Washington team's inclusive atmosphere and how everyone chipped in with efforts when they were needed.

"Nice to contribute, been a really good season. We have a really good bunch, had plenty of good times off the field. We just talked about trusting the process, just playing the game and not getting overawed by the moment. Really pleased for the boys. Some guys don't get a game but they are surely part of the squad, and we try to make them feel included. Everyone in this group has been outstanding. Everyone stood up at different times, our batting was pretty strong and Marco maybe didn't get to bat throughout the tournament. On the batting front, Travis was spectacular and he rightly won Player of the Tournament. With our bowling, I thought Netravalkar was outstanding and Lockie who missed today due to injury was outstanding as well. Everyone stood up for us."
summary:
**Match Result:** Washington Freedom (WAF) defeated San Francisco Unicorns (SFU) by 96 runs in the MLC 2024 final on July 29 at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

**Key Performances:**

* Steve Smith, WAF captain, scored 88 runs off 52 balls and led his team to victory, earning him the Man of the Match award.
* Glenn Maxwell, WAF, scored 40 runs off 22 balls, supporting Smith's innings.
* Marco Jansen and Rachin Ravindra, WAF bowlers, each took three wickets to dismantle the Unicorns' batting lineup.

title: Smith, Maxwell star in Washington Freedom's emphatic title win
body:
Smith, Maxwell and Head lead the charge for Washington, who lost just one game in MLC 2024

Andrew McGlashan

29-Jul-2024 • 14 hrs ago

Washington Freedom 207 for 5 (Smith 88, Maxwell 40) beat San Francisco Unicorns 111 (Ravindra 3-23, Jansen 3-28) by 96 runs

Steven Smith led Washington Freedom to the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 title as they romped to an overwhelming 96-run victory against San Francisco Unicorns in Dallas. Smith and Australia team-mate Glenn Maxwell dominated with the bat then Unicorns' chase disintegrated with Marco Jansen claiming both openers among his three wickets.

The result cemented Freedom's standing as the team of the season having secured five wins in the group stage before progressing direct to the final with victory over Unicorns in the Qualifier. This contest turned their way through a stand of 83 off 39 balls between Smith and Maxwell as Freedom added 121 in the second half of their innings.

Smith, who was overlooked for Australia's T20 World Cup squad earlier this year, overcame a sluggish start in the powerplay to make 88 off 52 balls including six sixes. Having been 10 off 12 balls in the sixth over he sped to a 34-ball fifty and ended the season as the joint second-leading run-scorer, alongside Travis Head, with 336 at a strike-rate of 148.67.

Head, who has struck at over 170 during the tournament, fell early to Pat Cummins when he edged to slip, where Finn Allen held on at the second attempt, having been given a life in the opening over. But Andries Gous gave Freedom's innings impetus as Smith found his feet although when Haris Rauf removed Rachin Ravindra after the midway mark, it was an even contest at 86 for 3.

Then Smith and Maxwell, the latter having found form in the closing stages of the tournament, took charge included 28 coming off the 13th over from Juanoy Drysdale. Smith produced an outrageous scoop for six off Rauf and was in sight of a century when he got a top edge off Cummins.

It appears likely that Smith's T20I career is over following his World Cup omission and absence from the squad to face Scotland and England in September as the selectors look to the future, but it has been a profitable few weeks for him in the US.

Though Maxwell also fell in the next over, superbly caught by Josh Inglis, Freedom were still able to cross 200.

Unicorns' chase never got off the ground. Jake Fraser-McGurk's low-key tournament ended when he edged into the stumps against Jansen to leave him with 81 runs at 11.57 then both Sanjay Krishnamurthi and Allen also fell inside the powerplay to leave a daunting task. Sherfane Rutherford was superbly caught at deep backward square by Ian Holland the ball after being dropped and the rest of the batting fell away amid a huge asking rate.

Freedom's victory gave Ricky Ponting a title as coach a couple of weeks after leaving his role with Delhi Capitals.

Andrew McGlashan is a deputy editor at ESPNcricinfo
summary:
**Result:** Washington Freedom won the MLC 2024 title by defeating San Francisco Unicorns by 96 runs.

**Score:** Washington Freedom scored 207 for 5, with Steven Smith scoring 88 off 52 balls and Glenn Maxwell scoring 40. San Francisco Unicorns were bowled out for 111.

**Standout Performers:** Steven Smith was the joint second-leading run-scorer in the tournament with 336 runs at a strike rate of 148.67. Travis Head also had a strong tournament, striking at over 170. Marco Jansen took 3 wickets for 28 runs, while Rachin Ravindra took 3 wickets for 23 runs.

**Tournament Summary:** Washington Freedom dominated the tournament, losing only one game in the group stage and progressing directly to the final after winning the Qualifier against San Francisco Unicorns. They secured five wins in the group stage.

**Notable Mentions:** Ricky Ponting, the coach of Washington Freedom, won his first title in the MLC. Steven Smith's impressive performance comes after being overlooked for Australia's T20 World Cup squad earlier this year.

title: Smith superb as Washington waltz to MLC crown
body:
Steve Smith's love affair with the United States deepened as the star batter reminded national selectors of his T20 prowess in a Major League Cricket final that had a distinctly Australian flavour.

Pat Cummins was immense for his San Fransisco Unicorns, whose ties to Silicon Valley and the world of venture capital lured the Test captain to the franchise, but was trumped by a jaw-dropping hand from Smith (88 off 52 balls) at Dallas' Grand Prairie Stadium.

The decider of the MLC's second season was unmistakably American. A pre-game rendition of Star Spangled Banner played on electric guitar was followed by a drone light show as the 'half-time' entertainment.

Commentators donned cowboy hats in keeping with the Texas venue that hosted the T20 World Cup opener last month, while sixes struck into the 7,000-strong crowd were measured in feet.

But the myriad Australians involved – eight of the 22 finalists, head coaches Ricky Ponting (Washington) and Shane Watson (San Fransisco), as well as the bulk of their assistants – left their mark on the competition's pinnacle match contested by the Cricket Victoria-aligned Unicorns and the Cricket NSW-aligned Freedom.

Washington captain Smith, who owns an apartment in New York City, carted six sixes as he shared in a 83-run onslaught with Glenn Maxwell. Their union lasted 38 deliveries and essentially decided the match.

"He's been absolutely brilliant," Ponting said of Smith. "He's pretty much singlehandedly won that game with the bat.

"I spoke to him before the game this morning and said, 'Look, if you play well, you show your class, you can win this game by yourself'. He's been awesome - his on-field leadership has been great."

Cummins (2-35 from four overs) had dismissed Smith's opening partner Travis Head with the new ball, but was then curiously held back by captain Corey Anderson as Smith and Maxwell torched the Unicorns' less credentialled bowlers.

Maxwell hit four sixes en route to a 22-ball 40 but not even he could keep up with his long-time national teammate. He applauded when Smith, left out of Australia's T20 World Cup squad earlier this year, scooped Haris Rauf for the most daring of his six sixes.

By the time Cummins returned to dismiss Smith with a faster bouncer, and wicketkeeper Josh Inglis then leapt to take a stunning one-hander to account for Maxwell the following over, the damage had been done.

Washington's 5-207, the highest score of this MLC season, proved 96 too many for San Fransisco, skittled for 111 with Inglis' 18 surpassed only by tailender Carmi le Roux hitting 20 in junk time.

It was the culmination of an impressive season from the Smith and Ponting-led Washington side that lost just one match all season.

Their other opener, Head, was named tournament MVP after hitting five consecutive fifties leading into the final, finishing with 336 runs at a strike-rate of 173.

"Everyone stood up at different times," said Smith.

"Our batting was strong – I don't think Marco (Jansen, the South Africa allrounder) even got a bat throughout the tournament batting at number eight.

"Travis Head was outstanding, it was nice to bat up the other end from him. He makes things a lot easier for me."

Jake Fraser-McGurk's fizzling follow-up to his breakout Indian Premier League campaign was capped as the Unicorns opener was dismissed for three to become the first of three Powerplay victims to the Freedom's left-arm pace pair, Marco Jansen and Saurabh Netravalkar.

Wisconsin-born, Melbourne-raised Ian Holland had given Fraser-McGurk a life first ball when he fumbled a catch at point, but made up for his error when he took a tremendous diving outfield grab off Sherfane Rutherford amid a strong finish to the tournament for Maxwell (1-14).

Andrew Tye (2-12), a late inclusion after Kiwi speedster Lockie Ferguson missed due to injury, got revenge over Inglis check-driving him for six by bowling his Perth Scorchers teammate to all but confirm Washington's triumph.

Australia's influence on the competition is certain to stretch beyond this season; Victoria and NSW have made long-term commitments to their Unicorns and Freedom franchises, while Cummins holds a four-year deal with the Unicorns, opening the door for other leading Australian to potentially join him in signing multi-year deals.
summary:
* The MLC final was played between the Washington Freedom and the San Francisco Unicorns, with a distinctly Australian flavor, featuring eight Australians among the 22 finalists.
* Steve Smith led the Washington Freedom to victory, scoring 88 off 52 balls, including six sixes, and shared an 83-run partnership with Glenn Maxwell.
* The Freedom, led by Smith and coach Ricky Ponting, posted the highest score of the season, 207, which proved to be 96 runs too many for the Unicorns.
* Pat Cummins, playing for the Unicorns, took 2-35 from four overs, but was outshone by Smith's batting performance.
* Travis Head, the Freedom's opener, was named tournament MVP after hitting five consecutive fifties, finishing with 336 runs at a strike-rate of 173.
* The Australian influence on the competition is set to continue, with Victoria and NSW making long-term commitments to their franchises, and Cummins holding a four-year deal with the Unicorns.

title: Washington Freedom vs San Francisco Unicorns Highlights: Washington Freedom beat San Francisco Unicorns by 96 runs to win MLC title
body:
Right then, with Washington Freedom winning the coveted trophy of the second season of Major League Cricket, it brings an end to this action-filled cricket tournament. We enjoyed covering every bit of it and we hope that you too relished our coverage. We will be back next year with more excitement from MLC. However, cricketing action doesn’t stop around the world and you can tune in to our coverage of The Hundred Women at 7.30 pm IST (2 pm GMT) followed by The Hundred Men at 11.05 pm IST (5.35 pm GMT). The Olympics in Paris will also be the highlight in the sporting world for a couple of weeks where a lot of sports will be on display. That is it from our side, goodbye cheers and take care!

Steven Smith is up for a chat. He was also the Player of the Match for this game. He says that it was nice to contribute and that it has been a good season. Adds that it has been a good bunch of guys and they have enjoyed themselves off the field as well. Mentions that they talked about trusting the process and feels that the team did an exceptional job. Says that they try everyone to feel that they are a part of the squad and all players had each other's backs. Mentions that everyone stood up at different times of the tournament and credits the batters for being the strength of the team. Appreciated the bowlers as well to take on the pressure and perform well. He then moves on to collect the winning trophy.

Travis Head is the Player of the Tournament for his consistent performance, scoring 336 runs for his team consisting of five half-centuries.. He says that he is looking forward to the few weeks off after this and he feels delighted to clinch the title. Adds that a few afternoon naps helps him chill before the game and then think of what to do when you arrive for training and see what the bowlers are bowling. Mentions that he is enjoying his life in USA and he has had a brilliant time even off the field playing Golf. Says that he and Smith complement each other and it felt nice to have a familiar face on the other end.

The Bart King Award for the best domestic player of the tournament goes to Hassan Khan for his all-round performance. He says that it has been a wonderful tournament and he is happy to contribute to the team's cause. Adds that he is fortunate for him to perform well with the bat and spend some time out in the middle. Says that the strength he has while batting is natural and mentions that the management trusted his batting and allowed him to bat higher up the order. Feels that having Pat Cummins in their dressing room was a valuable experience and he learned a lot from him.

Corey Anderson, the captain of San Francisco Unicorns is up for a chat. He says they are extremely disappointed as they came here expecting to lift the trophy and failed to do so. Adds the Smith and Maxwell partnership took the game away from them and it is hard to stop those guys when they are on song and they failed to execute their plans. Mentions they came out confident while chasing this total but they lost wickets early and they faded very quickly in the pace and lost their way in the chase. Says he is proud of the side and the way the players have played throughout. Closes by saying that this competition is going from strength to strength and is on the way up as we see more and more International stars featuring here.

Earlier in the innings, we saw a very strong batting performance from Washington Freedom. Steven Smith had to do the heavy lifting for a major part of the innings but when partnered with Glenn Maxwell, the runs came in from both ends and took them to a strong position. A sudden boost by Mukhtar Ahmed at the end powered them past 200. In the bowling department, it was Pat Cummins with his two wickets who shone out. Carmi le Roux had an off day and went wicketless while the others got one each.

Andries Gous says it has been awesome and all players dream of lifting such a trophy. Mentions that this is such an amazing feeling to be crowned as champions. Thanks the fans for their support and the number in which they have come out to support them. Closes by saying that everybody wants to come to the USA and such a quality tournament will help their cause.

Rachin Ravindra from Washington Freedom is up for a short chat as well. He says he loved to play with so many international stars and the way the Aussie core planned and executed the skills shows why they are a champion side. Mentions that the boys had done the job early with both bat and ball and all he needed to do was pick up the last few at the end.

Ricky Ponting, the coach of Washington Freedom is up for a chat and says he arrived a bit late and left the training to the staff. Says that the backroom support was just tremendous. Mentions that Smith pretty much won the game single-handedly with the way he played and he executed what we had planned which was to play the natural way and not let the occasion get big on anyone. Mentions that the condition they have had has been fantastic and the way the sides have performed throughout the season has been brilliant as well.

We have some interviews lined up. Starting with Saurabh Netravalkar who says that he is grateful for this platform and sharing the dressing room with such stars is a nice feeling. Mentions that this could well be the backbone of domestic cricket for the USA and the crowd coming in is a good sign of things to come. Andrew Tye joins him and agrees with Netravalkar. He adds that it is a nice feeling to work with the unit and they learn a lot by picking their brains.

Washington Freedom started off extremely well with the early wicket of Marco Jansen. Saurabh Netravalkar soon followed up in his second over. Jansen got rid of the dangerous Finn Allen as well to put his team in a strong spot. Glenn Maxwell, Rachin Ravindra, and Andrew Tye worked in tandem to take 4 wickets in 3 overs. Jansen got rid of Hassan Khan and that left them with the bowlers to deal with. Rachin Ravindra did the cleaning up towards the end and sealed a win for them. Ravindra was the pick of the bowlers for his spell of 4-0-23-3 along with Marco Jansen with his spell of 4-1-28-3. Andrew Tye clinched two while Glenn Maxwell and Saurabh Netravalkar, who is the leading wicket-taker in this series ended his season with one to his name.

The San Francisco Unicorns had a shaky start. They didn’t look comfortable and Jake Fraser-McGurk succumbed first. Sanjay Krishnamurthy and Finn Allen couldn’t stitch a partnership and got sent back in a span of one over. Sherfane Rutherford, Josh Inglis, and Corey Anderson too couldn’t make any significant impact and played rash shots to throw their wicket away. Those three could only get 23 runs on the board. The Unicorns slipped from being 30/1 in 3.4 overs to 53/6 in 8.3 overs. That period was the one where the game slipped out completely from their hands. Cummins came in and played some lusty blows along with Hassan Khan but the curtains were already drawn for their side. It was then onto the bowlers who tried to free their arms before being cleaned up for 111 in 16 overs.

W

Overs15.6

Score111 - 10

Rachin Ravindra to Juanoy Drysdale, OUT! CASTLED! That was the final nail in the coffin for San Francisco Unicorns. Rachin Ravindra seals things off and Drysdale departs. Looped full, turning away. Juanoy Drysdale misses his drive yet again and the ball turns away from his blade to crash into the off pole. He has been very handy with the ball for Washington Freedom and has always been the go-to bowler for Steven Smith throughout the tournament.

W

Overs13.5

Score92 - 9

Rachin Ravindra to Haris Rauf, OUT! Goes down the track, misses and the keeper does the rest. Tossed up outside off, Haris Rauf dances down the track and looks to slog this but misses out completely. The ball is gathered by the keeper and Gous removes the bails with Rauf still wandering outside his crease.
summary:
**Tournament Winner:** Washington Freedom won the coveted trophy of the second season of Major League Cricket.

**Player of the Match:** Steven Smith was named the Player of the Match for his crucial contribution to Washington Freedom's win.

**Player of the Tournament:** Travis Head was awarded the Player of the Tournament for his consistent performance, scoring 336 runs with five half-centuries.

**Bart King Award:** Hassan Khan received the Bart King Award for being the best domestic player of the tournament.

**Washington Freedom's Performance:** Washington Freedom had a strong batting performance, with Steven Smith and Glenn Maxwell forming a crucial partnership. They eventually scored over 200 runs, with Mukhtar Ahmed providing a late surge. In bowling, Pat Cummins took two wickets, while others chipped in with one wicket each.

**San Francisco Unicorns' Performance:** San Francisco Unicorns had a poor batting performance, losing wickets early and often. They eventually fell short, being bowled out for 111 in 16 overs.

**Post-Match Reactions:** Various players and coaches shared their thoughts on the game, with Steven Smith praising his team's process and trust in each other. Travis Head looked forward to a break after the tournament, while Corey Anderson, the captain of San Francisco Unicorns, expressed disappointment at not lifting the trophy.

**Awards and Interviews:** The article includes interviews with several players and coaches, including Steven Smith, Travis Head, Hassan Khan, Corey Anderson, Andries Gous, Rachin Ravindra, Ricky Ponting, Saurabh Netravalkar, and Andrew Tye.

title: WAS vs SF, MLC 2024, Qualifier: Match Prediction, Dream11 Team, Fantasy Tips and Pitch Report | Washington Freedom vs San Francisco Unicorns
body:
Washington Freedom will face San Francisco Unicorns in the Qualifier of the ongoing Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024. The clash will take place at the Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas.

Washington have maintained the top spot in the league stages. Meanwhile, San Francisco are the only team who have beaten Washington in their last league match. Now both teams will lock horns to book a place in finals.

MLC 2024, Qualifier: WAS vs SF

Date and Time: July 25, 07:30 pm Local; July 26, 12:30 am GMT/ 06:00 am IST

Venue: Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas

Grand Prairie Stadium Pitch Report:

Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas provides an exciting contest between batters and bowlers. Fast bowlers take advantage of the new ball early on, making the initial overs particularly thrilling. As the innings progress, spinners shine by leveraging the pitch’s subtle characteristics to create spin. Despite this, batters benefit from the pitch, where well-executed shots are rewarded, allowing them to score runs more easily.

title: Fans erupt as Steve Smith, Rachin Ravindra guide Washington Freedom to maiden title with a win over San Francisco Unicorns in MLC 2024
body:
In a thrilling finale at Grand Prairie Stadium, Washington Freedom claimed the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 title with a commanding 96-run victory over the San Francisco Unicorns.

Steve Smith sizzles with the bat

Opting to bowl first after winning the toss, the Unicorns faced a daunting challenge from a powerful Washington batting lineup. Washington Freedom set a formidable target with a total of 207 for 5 in their 20 overs. Steve Smith was the star of the innings, scoring a scintillating 88 off 52 balls, including 7 fours and 6 sixes.

His partnership with Glenn Maxwell, who blasted 40 off 22 balls with 1 four and 4 sixes, provided the backbone of the innings. Contributions from Andries Gous (21 off 14), Mukhtar Ahmed (19 off 9), and Obus Pienaar (13 off 9) further bolstered the score. Pat Cummins was the pick of the bowlers for San Francisco, claiming 2 wickets for 35 runs, while Hassan Khan, Haris Rauf, and Juanoy Drysdale each took a wicket but proved expensive.

Rachin Ravindra wreaks havoc

Chasing 208, the San Francisco Unicorns faltered early and never recovered, bowled out for 111 in 16 overs. The Washington bowlers were relentless, with Marco Jansen and Rachin Ravindra taking 3 wickets apiece, conceding 28 and 23 runs respectively.

Andrew Tye provided crucial breakthroughs, claiming 2 wickets for just 12 runs in his 2 overs, while Maxwell also chipped in with a wicket. The Unicorns struggled to build partnerships, with only Carmi le Roux (20 off 19) and Josh Inglis (18 off 11) providing brief resistance.

Washington Freedom’s comprehensive win was a testament to their all-round performance, with significant contributions from both their batters and bowlers. This victory marks a remarkable season for Washington Freedom, crowning them the champions of MLC 2024.

**Key Performers:**

* Steve Smith scored 88 off 52 balls, including 7 fours and 6 sixes, to help Washington set a target of 207 for 5 in 20 overs.
* Glenn Maxwell contributed 40 off 22 balls with 1 four and 4 sixes.
* Rachin Ravindra took 3 wickets for 23 runs, while Marco Jansen also took 3 wickets for 28 runs, to help Washington bowlers restrict San Francisco to 111 in 16 overs.

**Match Summary:** Washington Freedom batted first and scored 207 for 5 in 20 overs, thanks to Steve Smith's scintillating innings. San Francisco Unicorns failed to chase the target, bowled out for 111 in 16 overs, with Rachin Ravindra and Marco Jansen taking three wickets each. Washington Freedom's all-round performance earned them the MLC 2024 championship.

title: MLC 2024: Washington Freedom won the Major League Cricket title, defeated Francisco in the final – AnyTV News
body:
MLC 2024 Final: Major League Cricket has got a new champion. The final match of this league was played between the teams of Washington Freedom and San Francisco Unicorns. Washington Freedom, captained by Steve Smith, won the final match in a one-sided manner and won the title. Freedom defeated San Francisco Unicorns by 96 runs in the title match. The heroes of Washington Freedom’s victory were captain Steve Smith and Marco Jansen.

Steve Smith’s captaincy innings

In the match played at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, Washington Freedom batted first. Travis Head did not perform well in the final match, but captain Steve Smith batted brilliantly. Due to which Washington Freedom, batting first, scored 207 runs for 5 wickets in 20 overs. Steve Smith scored 88 runs in just 52 balls, which included 6 sixes and 7 fours. During this, his strike rate was 169.23. Apart from this, Glenn Maxwell scored 40 runs in 22 balls. Smith, along with Glenn Maxwell, took the innings to 169 runs. Mukhtar Ahmed scored 19 runs in 9 balls and Obas Pienaar scored 13 runs in 9 balls to end the innings.

Freedom’s bowlers wreaked havoc

While chasing the target of 208 runs given by Washington Freedom, the team of San Francisco Unicorns collapsed cheaply. The entire team was all out for 111 runs in 16 overs. Carmy Lee Roux contributed the highest 20 runs for San Francisco Unicorns and returned not out. On the other hand, Marco Jansen took three wickets for 28 runs in four overs for Freedom. At the same time, Rachin Ravindra took three wickets for 23 runs in four overs. Andrew Tye took two wickets for 12 runs in two overs. While Saurabh Netravkar and Glenn Maxwell took one wicket each. Steve Smith was selected Player of the Match in the final for his brilliant and explosive innings.

Strong performance by Steve Smith and Travis Head

This season was very good for Steve Smith. With the 6 sixes he hit in the final of MLC 2024, Steve Smith’s total number of sixes in the tournament became 21. During this, he scored 336 runs in 9 innings and became the third most successful batsman of the league. On the other hand, Travis Head was chosen as the Player of the Tournament. Travis Head scored 336 runs in 9 matches at an average of 48 and during this his strike rate was 173.2.

title: WATCH: Juanoy Drysdale’s rocket beamer shocks Steve Smith during the MLC 2024 final
body:
In a thrilling climax to the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024, the Washington Freedom emerged triumphant, defeating the San Francisco Unicorns in a one-sided final. The match played at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, was marked by a dramatic moment when a beamer nearly caused chaos, but it was the Freedom’s overall dominance that sealed their fate as champions.

The victory capped off a remarkable campaign for the Freedom, who consistently showcased their prowess throughout the tournament. Their combination of star power, balanced squad, and clinical execution proved to be too much for their opponents.

The Washington Freedom cruised to a comprehensive 96-run victory over the San Francisco Unicorns in the tournament. The match was highlighted by a shocking incident involving Juanoy Drysdale and Steve Smith, but it was Washington’s overall dominance that stole the show.

Juanoy Drysdale’s beamer rocks Steve Smith

The 13th over of the San Francisco Unicorns’ innings witnessed a heart-stopping moment. Drysdale, aiming for a yorker to unsettle the well-set Smith, lost control of the delivery.

The ball rocketed towards Smith, who had shuffled across the crease in anticipation. Fortunately, Smith escaped serious injury as Josh Inglis, the wicketkeeper, could only manage a partial save.

The delivery, rightfully called a no-ball, served as a stark reminder of the dangers associated with beamers in cricket.

Here’s the video:

Washington Freedom batting: A masterclass by Smith

Washington Freedom set the tone for a convincing victory with a strong batting performance. The lynchpin of their innings was the ever-reliable Australian batter, who anchored the innings with a magnificent 88 runs. Smith’s knock was a display of class and composure, and he played a pivotal role in guiding his team to a formidable total.

Valuable contributions came from Glenn Maxwell, who chipped in with a brisk 40 runs. The rest of the Washington Freedom batting lineup played their part, ensuring a strong foundation for their bowlers to defend.

Also WATCH: Corey Anderson’s remarkable catch to dismiss Faf Du Plessis in MLC 2024

San Francisco Unicorns crumble under pressure

Chasing a mammoth target of 208 runs, the San Francisco Unicorns batting lineup faltered under the pressure. Their batters struggled to cope with the Washington Freedom bowling attack, which displayed exceptional discipline and accuracy.

The bowling trio of Rachin Ravindra, Marco Jansen, and Andrew Tye shared the spoils, each picking up three crucial wickets. The San Francisco Unicorns were eventually bundled out for a meagre 111 runs, falling short of the target by a massive 96 runs.
summary:
**Champions: Washington Freedom**

The Washington Freedom won the MLC 2024 tournament by defeating the San Francisco Unicorns in the final by 96 runs. The final was played at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

**Match Highlights:**

* The Freedom's Steve Smith scored 88 runs, anchoring the innings and guiding his team to a formidable total.
* Glenn Maxwell contributed 40 runs to the Freedom's strong batting performance.
* Juanoy Drysdale's beamer nearly caused chaos, but fortunately, Steve Smith escaped serious injury.
* The Freedom's bowling attack, comprising Rachin Ravindra, Marco Jansen, and Andrew Tye, shared the spoils, each picking up three crucial wickets.
* The Unicorns were eventually bundled out for 111 runs, falling short of the target by 96 runs.

Overall, the Washington Freedom's balanced squad, clinical execution, and star power led to their dominant victory in the tournament.

title: MLC 2024 [WATCH]: Mitchell Santner’s monstrous six against Ali Sheikh in the TSK vs SEO game
body:
In the final league match of the current Major League Cricket (MLC) season, Texas Super Kings (TSK) triumphed over Seattle Orcas (SEO) by 37 runs due to their exceptional bowling performance. A standout moment from the match was Mitchell Santner‘s massive six.

Mitchell Santner’s freakish six

The incident occurred during Ali Sheikh‘s second over, where he pitched an off-side delivery to Santner. Showing quick assessment and excellent timing, Santner read the line and length of the ball perfectly. With a confident and controlled bat swing, Santner executed a powerful shot that effortlessly cleared the boundary over the long-off and sailed into the stands. The shot showcased Santner’s batting prowess and demonstrated his ability to capitalize on scoring opportunities with precision and confidence.

Here is the video:

Also WATCH: Kieron Pollard’s heartfelt gesture after accidentally hitting a fan with his six in MLC 2024

Commanding victory for Texas Super Kings

Santner’s innings ended abruptly when Michael Bracewell outfoxed him in the subsequent over. Even after the fall of Santner, TSK were eventually successful in posting a fighting score with Calvin Savage played a blistering unbeaten knock of 45 off 27 balls which included 6 fours and 2 sixes helped the team to reach the total of 177/8 in their allotted 20 overs.

In response Orcas lost their first wicket early with Ryan Rickelton gone for a duck. Quinton de Kock and Shehan Jayasuriya tried to provide the stability to the team by adding 52 runs for the second wicket but soon they both got dismissed and middle order faltered after that. Keemo Paul tried to provide some resistence with the quick knock of 25 off 17 balls but failed to win the match for a side as the team could score only 140/9 in 20 overs. After securing a decisive victory against the Orcas, TSK advanced to the playoffs in third place and are now set to encounter MI New York in the eliminator at their home ground in Dallas.
summary:
* The Texas Super Kings (TSK) won their final league match against the Seattle Orcas (SEO) by 37 runs, securing a spot in the playoffs.
* Mitchell Santner played an exceptional shot, hitting a massive six off Ali Sheikh's delivery, showcasing his batting skills.
* Despite Santner's dismissal, TSK posted a competitive score of 177/8 in 20 overs, thanks to Calvin Savage's unbeaten 45 off 27 balls.
* SEO struggled in response, losing early wickets and eventually scoring only 140/9 in 20 overs, with Keemo Paul's 25 off 17 balls being the highest score.
* With this win, TSK advanced to the playoffs in third place and will face MI New York in the eliminator at their home ground in Dallas.

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Washington Freedom Crowned Champions
body:
Washington Freedom defeated San Francisco Unicorns by 96 runs in the finals of the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 at the Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium. Steve Smith and co. had a near-perfect campaign and had just 1 loss in their entire campaign.

Batting first, Washington Freedom put on a mammoth total of 207 runs in 20 overs and were in pole position throughout the game. Skipper Steve Smith was in his element and played a fabulous knock of 88 runs in just 52 deliveries. His innings was packed with 7 fours and 6 sixes and he had a good strike-rate of 169.23.

Glenn Maxwell played a cameo knock of 40 runs in 22 balls and made sure that his team gets powered to an imposing total at the Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium.

With the ball, Pat Cummins of San Francisco Unicorns bagged 2 wickets and his scalps included fellow Australian players Travis Head and Steve Smith.

Hassan Khan, Haris Rauf and Juanoy Drysdale bagged 1 wicket each in this epic and high-voltage finals.

San Francisco Unicorns’ batting department let them down

Chasing 208 runs in 120 balls, San Francisco Unicorns had lost the plot initially. They had lost 3 wickets in the powerplay and had dug a deep hole for themselves. It was impossible to bail themselves out from such a precarious situation and the writing was on the wall for San Francisco Unicorns.

Marco Jansen and Rachin Ravindra were fabulous with the white-cherry and they bagged 3 wickets each. Saurabh Netravalkar, who had a terrific tournament and finished as the highest wicket-taker, took 1 wicket in this game.

None of the batters of San Fransico Unicorns got going in the game and some big names in the form of Corey Anderson, Finn Allen, Sherfane Rutherford and Josh Inglis, failed to live up to their expectations.

Washington Freedom had lost to MI New York in the Eliminator of the previous edition of the Major League Cricket and have staged the perfect comeback to win the tournament.
summary:
**Tournament Result:** Washington Freedom won the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 tournament, defeating San Francisco Unicorns by 96 runs in the finals at the Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium.

**Finals Match Details:** Washington Freedom batted first and scored 207 runs in 20 overs, led by Steve Smith's 88 runs in 52 deliveries. San Francisco Unicorns struggled in response, losing 3 wickets in the powerplay, and eventually fell short.

**Notable Performances:** Steve Smith (Washington Freedom) scored 88 runs with a strike rate of 169.23, while Glenn Maxwell contributed 40 runs in 22 balls. For San Francisco Unicorns, Pat Cummins took 2 wickets, including those of Travis Head and Steve Smith. Marco Jansen and Rachin Ravindra took 3 wickets each for Washington Freedom.

**Background:** This is Washington Freedom's first MLC title, marking a comeback after losing to MI New York in the Eliminator of the previous edition.

title: Steve Smith Led Washington Freedom Lift The MLC Trophy
body:
MLC Final 2024: Steve Smith Led Washington Freedom Lift The MLC Trophy. Washington Freedom team won the title of champion in the Major League Cricket 2024 Tournament held in America. The Washington Freedom and San Francisco Unicorns faced each other in the final match at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on 29th July. Corey Anderson led San Francisco Unicorns won the toss and chose to bowl in the final.

Steve Smith gave a good start to the Washington Freedom team who started the innings accordingly. But the other opener Travis Head (9) was disappointed by giving away his wicket early. Andries Gous (21) got out soon after this. At this stage, Steve Smith and Glenn Maxwell, who came together, displayed a great batting performance. This Aussie duo emphasized the fast batting and crossed the team’s total of 150 by the time 15 overs were over.

Also Read: WTC 2023-25 Points Table Updated (India On Top) After England vs West Indies 3rd Test Match

The 35-year-old right-handed batter Steve Smith, who faced 52 balls, scored 88 runs with 6 huge sixes and 7 fours. Glenn Maxwell scored 40 runs in 22 balls by hitting 4 huge sixes. With the help of this great batting, the Washington Freedom team lost 5 wickets in 20 overs and collected 207 runs.

Marco Jansen gave the San Francisco Unicorns an early shock as they chased a tough target of 208 runs. Jake Fraser-McGurk (3) and Finn Allen (13) took wickets in the powerplay and brought early success.

After that, Josh Inglis scored 18 runs, while Hassan Khan scored 13 runs. The Aussies ODI skipper Pat Cummins got out after scoring 13 runs. The Washington Freedom bowlers organized a team attack and managed to bowl out the San Francisco Unicorns for 111 runs in 16 overs. Through this, the Washington Freedom team led by Steve Smith won the championship by 96 runs.

In the first season of the Major League Cricket tournament, Mumbai Indians franchise MI New York won the title. Also, the Seattle Orcas team was satisfied with the runner-up award. This time, Washington lifted the Freedom Trophy by defeating the San Francisco Unicorns.

Also Read: Major League Cricket (MLC) 2023 Final: MI New York Beat Seattle Orcas To Win Inaugural Title

Washington Freedom Playing XI: Travis Head, Steven Smith (captain), Andries Gauss (wicketkeeper), Rachin Ravindra, Glenn Maxwell, Mukhtar Ahmed, Obus Pinar, Marco Jansen, Ian Holland, Andrew Tye, Saurabh Netravalkar.
summary:
**Title:** Washington Freedom wins MLC 2024 championship under Steve Smith's leadership

**Final Match:** Washington Freedom defeated San Francisco Unicorns by 96 runs in the final match held at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on July 29.

**Match Summary:** Steve Smith led Washington Freedom to a total of 207 runs, with his own score of 88 runs, including 6 sixes and 7 fours, supported by Glenn Maxwell's 40 runs. San Francisco Unicorns, led by Corey Anderson, were bowled out for 111 runs in 16 overs, with Marco Jansen giving an early shock to the team.

**Washington Freedom Team:** The team, led by Steve Smith, included Travis Head, Andries Gous (wicketkeeper), Rachin Ravindra, Glenn Maxwell, Mukhtar Ahmed, Obus Pinar, Marco Jansen, Ian Holland, Andrew Tye, and Saurabh Netravalkar.

**MLC 2024 Championship:** This is Washington Freedom's first MLC championship title, while San Francisco Unicorns finished as runners-up. The team's victory marks a new champion in the Major League Cricket tournament, following MI New York's win in the inaugural season in 2023.
